recipe.name: Mashed potatoes (serves 2)
instructions: Pour 500 ml cold water into the blender jug. Peel, wash and halve the potatoes, put in the cooking pot, hang it in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, steam with the steamer button/15 minutes.

Remove the cooking pot, pour away the water from the blender jug, put the potatoes with the milk at room temperature and butter in the blender jug and with the measuring beaker in place, chop them for 6 seconds/speed setting 6.
Season with nutmeg, pepper and salt and stir in for 10 seconds/speed setting 2.

Serve the mashed potatoes hot.

VARIATIONS Season with a little freshly grated horseradish. Cook 175 g diced Hokkaido pumpkin with the potatoes. Stir 50 g freshly grated Parmesan into the mashed potato. Mix in freshly chopped herbs.

ingredients.name: 125 ml milk at room temperature (fresh whole milk 3.5 % fat)
nutmeg, pepper and salt to taste

steps.text: Weigh out 400 g small floury potatoes. Peel, wash and halve them, then put them in the cooking pot.
Pour 500 g water into the blender jug.
Put the cooking pot into the blender jug.
Remove the cooking pot and pour the water out of the blender jug.
Put the potatoes into the blender jug.
Add 125 g milk at room temperature.
Add 10 g butter.
Season with freshly grated nutmeg, salt and pepper, and serve hot.

recipe.name: Mashed potatoes (serves 6)
instructions: Pour 1 litre of cold water into the blender jug. Peel, wash and halve the potatoes, put in the deep and shallow steamer baskets, attach the steamer attachment to the blender jug, close the lid and steam with the steamer button/15 minutes.

Remove the steamer attachment, pour away the water from the blender jug, put the potatoes with the milk at room temperature and butter in the blender jug and with the measuring beaker in place, chop them for 8 seconds/speed setting 6.
Season with nutmeg, pepper and salt and stir in for 10 seconds/speed setting 2.
Serve the mashed potatoes hot.

VARIATIONS
Season with a little freshly grated horseradish.
Cook 525 g diced Hokkaido pumpkin with the potatoes.
Stir 150 g freshly grated Parmesan into the mashed potato.
Mix in freshly chopped herbs.

ingredients.name: 375 ml milk at room temperature (fresh whole milk 3.5 % fat)
nutmeg, pepper and salt to taste

steps.text: Weigh out 1200 g floury potatoes. Peel, wash and halve them.
Arrange them in the deep steamer basket and shallow steamer basket.
Pour 1000 g water into the blender jug.
Insert the shallow steamer basket into the deep steamer basket, then attach to the blender jug, with the lid closed.
Remove the entire steamer attachment and pour the water out of the blender jug.
Put the potatoes into the blender jug.
Add 375 g milk at room temperature.
Add 30 g butter.
Season with freshly grated nutmeg, salt and pepper, and serve hot.

recipe.name: Pancakes (makes 5)
instructions: Put all the ingredients except the butter in the blender jug and process with the measuring beaker in place for 35 seconds/speed setting 4 to make a smooth batter.
Allow it to rest for 10 minutes.
Heat some butter in a pan and add a portion of the batter measured by a ladle.
Fry the pancake on each side for about 2 minutes until golden.

Keep the finished pancake in a warm place and fry another 4 from the remaining batter.

TIP Pancakes are delicious with sweet and savoury fillings, and also simply with fruit, jam, ice-cream or sprinkled with a mixture of sugar and cinnamon.

ingredients.name: 400 ml milk at room temperature (fresh whole milk, 3.5 % fat)

steps.text: Pour 400 g milk at room temperature into the blender jug.
Add 2 eggs (large) and 1 pinch of salt.
Add 250 g flour.
Leave the batter to rest for 10 minutes.
Heat a little butter in a pan and add the batter in portions, measured out with a ladle. Fry the pancakes on each side for about 2 minutes until golden.
Keep the finished pancakes in a warm place and fry another 4 from the remaining batter.

recipe.name: Basic rice pudding recipe (serves 2)
instructions: Put the cold milk, sugar, 1 pinch of salt and the pudding rice in the blender jug, and the measuring beaker not inserted, simmer with the reverse button/30 minutes/speed setting 1/90 °C. Once the cooking time has elapsed, check if the rice pudding has the desired consistency and extend the cooking time if necessary.
Allow the pudding rice to soak in the blender jug (detached from the base) for 15 minutes. Then decant into dishes and enjoy whilst still warm, or chill in the refrigerator until served.

TIPS
To make rice pudding creamier, stir in some whipped cream. 
Serve with a sugar and cinnamon mixture, grated chocolate, jam, caramelised nuts and cracknel.
Rice pudding is a real feast for the eyes when layered in small jars with hot cherries.

ingredients.name: 400 ml cold milk (fresh whole milk 3.5 % fat)

steps.text: Pour 400 g cold milk into the blender jug.
Add 25 g sugar and 1 pinch of salt.
Put 80 g pudding rice into the blender jug.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Check if the rice pudding has the desired consistency and carry out the next step, if necessary; otherwise skip this step.
Allow the pudding rice to soak in the blender jug (detached from the base) for 15 minutes.
Then decant into dishes and enjoy whilst still warm, or chill in the refrigerator until served.

recipe.name: Basic rice pudding recipe (serves 4)
instructions: Put the cold milk, sugar, 1 pinch of salt and the pudding rice in the blender jug, and the measuring beaker not inserted, simmer with the reverse button/35 minutes/speed setting 1/90 °C. Once the cooking time has elapsed, check if the rice pudding has the desired consistency and extend the cooking time if necessary.
Allow the pudding rice to soak in the blender jug (detached from the base) for 15 minutes. Then decant into dishes and enjoy whilst still warm, or chill in the refrigerator until served.

TIPS
To make rice pudding creamier, stir in some whipped cream. 
Serve with a sugar and cinnamon mixture, grated chocolate, jam, caramelised nuts and cracknel.
Rice pudding is a real feast for the eyes when layered in small jars with hot cherries.

ingredients.name: 800 ml cold milk (fresh whole milk 3.5 % fat)

steps.text: Pour 800 g milk into the blender jug.
Add 50 g sugar and a pinch of salt.
Put 165 g pudding rice into the blender jug.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Check if the rice pudding has the desired consistency and carry out the next step, if necessary; otherwise skip this step.
Allow the pudding rice to soak in the blender jug (detached from the base) for 15 minutes.
Then decant into dishes and enjoy whilst still warm, or chill in the refrigerator until served.

recipe.name: Béchamel sauce (serves 2)
instructions: minutes/speed setting 2/90 °C.
Add the flour, and with the measuring beaker in place, blend for 20 seconds/speed setting 6.
Use the spatula to scrape up the mixture from the base of the blender jug.
Then, with the measuring beaker in place, boil for 8 minutes/speed setting 2/100 °C.
Add the milk at room temperature and, the measuring beaker not inserted, simmer for 10 minutes/speed setting 2/90 °C.
Season to taste with salt, pepper, nutmeg and lemon juice.

Scrape everything down the inside of the blender jug, and with the measuring beaker in place, blend for another 5 seconds/speed setting 5.

TIP Refine the béchamel sauce with saffron or replace some of the milk with stock, cream or dry white wine.

ingredients.name: 250 ml milk at room temperature (fresh whole milk 3.5% fat)
salt, pepper, nutmeg and lemon juice to taste

steps.text: Put 25 g cubed butter into the blender jug.
Add 25 g flour.
Use the spatula to loosen the mixture from the bottom of the jug.
Add 250 g cold milk.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Season to taste with salt, pepper, nutmeg and lemon juice.
Use the spatula to push the mixture down the inside of the blender jug.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.

recipe.name: Pumpkin soup (serves 4)
instructions: Peel and halve the onion and put into the blender jug with the peeled garlic cloves. With the measuring beaker in place, chop with the turbo button/6 seconds. Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.

Wash the pumpkin, remove the core and fibres, and cut into pieces approximately 3 cm long. (It is not necessary to peel Hokkaido pumpkins.) Add the pumpkin flesh to the onion and garlic in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 15 seconds/speed setting 5. Repeat the process if necessary.
Add the butter cut into pieces and use the spatula to scrape everything down the inside of the blender jug. The measuring beaker not inserted, stew with the roast button.
Add the sugar, ½ teaspoon of salt, ¼ teaspoon of pepper and 2 big pinches each of cinnamon and nutmeg.
Pour over the warm vegetable stock and, with the measuring beaker in place, cook for 20 minutes/speed setting 1/100 °C.

Add the cream at room temperature and, with the measuring beaker in place, blend for 1 minute/speed settings 3–8, increasing the speed gradually. Season the soup to taste again with lemon juice and, with the measuring beaker in place, stir for 20 seconds/speed setting 1.
Pour the soup into bowls and garnish with the whipped cream and a few drops of pumpkin seed oil.

VARIATION
To give the soup a taste of the Orient, replace the cream with coconut milk and add 1 teaspoon of curry powder to the spices in the soup.

ingredients.name: 200 ml cream at room temperature (30% fat)
a few drops of pumpkin seed oil

steps.text: Peel 1 onion (60 g) and 1 garlic clove, cut the onion in half and place both in the blender jug.
Hold the turbo button down for 6 seconds.
Use the spatula to scrape down the sides of the blender jug.
Wash 800 g Hokkaido pumpkin, remove the seeds and fibres, and cut into 3-cm chunks.
Put the pumpkin flesh into the blender jug.
Follow the next step if necessary; otherwise, skip it.
Add 50 g cubed butter to the blender jug. Use the spatula to scrape everything down.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Add 1 tsp brown sugar, ½ tsp salt, ¼ tsp pepper, 1 big pinch of cinnamon and 1 big pinch of nutmeg.
Add 750 g warm vegetable stock.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Add 200 g cream at room temperature.
Season the soup with lemon juice.
Ladle the soup into bowls and garnish with 4 tbsp whipped cream and a few drops of pumpkin seed oil.

recipe.name: Cream of courgette soup (serves 6)
instructions: Peel the onion and the garlic clove, put them into the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop finely with the turbo button/4 seconds. Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.

Wash, trim, halve and roughly dice the courgettes and put into the blender jug with the hot vegetable stock, 1 teaspoon of salt and 3 pinches of pepper. With the measuring beaker in place, cook for 15 minutes/speed setting 1/90 °C.
Add the butter and processed cheese and blend the vegetables, with the measuring beaker in place, for 1 minute/speed settings 3–8, increasing the speed gradually.
Season again with salt and pepper to taste and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 20 seconds/speed setting 2. Serve immediately.

TIP
You can use a finely grated hard cheese, for example Parmesan (32% fat), instead of the processed cheese.

steps.text: Peel 1 small onion (30 g) and 1 large garlic clove and put them into the blender jug.
Hold the turbo button down for 4 seconds.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Wash, trim, halve and roughly dice 3 courgettes (750 g) and put them into the blender jug.
Pour 750 g hot, strong vegetable stock into the blender jug.
Add 1 tsp salt and 3 pinches of pepper.
Add 2 tbsp butter and 3 tbsp processed cheese.
Season to taste with salt and pepper.

recipe.name: Boiling rice (serves 4)
instructions: Put the rice in the cooking pot, insert in the blender jug, sprinkle 1 teaspoon of salt on top and pour 2 litres of cold water into the blender jug above the rice.
With the measuring beaker in place, boil for 30 minutes/speed setting 1/100 °C.
Half way through, stir once with the spatula. Season the rice to taste with 1 teaspoon of butter.

TIP
Cooking time can vary depending on the type of rice.

steps.text: Insert the cooking pot into the blender jug.
Put 400 g parboiled rice into the cooking pot.
Sprinkle 1 tsp salt on top and pour 2000 g cold water into the blender jug over the rice.
Stir the rice once with the spatula.
Add salt and butter to taste.

recipe.name: Sunday rolls (makes 5)
instructions: Put 100 ml lukewarm water and the milk at room temperature in the blender jug. Crumble in the yeast and, with the measuring beaker in place, heat for 2 seconds/speed setting 1/37 °C.
Add the remaining ingredients and, with the measuring beaker in place, knead with the knead button/2 minutes.
Leaving the measuring beaker in place, allow the dough to prove for 30 minutes in the blender jug. It will double in volume.
Pre-heat the oven to 200 °C.
Then, with the measuring beaker in place, knead the dough using the reverse button/1 minute/speed setting 1.
On a floured surface, divide the dough into 5 portions, shape into rolls and put on a baking sheet (a perforated one is best). Score lengthways or crosswise and bake for 25 minutes.

TIP
You can also bake 1 baguette or 3 baguette rolls from the same quantity of dough.

ingredients.name: 50 ml milk at room temperature (fresh whole milk, 3.5% fat)
¼ cube of fresh yeast (10 g)
plain flour (type 405) for the work surface

steps.text: Take the butter out of the refrigerator.
Pour 100 g lukewarm water into the blender jug.
Add 50 g milk at room temperature.
Crumble ¼ cube fresh yeast (10 g) into the blender jug.
Put 1 tsp salt, 1 tsp honey and 1 tsp soft butter into the blender jug.
Add 250 g flour.
Leave the dough to prove for 30 minutes in the blender jug, with the measuring beaker in place. It will double in volume.
Pre-heat the oven to 200 °C (top and bottom heat).
On a floured surface, divide the dough into 5 portions, shape into rolls and put on a baking sheet (a perforated one is best).
Score lengthways or crosswise and bake for 25 minutes.

recipe.name: Spaghetti bolognese with Parmesan (serves 2)
instructions: Remove the rind from the Parmesan and cut into 2 cm pieces. Put in the blender jug, and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop finely with the turbo button/10 seconds. Decant into another container and rinse out the blender jug.

Peel the onion and garlic clove. Peel and wash the carrot. Clean and wash the celery and slice into pieces 4 cm long. With the measuring beaker in place, chop the vegetables in the blender jug for 10 seconds/speed setting 5. Use the spatula to scrape everything down the inside of the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for another 7 seconds/speed setting 5. Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug again, add 1 teaspoon of olive oil and, the measuring beaker not inserted, brown with the roast button/4 minutes/110 °C. Remove from the blender jug and set aside. Clean the blender jug.

Put the bacon into the blender jug, add 1 teaspoon of olive oil and, the measuring beaker not inserted, sauté with the roast button/4 minutes. Add the minced meat, and, the measuring beaker not inserted, brown with the roast button. Pour on 50 ml warm stock and, the measuring beaker not inserted, boil down with the roast button/10 minutes.

Put the sugar, tomato purée, the vegetable mixture, the chopped tomatoes and the remaining warm stock in the blender jug, season with paprika powder, cinnamon, 1 big pinch of pepper and thyme, and mix everything with the measuring beaker in place with the reverse button/30 seconds/speed setting 2. Then, the measuring beaker not inserted, boil everything down with the reverse button/30 minutes/speed setting 1/95 °C. Season to taste with salt and ½ teaspoon of pepper and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix in with reverse button/20 seconds/speed setting 2.
Cook the spaghetti according to packet instructions until al dente, and drain. Serve with the meat sauce and sprinkled with Parmesan.

TIP
If no children are eating with you, replace 50 ml stock with red wine.

ingredients.name: 200 g mixed beef and pork mince
150 ml warm vegetable or beef stock

steps.text: Remove the rind from 25 g Parmesan, cut into 2-cm cubes and put it into the blender jug.
Hold down the turbo button for 10 seconds.
Decant into a bowl and rinse out the blender jug.
Peel and halve ½ onion (30 g), then put it into the blender jug.
Peel 1 small garlic clove and add it to the blender jug.
Peel and halve ½ carrot (40 g) and add it to the blender jug.
Wash and trim 1 small stick of celery (40 g), cut into 4-cm pieces and add to the blender.
Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug.
Add 1 tsp olive oil.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Remove the vegetables from the blender jug and set aside.
Clean the blender jug.
Put 40 g diced streaky bacon into the blender jug.
Add 1 tsp olive oil.
Put 200 g minced meat into the blender jug.
Pour 50 g warm vegetable or beef stock into the blender jug.
Add ½ tsp sugar, 1½ tbsp tomato purée and the vegetables to the blender jug.
Add 200 g tinned chopped tomatoes.
Pour in 100 g warm vegetable or beef stock.
Add ½ tsp sweet paprika, a pinch of cinnamon, a big pinch of pepper and 1 tsp dried  thyme.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Cook the spaghetti according to packet instructions until al dente, and drain. Serve with the meat sauce and sprinkled with Parmesan.

recipe.name: Spaghetti bolognese with Parmesan (serves 4)
instructions: Remove the rind from the Parmesan and cut into 2 cm pieces. Put in the blender jug, and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop finely with the turbo button/10 seconds. Decant into another container and rinse out the blender jug.

Peel the onion and garlic clove and halve the onion. Peel, wash and halve the carrot. Clean and wash the celery and slice into pieces 4 cm long. With the measuring beaker in place, chop the vegetables in the blender jug for 10 seconds/speed setting 5. Scrape everything down the inside of the blender jug using the spatula and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for another 7 seconds/speed setting 5. Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug again, add 1 tablespoon of olive oil and, the measuring beaker not inserted, brown with the roast button/4 minutes.
Add 200 g minced meat, and, the measuring beaker not inserted, brown with the roast button. Remove everything from the blender jug and put aside. Clean the blender jug.

Cut the bacon into rough pieces and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop in the blender jug for 8 seconds/speed setting 9. Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug again, add 1 tablespoon of olive oil and, the measuring beaker not inserted, sauté with the roast button/3 minutes.

Add the remaining minced meat, and the measuring beaker not inserted, sauté with the roast button. Pour on 200 ml warm stock and, the measuring beaker not inserted, boil down with the roast button/10 minutes.

Put the sugar, tomato purée, the meat mixture, the chopped tomatoes and the remaining warm stock in the blender jug, season with paprika powder, cinnamon, ¼ teaspoon of pepper, and mix everything with the measuring beaker in place with the reverse button/30 seconds/speed setting 2. Then, the measuring beaker not inserted, boil everything down with the reverse button/30 minutes/speed setting 1/95 °C. Season to taste with salt and ½ teaspoon of pepper and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix in with reverse button/20 seconds/speed setting 2.
Cook the spaghetti according to packet instructions until al dente, and drain. Serve with the meat sauce and sprinkled with Parmesan.

TIP
If no children are eating with you, replace 100 ml stock with red wine.

ingredients.name: 400 g mixed beef and pork mince
300 ml warm vegetable or beef stock

steps.text: Remove the rind from 50 g Parmesan, cut it into 2-cm cubes and put it into the blender jug.
Hold down the turbo button for 10 seconds.
Decant into a bowl and rinse out the blender jug.
Peel and halve 1 onion (60 g) and put it into the blender jug.
Peel 1 garlic clove and add it to the blender jug.
Peel and halve 1 carrot (70 g) and add it to the blender jug.
Wash and trim 1½ sticks of celery (75 g), cut into 4-cm pieces and add to the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug.
Add 1 tbsp olive oil.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Add 200 g minced meat to the blender jug.
Transfer everything from the blender jug into a bowl.
Clean out the blender jug.
Cut 75 g streaky bacon into rough pieces and put it into the blender jug.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug.
Add 1 tbsp olive oil.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Add the rest of the minced meat (200 g) to the blender jug.
Pour in 200 g warm vegetable or beef stock.
Add 1 tsp sugar, 3 tbsp tomato purée and the vegetable and minced meat mixture to the blender jug.
Add 400 g tinned chopped tomatoes.
Pour in 100 g warm vegetable or beef stock.
Add 1 tsp sweet paprika, 1 pinch of cinnamon, ¼ tsp pepper and 1 tbsp dried thyme.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Cook the spaghetti according to packet instructions until al dente, and drain. Serve with the meat sauce and sprinkled with Parmesan.

recipe.name: Mushroom risotto with Parmesan (serves 2)
instructions: Wash the parsley, shake dry and remove the leaves from the stalks. Remove the rind from the Parmesan, cut into 2-cm dice and add to the parsley in the blender jug. With the measuring beaker in place, chop for 8 seconds/setting 8. Decant and put to one side.
Trim the mushrooms, cut in half depending on size, put them in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop with the turbo button/1 second. Then also decant.

Peel the shallot and garlic clove, put them into the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop with the turbo button/3 seconds. Use the spatula to scrape everything down the inside of the blender jug.
Add 2 tablespoons of butter and, the measuring beaker not inserted, sweat the shallot and garlic with the roast button/2 minutes/120 °C.
Add the risotto rice and, the measuring beaker not inserted, sweat with the other ingredients with the roast button/1 minute/120 °C.
Then deglaze with the hot stock and, the measuring beaker not inserted, cook with the reverse button/10 minutes/speed setting 1/95 °C.
Wash the thyme, shake dry and remove the leaves.
Put the mushrooms and thyme leaves into the blender jug, stir with the spatula and, with the measuring beaker in place, cook with the reverse button/8 minutes/speed setting 1/95 °C.
Season with the chilli powder and lemon juice.

Add the Parmesan and parsley mixture and the remaining butter, stir with the spatula and, measuring beaker not inserted, mix with the reverse button/30 seconds/speed setting 3, while stirring with the spatula.
Season with salt and pepper and stir in with the reverse button/20 seconds/speed setting 2. Serve immediately.

TIPS
If no children are sharing the meal, replace 100 ml of the stock with dry white wine.
Keep an eye on the risotto during the cooking process and, if necessary, help to stir using the spatula. A perfect risotto should be slightly al dente and have a creamy consistency. It should be neither too dry nor too wet.

ingredients.name: 200 g risotto rice (Arborio, cooking time: 15 minutes)
600 ml hot chicken or vegetable stock

steps.text: Wash 2 sprigs of parsley, shake them dry, tear off the leaves and put them into the blender jug.
Remove the rind from 45 g Parmesan, cut into rough 2-cm cubes and add to the blender jug.
Transfer the parsley and Parmesan mixture to a bowl and set it to one side.
Clean 125 g mixed mushrooms, cutting in half depending on size, and add to the blender jug.
Hold down the turbo button for 1 second.
Transfer the mushrooms to a bowl.
Peel 1 shallot (20 g) and 1 garlic clove and put them into the blender jug.
Hold the turbo button down for 3 seconds.
Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug.
Place a small bowl on top of the blender jug and weigh 30 g butter into it.
Put 1 tbsp of the butter into the blender jug.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Put 200 g risotto rice (Arborio) into the blender jug.
Pour 600 g hot chicken or vegetable stock into the blender jug.
Wash 3 sprigs of thyme, shake them dry, strip off the leaves and put them into the blender jug.
Add the mushrooms and stir with the spatula.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Season with 1 pinch of chilli powder and 1 tbsp lemon juice.
Transfer the Parmesan and parsley mixture and the rest of the butter to the blender jug and stir with the spatula.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
During the next step, stir with the spatula through the lid opening.
Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Serve immediately.

recipe.name: American pancakes (makes 20)
instructions: Put the butter in chunks into the blender jug and, the measuring beaker not inserted, melt for 2 minutes 30 seconds/speed setting 2/70 °C. Add the milk at room temperature, eggs, sugar, flour, baking powder and 1 pinch of salt, and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix everything for 30 seconds/speed setting 4.

To fry, heat ½ teaspoon of butter for each pancake. Pour 1 small ladle of batter into the frying pan and fry the pancake on a medium heat on both sides until golden. Remove and keep warm. Continue in the same way with the rest of the batter until it is used up.

VARIATION 
Wash and halve 400 g blueberries. When starting to fry the pancakes, arrange approximately 6 blueberries on each pancake and fry as described above.

ingredients.name: 600 ml milk at room temperature (fresh whole milk, 3.5% fat)
10 tsp butter for the frying pan

steps.text: Put 100 g butter into the blender jug.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Add 600 g milk at room temperature to the blender jug.
Add 4 eggs (large).
Add 100 g sugar.
Add 400 g flour.
Add 2 tsp baking powder and 2 pinches of salt.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
To fry, heat ½ tsp butter for each pancake.
Pour 1 small ladle of batter into the frying pan and fry the pancake on a medium heat on both sides until golden. Remove and keep warm.
Continue in the same way with the rest of the batter until it is used up.

recipe.name: Vegetable and potato mash (serves 2)
instructions: Peel and wash the potatoes and cut them into 2-cm chunks. Peel the vegetables and cut them into chunks of the same size. Insert the mixer attachment into the blender jug. Put the potatoes, vegetables, room-temperature milk and ¼ teaspoon of salt in the blender jug and, the measuring beaker not inserted, cook for 25 minutes/speed setting 1/100 °C. Put the cooking pot on the lid as a splash guard.

Remove the mixer attachment. Season the vegetables with nutmeg and add the butter. With the measuring beaker in place, process for 40 seconds/speed setting 4. Arrange the vegetable and potato mash on plates and serve warm.

TIP
If you are using vegetables with a high water content, such as courgettes, tomatoes or cucumbers, use only 150 ml milk. If your vegetables need longer to cook (e.g. carrots), cut them into thin slices or small pieces, or extend the cooking time by 3 minutes.

ingredients.name: 175 g vegetables (e.g. pumpkin, carrots, celeriac, peas, cauliflower or broccoli)
175 ml milk at room temperature (fresh whole milk, 3.5% fat)

steps.text: Insert the mixer attachment into the blender jug.
Weigh out 3 floury potatoes (325 g).
Peel the potatoes, cut into 2-cm chunks and put into the blender jug.
Weigh out 175 g vegetables (e.g. pumpkin, carrots, celeriac, peas, cauliflower or broccoli).
Peel the vegetables, cut into 2-cm chunks and add to the blender jug.
Add 175 g milk at room temperature and ¼ tsp salt.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Remove the mixer attachment.
Put 15 g butter in chunks and 1 pinch of nutmeg into the blender jug.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Arrange the vegetable and potato mash on plates and serve warm.

recipe.name: Vegetable and potato mash (serves 6)
instructions: Peel and wash the potatoes and cut them into 2-cm chunks. Peel the vegetables and cut them into chunks of the same size. Insert the mixer attachment into the blender jug. Put the potatoes, vegetables, room-temperature milk and 1 teaspoon of salt in the blender jug and, the measuring beaker not inserted, cook for 25 minutes/speed setting 1/100 °C. Put the cooking pot on the lid as a splash guard.

Remove the mixer attachment. Season the vegetables with nutmeg and add the butter. With the measuring beaker in place, process for 40 seconds/speed setting 4. Arrange the vegetable and potato mash on plates and serve warm.

TIP
If you are using vegetables with a high water content, such as courgettes, tomatoes or cucumbers, use only 450 ml milk. If your vegetables need longer to cook (e.g. carrots), cut them into thin slices or small pieces, or extend the cooking time by 3 minutes.

ingredients.name: 525 g vegetables (e.g. pumpkin, carrots, celeriac, peas, cauliflower or broccoli)
525 ml milk at room temperature (fresh whole milk, 3.5% fat)

steps.text: Insert the mixer attachment into the blender jug.
Weigh out 975 g floury potatoes.
Peel the potatoes, cut into 2-cm chunks and put into the blender jug.
Weigh out 525 g vegetables (e.g. pumpkin, carrots, celeriac, peas, cauliflower or broccoli).
Peel the vegetables, cut into 2-cm chunks and add to the blender jug.
Add 525 g milk and 1 tsp salt.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Remove the mixer attachment.
Put 45 g butter in chunks and 2 pinches of nutmeg into the blender jug.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Arrange the vegetable and potato mash on plates and serve warm.

recipe.name: Chilli con carne (serves 2)
instructions: Peel the onion and garlic clove, halve the onion, and put both ingredients in the blender jug. With the measuring beaker in place, chop for 8 seconds/speed setting 6. Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug. Add 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil and, the measuring beaker not inserted, brown with the roast button/3 minutes/120 °C. Add 200 g minced meat, and, the measuring beaker not inserted, brown with the roast button. Remove the meat and put to one side.

Put the chopped tomatoes and tomato purée in the blender jug and season with ½ teaspoon of salt, 1 pinch of pepper and the paprika powder. With the measuring beaker in place, cook everything with the reverse button/25 minutes/speed setting 1/100 °C.

Rinse the sweetcorn and kidney beans, drain and put in the blender jug. Add the cumin and Tabasco and, with the measuring beaker in place, simmer with the reverse button/15 minutes/speed setting 1/90 °C.
Before serving, season to taste with salt, pepper and Tabasco, depending on how hot you like it, and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix in with the reverse button/20 seconds/speed setting 1.

TIP
Serve with crispy baguette, nachos or pitta bread.

ingredients.name: 200 g mixed beef and pork mince

steps.text: Peel and halve 1 onion (70 g) and 1 garlic clove and put them into the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug.
Add 2 tbsp vegetable oil.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Add 200 g mixed minced meat.
Put 1 tbsp tomato purée, ½ tsp salt, 1 pinch of pepper and 1 tsp sweet paprika into the blender jug.
Add 250 g tinned chopped tomatoes.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Drain and rinse 50 g sweetcorn and add it to the blender jug.
Drain and rinse 100 g kidney beans and add them to the blender jug.
Add ½ level tsp ground cumin and 1 dash of Tabasco.
Before serving, season to taste with salt, pepper and Tabasco, depending on how hot you like it.

recipe.name: Chilli con carne (serves 4)
instructions: Peel the onions and garlic cloves, halve the onions, and put both ingredients in the blender jug. With the measuring beaker in place, chop for 8 seconds/speed setting 6. Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug. Add 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil and, the measuring beaker not inserted, brown with the roast button/3 minutes/120 °C. Add 200 g minced meat, and, the measuring beaker not inserted, brown with the roast button. Remove the meat and put to one side.
Add 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil and the remaining minced meat to the blender jug, and, the measuring beaker not inserted, brown with the roast button.

Put the reserved meat mixture, chopped tomatoes and tomato purée in the blender jug and season with 1 teaspoon of salt, 2 pinches of pepper and the paprika powder. With the measuring beaker in place, cook everything with the reverse button/25 minutes/speed setting 1/100 °C.

Rinse the sweetcorn and kidney beans, drain and put in the blender jug. Add the cumin and Tabasco and, with the measuring beaker in place, simmer with the reverse button/15 minutes/speed setting 1/90 °C.
Before serving, season to taste with salt, pepper and Tabasco, depending on how hot you like it, and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix in with the reverse button/20 seconds/speed setting 1.

TIP
Serve with crispy baguette, nachos or pitta bread.

ingredients.name: 400 g mixed beef and pork mince

steps.text: Peel and halve 2 onions (140 g) and 2 garlic cloves and put them into the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug.
Add 2 tbsp vegetable oil.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Add 200 g mixed minced meat.
Decant the minced meat into a bowl.
Put 2 tbsp vegetable oil into the blender jug.
Add 200 g minced meat.
Put the reserved onion and meat mixture into the blender jug.
Put 2 tbsp tomato purée, 1 tsp salt, 2 pinches of pepper and 2 tsp sweet paprika into the blender jug.
Add 500 g tinned chopped tomatoes.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Drain and rinse 100 g sweetcorn and add it to the blender jug.
Drain and rinse 200 g kidney beans and add them to the blender jug.
Add 1 level tsp ground cumin and 2 dashes of Tabasco.
Before serving, season to taste with salt, pepper and Tabasco, depending on how hot you like it.

recipe.name: Waffles (serves 8)
instructions: Put the soft butter in chunks, sugar and 2 pinches of salt in the blender jug, and whisk until creamy with the measuring beaker in place, for 15 seconds/speed setting 5. Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug.
Add the eggs and cold buttermilk and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 30 seconds/speed setting 5.

Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug again. Sieve the flour and baking powder over the top, and with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 1 minute/speed setting 4.
Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug again, and with the measuring beaker in place, create a viscous batter for 30 seconds/speed setting 4.
Pre-heat and grease a waffle iron.
Put 3 tablespoons of batter on each surface of the waffle iron and bake golden waffles in approx. 4 minutes each.

TIP
Waffles are delicious dusted with icing sugar or topped with jam, whipped cream or a scoop of vanilla ice cream.

ingredients.name: fat for greasing the waffle iron

steps.text: Put 170 g soft butter in chunks into the blender jug.
Add 170 g sugar and 2 pinches of salt.
Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug.
Add 4 eggs (medium) to the blender jug.
Add 400 g cold buttermilk.
Use the spatula to push the mixture down the inside of the blender jug again.
Sieve 400 g flour and 1 tsp baking powder over the top.
Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug again.
Pre-heat and grease a waffle iron. Put 3 tbsp batter on each surface and bake until golden according to the appliance settings.

recipe.name: Potato fritters (serves 6)
instructions: Peel, wash and halve the potatoes and put them into the blender jug. Peel and halve the onions and add to the potatoes.
Add the cornflour, 1½ teaspoons of salt and ½ teaspoon of pepper and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 15 seconds/speed setting 5.

Add the eggs, and with the measuring beaker in place, mix with the reverse button/20 seconds/speed setting 3. Season with salt and pepper and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix with the reverse button/10 seconds/speed setting 2.
Heat the oil in a non-stick frying pan, put 1 large tablespoon of the mixture and fry little potato fritters one by one.

TIP
Serve the potato fritters according to taste with apple sauce, cranberries or smoked salmon.

steps.text: Weigh out 1500 g floury potatoes. Peel, wash and halve them, then place in the blender jug.
Peel and halve 3 onions (150 g) and add them to the potatoes.
Add 30 g cornflour.
Add 1½ tsp salt and ½ tsp pepper.
Add 3 eggs (large).
Season again with salt and pepper.
Heat 7 tbsp oil in a non-stick frying pan, add 1 large tbsp of the mixture at a time, and fry the little potato fritters one by one.
Serve the potato fritters.

recipe.name: Cream of mushroom soup (serves 6)
instructions: Peel the potatoes, carrot and parsley root and cut into rough pieces.
Clean the mushrooms and dry as required with kitchen paper.
With the measuring beaker in place, chop the vegetables in the blender jug for 7 seconds/speed setting 5. Use the spatula to scrape the vegetables down the inside of the blender jug.
Pour on the vegetable stock at room temperature and, with the measuring beaker in place, cook everything for 20 minutes/speed setting 2/90 °C.

Pour in the cream at room temperature, season the soup with ½ teaspoon of salt and ¼ teaspoon of pepper and, with the measuring beaker in place, blend for 1 minute/speed settings 3–8, increasing the speed gradually.
Finally, season again to taste with salt and pepper and, with the measuring beaker in place, stir in for 20 seconds/speed setting 2.
Wash the parsley, shake it dry. Remove the leaves from the stalks and chop finely.
Divide the soup between deep bowls, garnish with parsley and serve immediately.

TIP
For a more substantial soup, replace the cooking cream with 200 ml cream (30% fat).

ingredients.name: 1100 ml vegetable stock at room temperature
150 ml cream at room temperature (18% fat)

steps.text: Peel and wash 3 medium-sized potatoes (220 g), cut into quarters and put into the blender jug.
Peel and wash 1 carrot (70 g) and 1 parsley root (70 g), cut into rough pieces and add.
Clean 450 g button mushrooms, dry as required with kitchen paper and add to the blender jug
Use the spatula to scrape the vegetables down the inside of the blender jug.
Pour 1100 g vegetable stock at room temperature into the blender jug.
Add 150 g cream.
Add ½ tsp salt and ¼ tsp pepper.
Season the soup with salt and pepper to taste.
Wash 3 sprigs of parsley, shake dry, strip the leaves and chop finely.
Divide the soup between deep bowls, garnish with parsley and serve immediately.

recipe.name: Broccoli salad (serves 2)
instructions: Wash, trim and pat the broccoli dry and divide into florets. Put 150 g broccoli florets into the blender jug.
Halve and trim the pepper, remove the stem and wash inside and out.
Add the pepper, pine nuts and remaining ingredients to the broccoli in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 5 seconds/speed setting 5.
If necessary, repeat the procedure, with the measuring beaker in place, for 3 seconds/speed setting 5.

TIP
You can also use 75 g each of broccoli and cauliflower florets and replace the pine nuts with sunflower seeds, walnuts or cashew nuts.

steps.text: Wash, trim and pat dry 300 g broccoli and divide into florets.
Put 150 g broccoli florets into the blender jug.
Weigh out ½ red pepper (75 g), then trim, wash and halve it and add it to the blender jug.
Add 25 g pine nuts.
Add 1 tbsp apple cider vinegar, 2 tbsp olive oil, 1 tsp maple syrup, 1 tsp mustard, ½ tsp salt and ¼ tsp pepper.
Repeat the process if necessary.

recipe.name: Apple cake (6 slices)
instructions: Pre-heat the oven to 180 °C. Grease the springform tin and sprinkle with a few breadcrumbs.
Peel and trim the apples and cut into eighths.
Put the eggs, sugar, baking powder, flour and cinnamon into the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 30 seconds/speed setting 6.
Pour the mixture into the prepared springform tin.

Arrange the pieces of apple evenly on the mixture and bake in the hot oven for 40 minutes. Carry out a skewer test using a wooden cocktail stick to check whether the cake is cooked, and bake for a little longer if necessary.
Remove the cake from the oven, let it cool down in the tin for a few minutes, gently release the side of the tin, open the tin and lift the cake out and leave to continue to cool.
Cut the cake into slices and serve.

ingredients.name: fat and breadcrumbs for the tin

steps.text: Preheat the oven to 180 °C (top and bottom heat).
Grease a springform tin and sprinkle with a few breadcrumbs.
Put 100 g flour into the blender jug.
Add 1 heaped tsp baking powder, 3 eggs (medium) and ¼ tsp cinnamon.
Add 160 g sugar.
Pour the mixture into the prepared springform tin.
Weigh out 3 small apples (330 g), peel and cut into eighths.
Arrange the apple pieces evenly over the dough and bake the cake in the preheated oven for 40 minutes.
Use a wooden cocktail stick to test the cake for doneness and bake a little longer if necessary.
Remove the cake from the oven and allow to cool in the springform tin for a few minutes.
Using a small knife, gently release the sides of the cake from the tin, open the springform, lift the cake out and continue to cool.
Cut the cake into slices and serve.

recipe.name: Apple and cinnamon porridge (serves 2)
instructions: VERSION WITH UNCOOKED APPLES
Put the almonds in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 3 seconds/speed setting 6. Then decant and reserve.

Wash the apple, peel if desired, cut into quarters and remove the cores. Then put them into the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop roughly for 3 seconds/speed setting 5. Then decant and reserve.
Put the oats, cold milk, cinnamon and ground vanilla in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, cook for 9 minutes/speed setting 2/95 °C.

Add the apples and honey to the porridge and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 20 seconds/speed setting 3.
Pour the porridge into bowls, sprinkle with almonds and serve hot or lukewarm.

VARIATION VERSION WITH COOKED APPLES Proceed as described above, but do not take out the pieces of apple, but simply cook them with the other ingredients.

ingredients.name: 225 ml cold milk (fresh whole milk, 3.5% fat)

steps.text: Put 15 g whole almonds into the blender jug.
Transfer the chopped almonds to a bowl.
Wash 1 apple (140 g), peel if desired, cut into quarters, core and place in the blender jug.
Transfer the chopped apples to the bowl.
Put 50 g porridge oats into the blender jug.
Add 225 g cold milk.
Add ¼ tsp cinnamon and 1 pinch of ground vanilla.
Add the apple and 1 tbsp honey to the porridge.
Pour the porridge into bowls, sprinkle with almonds and serve hot or lukewarm.

recipe.name: Apple and cinnamon porridge (serves 6)
instructions: VERSION WITH UNCOOKED APPLES
Put the almonds in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 4 seconds/speed setting 6. Then decant and reserve.

Wash the apples, peel if desired, cut into quarters and remove the cores. Then put them into the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop roughly for 4 seconds/speed setting 5. Then decant and reserve.
Put the oats, cold milk, cinnamon and ground vanilla in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, cook for 12 minutes/speed setting 2/95 °C.

Add the apples and honey to the porridge and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 20 seconds/speed setting 3.
Pour the porridge into bowls, sprinkle with almonds and serve hot or lukewarm.

VARIATION VERSION WITH COOKED APPLES Proceed as described above, but do not take out the pieces of apple, but simply cook them with the other ingredients.

ingredients.name: 675 ml cold milk (fresh whole milk, 3.5% fat)

steps.text: Place 45 g whole almonds in the blender jug.
Transfer the chopped almonds to a bowl.
Wash 3 apples (420 g), peel if desired, cut into quarters, core and place in the blender jug.
Transfer the chopped apples to the bowl.
Place 150 g porridge oats in the blender jug.
Add 675 g cold milk.
Add 1 tsp cinnamon and ¼ tsp ground vanilla.
Add the apples and 3 tbsp honey to the porridge.
Pour the porridge into bowls, sprinkle with almonds and serve hot or lukewarm.

recipe.name: Moist chocolate cake (6 slices)
instructions: Pre-heat the oven to 200 °C. Grease the springform tin.

Separate the eggs. Insert the mixing attachment and put the egg whites with 1 pinch of salt in the blender jug. Then, with the measuring beaker in place, beat for 4 minutes/speed setting 4 until stiff. Remove the mixer attachment, decant the beaten egg whites and place in the refrigerator.

Put the butter in chunks and the sugar and egg yolks in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, stir for 5 minutes/speed setting 3/70 °C. Add the chocolate broken into rough pieces to the blender jug and let everything rest for 5 minutes. Then, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 30 seconds/speed setting 4. Add the flour and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 35 seconds/speed setting 4. Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug and then continue to mix, with the measuring beaker in place, for 15 seconds/speed setting 4.
Attach the mixer attachment, add the beaten egg whites and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 18 seconds/speed setting 2.

Pour the mixture into a springform tin and bake for 20 minutes. Carry out a skewer test using a wooden cocktail stick to check whether the sponge is cooked, and bake for a little longer if necessary. Then remove from the oven, let it cool down in the tin for a few minutes, gently release the sides of the cake from the tin, release the catch on the tin and lift the cake out. Serve the chocolate cake either warm or cold.

TIPS
The cake is best if it is cooked through and is still slightly moist inside. So, do not bake it for too long.
Serve this chocolate cake with whipped cream and fresh berries.

steps.text: Pre-heat the oven to 200 °C (top and bottom heat).
Grease a springform tin (18 cm Ø).
Insert the mixer attachment into the blender jug.
Separate 3 eggs (medium) and add the egg whites to the blender jug. Set aside the yolks.
Add 1 pinch of salt to the blender jug.
Remove the mixer attachment.
Transfer the beaten egg whites to a bowl and put in the refrigerator.
Add 100 g butter in chunks to the blender jug.
Add 150 g sugar.
Add the egg yolks.
Add 180 g broken dark chocolate to the blender jug. Allow the mixture to rest for 5 minutes.
Add 45 g flour to the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug.
Insert the mixer attachment and add the beaten egg whites to the blender jug.
Pour the batter into the greased springform tin and bake for 20 minutes. Use a cocktail stick to check whether the sponge is done. Extend the baking time if necessary.
Remove from the oven. Let the cake cool down in the tin for a few minutes, gently release the sides from the tin, release the catch and lift the cake out.
Serve the chocolate cake either warm or cold.

recipe.name: Aioli (serves 8)
instructions: Peel the garlic cloves, put it in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop with the turbo button/2 seconds.

Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, add the eggs, lemon juice, mustard, 1 teaspoon of salt and ¼ teaspoon of pepper and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 10 seconds/speed setting 3.

Then, with the measuring beaker in place, set the appliance to 8 minutes/speed setting 4. Start the appliance and pour the sunflower oil slowly onto the lid of the blender jug so that it drips inwards along the measuring beaker insert. Slowly increase the quantity of oil. The aioli is ready when it has a fine, creamy consistency.

TIPS
You will get the best results if all the ingredients are at room temperature.
If you like a bite to your aioli, add up to 6 garlic cloves.
Aioli keeps in the refrigerator for approximately 3 days.

ingredients.name: 500 ml sunflower oil or mild olive oil at room temperature

steps.text: Peel 2 small garlic cloves and put them into the blender jug.
Hold down the turbo button for 2 seconds.
Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug.

Add 2 eggs (large) at room temperature, 
1 tbsp lemon juice, 1 tbsp mustard, 1 tsp salt and ¼ tsp pepper.

Place a container on the blender jug, weigh in 
500 g sunflower oil, then set to one side.
In the next step, pour the oil slowly onto the lid of the blender jug (measuring beaker in place) so that it drips in. Slowly increase the quantity.

recipe.name: Shortcrust pastry (makes 6)
instructions: Add the refrigerated butter in chunks, sugar, 1 pinch of salt, the refrigerated egg and flour to the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, knead with the knead button/1 minute into a smooth dough. If the mixture is too dry, add 1 tablespoon of cold water and knead, with the measuring beaker in place, for 20 seconds/speed setting 4.

Roll the dough into a ball and wrap in cling film. Allow to rest for at least 30 minutes in the refrigerator. Pre-heat the oven to the temperature specified in your recipe. Put a little butter in the tin and spread with a brush. If the pastry is pre-baked without pulses, the side of the tin should not be greased as the pastry will become soft on account of the high butter content and will slip down during baking.

Using a rolling pin, roll out the pastry into a thin layer between two layers of cling film. The size of the rolled-out pastry depends on the size of the tin you are using. If the edge of the tin is also to be lined with pastry, it should be rolled out to the size of the springform tin plus about 4 cm. Place the rolled-out pastry without cling film in the baking tin, and if necessary pull up an edge. Put the pastry into the oven immediately. If further steps need to be carried out according to the recipe, it is best to store the pastry in the tin in the refrigerator until needed.

If the shortcrust pastry base is baked with a rim and without a topping, it should be "baked blind" so that the edge of the pastry does not collapse during baking and so that no unsightly bubbles form on the base. To do this, cover the pastry with greaseproof paper and fill the tin to the top with pulses. For bases without edges or shortcrust pastry, which is only pre-baked, it is sufficient to prick the base several times with a fork.

Bake or pre-bake the pastry as indicated in the recipe. After baking, loosen the edge of the springform tin and allow the pastry to cool in the tin for 10 minutes. Only then remove entirely from the tin and allow to cool completely on a cake rack. Since shortcrust pastry crumbles easily, it should be handled very carefully.

VARIATION
To make a savoury shortcrust pastry, mix 150 g plain flour (type 405), 100 g cold butter, 50 ml cold water and ½ teaspoon of salt, with the measuring beaker in place, with the knead button/1 minute.

ingredients.name: soft butter and plain flour (type 405) for the tin
300 g pulses for baking blind, if necessary

steps.text: Put 80 g refrigerated butter in chunks into the blender jug.
Add 40 g sugar.
Add 1 pinch of salt.
Put 120 g flour into the blender jug.
If the mixture is too dry, add 1 tbsp cold water and carry out the following step.
Roll the dough into a ball, wrap it in cling film and leave to rest in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes.
Pre-heat the oven to the temperature specified in your recipe and follow the rest of the steps given for the prepared dough.

recipe.name: Mayonnaise (1 jar)
instructions: First ensure all the ingredients are at room temperature.
Put the egg, lemon juice, mustard, 2 pinches each of salt and pepper and 1 of sugar in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 10 seconds/speed setting 3.

Then, with the measuring beaker in place, set the appliance to 4 minutes/speed setting 4. Start the appliance and pour the sunflower oil slowly onto the lid of the blender jug so that it drips downwards along the measuring beaker insert. Slowly increase the quantity of oil. The mayonnaise should have a fine creamy consistency.

TIPS
If stored in the refrigerator, the mayonnaise will keep for approximately three days.
You can quickly make a delicious Marie Rose sauce from homemade mayonnaise and homemade ketchup. Put 250 g mayonnaise, 6 tbsp ketchup, 3 tbsp milk (UHT semi-skimmed milk 1.5% fat), 2 pinches each of salt and pepper, 1 pinch of sugar and 3 tsp brandy in the blender jug. With the measuring beaker in place, blend for 12 seconds/speed setting 3. Allow flavours to infuse for a few hours before eating. Goes very well with prawns, poultry and raclette.

steps.text: Ensure that all of the ingredients are at room temperature.
Sterilise 1 jar (300 ml).
Place a container on the blender jug, weigh 300 g sunflower oil into it and set to one side.
Put 1 egg (medium), 1 tsp lemon juice, 1 tsp mustard, 1 pinch of salt, 1 pinch of pepper and 1 pinch of sugar into the blender jug.
In the next step, pour the oil slowly onto the lid of the blender jug (with measuring beaker in place) so that it drips in. Slowly increase the quantity.

recipe.name: Tomato soup (serves 6)
instructions: Peel the onion and garlic cloves. Quarter the onion and put it with the garlic in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop roughly for 8 seconds/speed setting 6.

Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug, add the olive oil and the onion and garlic and, the measuring beaker not inserted, sauté with the roast button/4 minutes/100 °C. Add the tomato purée and 1 teaspoon of sugar and, the measuring beaker not inserted, sauté with the roast button/1 minute 30 seconds/100 °C.

Put the cherry tomatoes in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 10 seconds/speed setting 9. Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug again. Add the chopped tomatoes, vegetable stock powder and oregano and, with the measuring beaker in place, cook for 15 minutes/speed setting 1/90 °C. Then, with the measuring beaker in place, blend for 10 seconds/speed settings 5–9, increasing the speed gradually.

With the measuring beaker in place, bring the soup to the boil again for 2 minutes/speed setting 1/100 °C.  Season with 1½ teaspoons of salt and ½ teaspoon of pepper. If desired, add a little more sugar to taste and, with the measuring beaker in place, stir in for 20 seconds/speed setting 2. Wash the basil leaves, shake dry and cut into thin slices. Pour the soup into soup cups and serve with 1 teaspoon of crème fraîche and strips of basil on top of each one.

steps.text: Wash 15 fresh basil leaves, shake them dry, shred them finely and set them to one side.
Peel 1 large onion (100 g) and 2 garlic cloves, quarter the onion, and put both into the jug.
Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug.
Add 3 tbsp olive oil to the blender jug.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Add 3 tbsp tomato purée and 1½ tsp sugar.
Wash and dry 375 g cherry tomatoes and put them into the blender jug.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug.
Add 1200 g chopped tomatoes (from a tin) to the blender jug.
Add 3 tsp vegetable stock powder and 3 tsp dried oregano.
Season with 1½ tsp salt and ½ tsp pepper. If desired, add a little more sugar to taste.
Pour the soup into soup cups and serve with 1 tsp crème fraîche and strips of basil on top of each one.

recipe.name: Potato soup with parsley (serves 4)
instructions: Wash the parsley, shake dry and remove the leaves from the stalks. Chop the leaves finely with a knife and set aside.

Peel and halve the onion and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop them in the blender jug with the turbo button/6 seconds. Use the spatula to scrape the diced onion down the inside of the blender jug. Put the butter in chunks in the blender jug and, the measuring beaker not inserted, sauté the diced onion with the roast button/3 minutes.

Peel the potatoes, cut into quarters and put into the blender jug. Wash the leek, and peel the celeriac and carrot. Cut into large pieces and add to the potatoes. Pour in the vegetable stock, add the marjoram and, with the measuring beaker in place, boil for 30 minutes/speed setting 1/100 °C. Then with the measuring beaker in place, blend for 30 seconds/speed settings 4–6, increasing the speed gradually. Add the soured cream, ½ teaspoon of salt and 1 big pinch of pepper and, with the measuring beaker in place, cook for 3 minutes/speed setting 3/100 °C. Season the soup again and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 20 seconds/speed setting 1. Serve garnished with parsley.

TIP
At a party, serve the soup with various extras available in separate bowls for guests to add as they wish, e.g. croutons, small Vienna sausages, brown shrimp, leek rings, smoked salmon strips, cooked ham (diced), soured cream, fried mushrooms, various herbs and so on.

ingredients.name: 1 bunch soup greens (celeriac, carrots and leeks; 400 g trimmed weight)
800 ml vegetable stock at room temperature

steps.text: Peel, wash and quarter 500 g waxy potatoes, then set them to one side.
Weigh out 1 bunch of soup greens (400 g) and wash the leek.
Peel the celeriac and carrot, cut them into chunks and set all of the soup greens to one side.
Wash 3 sprigs of flat-leaf parsley, shake it dry, tear off the leaves and put them into the blender jug.
Peel and halve 1 onion (70 g) and put them into the blender jug.
Hold the turbo button down for 6 seconds.
Use the spatula to scrape the diced onion down the inside of the blender jug.
Add 1 tbsp butter to the blender jug.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Put the potatoes into the blender jug.
Add the prepared soup greens to the blender jug.
Add 800 g vegetable stock at room temperature and ½ tbsp freshly chopped marjoram.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Add 200 g soured cream, ½ tsp salt and 1 big pinch of pepper.
Season the soup again and serve garnished with parsley.

recipe.name: Meatballs with tomato sauce (serves 6)
instructions: Cut the bread roll or white bread into rough pieces, put in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop finely for 12 seconds/speed setting 10. Add the milk at room temperature, minced meat, eggs, mustard, 1½ teaspoons of salt, 1 teaspoon of pepper and the paprika powder and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix with the knead button.
Transfer the meat mixture to another container. With damp hands, make 18–22 equal-sized balls from the mixture and place in the deep steamer basket. Rinse out the blender jug.

Peel the shallots and garlic cloves. Halve the shallots and put the shallots and garlic in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop with the turbo button/2 seconds. Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug. Add the olive oil and, the measuring beaker not inserted, sweat with the roast button/5 minutes/120 °C.

Add the chopped tomatoes, warm vegetable stock, herbs and sugar. Attach the deep steamer basket, with its lid, and cook with the steamer button. Once the cooking time has elapsed, season again with salt and pepper and, with the measuring beaker in place, stir in for 10 seconds/speed setting 2. Serve with the meat balls.

TIP
Serve with baguette.

ingredients.name: 3 dry bread rolls or day-old white bread (90 g)
45 ml milk at room temperature (fresh whole milk, 3.5% fat)
450 g mixed beef and pork mince

steps.text: Cut 3 dry bread rolls or white bread (90 g) into coarse pieces and place in the blender jug.
Add 45 g milk at room temperature to the blender jug.
Add 2 eggs (medium), 1½ tsp mustard, 1½ tsp salt, 1 tsp pepper and 1½ tsp paprika.
Add 450 g mixed beef and pork mince.
With damp hands, form the mixture into 18–22 equal-sized balls and place them in the deep steamer basket.
Rinse out the blender jug.
Peel and halve 2 shallots (60 g) and 2 garlic cloves and put them in the blender jug.
Hold the turbo button down for 2 seconds.
Use the spatula to scrape down the sides of the blender jug; then add 3 tbsp olive oil.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Add 600 g tinned peeled tomatoes to the blender jug.
Add 450 g warm vegetable stock.
Add 1 tsp dried oregano, 1 tsp dried marjoram, 1 tsp dried thyme and 1½ tsp sugar.
Attach the deep steamer basket with the meatballs to the blender jug.
Season the sauce again with salt and pepper.
Serve the sauce with the meatballs.

recipe.name: Vanilla custard (serves 2)
instructions: Halve the vanilla pod lengthways, scrape out the pulp, then put pod and pulp and all the remaining ingredients into the blender jug. With the measuring beaker in place, thicken for 7 minutes/speed setting 3/100 °C.
Pour the mixture into a bowl that has been rinsed in cold water and remove the vanilla pod.
Serve lukewarm or cold.

TIP
Use glasses to serve and create alternate layers of crushed chocolate biscuits or brownies and custard. It looks fabulous and tastes delicious.

ingredients.name: 250 ml milk at room temperature (fresh whole milk, 3.5% fat)

steps.text: Halve ½ vanilla pod lengthways, scrape out the seeds, then put pod and seeds and 1 egg yolk (large) and 1 pinch of salt into the blender jug.
Add 250 g milk at room temperature.
Add 30 g sugar.
Add 20 g cornflour.
Pour the mixture into a bowl that has been rinsed in cold water and remove the vanilla pod. Serve lukewarm or cold.

recipe.name: Vanilla custard (serves 8)
instructions: Halve the vanilla pods lengthways, scrape out the pulp, then put pod and pulp and all the remaining ingredients into the blender jug. With the measuring beaker in place, thicken for 8 minutes/speed setting 3/100 °C.
Pour the mixture into a bowl that has been rinsed in cold water and remove the vanilla pod.
Serve lukewarm or cold.

TIP
Use glasses to serve and create alternate layers of crushed chocolate biscuits or brownies and custard. It looks fabulous and tastes delicious.

ingredients.name: 665 ml milk at room temperature (fresh whole milk, 3.5% fat)

steps.text: Halve 1½ vanilla pods vertically, scrape out the seeds, then put pod and seeds and 3 egg yolks (large) and 2 pinches of salt into the blender jug.
Add 665 g milk.
Add 80 g sugar.
Add 55 g cornflour.
Pour the mixture into a bowl that has been rinsed in cold water and remove the vanilla pod. Serve lukewarm or cold.

recipe.name: Creamy chicken fricassée with rice (serves 2)
instructions: Put the rice in the cooking pot, and the bay leaf in the blender jug. Place the cooking pot in the blender jug and pour the hot stock over it.
Rinse the chicken breast fillets under cold running water, pat dry and dice into cubes of 2.5 cm in length.

Season the meat all over with 2 pinches of pepper and 2 big pinches of salt, arrange in the deep steamer basket, attach the basket closed with its lid on, and steam with the steamer button/15 minutes. Put to one side closed with the lid still in place.
Remove the cooking pot from the blender jug and put to one side. Pour the stock out of the blender jug and reserve 100 ml. Remove the bay leaf.
Peel and halve the onion, and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop in the blender jug for 10 seconds/speed setting 5. Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Add the cold butter in chunks and, the measuring beaker not inserted, sauté with the roast button/5 minutes/110 °C..
Add the flour and reserved stock and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 20 seconds/speed setting 6.
Add the drained capers, cream and lemon juice and, with the measuring beaker in place, cook for 5 minutes/speed setting 2/100 °C. Season with pepper and salt to taste.

Put the meat in a serving dish and pour over the sauce. Serve with the rice.

TIP If you like, you can add pre-cooked pieces of asparagus, peas and button mushrooms to the fricassée.

ingredients.name: 1 l hot chicken or vegetable stock

steps.text: Drain 1 tsp capers of their brine and set to one side.
Wash 2 chicken breast fillets (each 170 g) under cold running water and pat them dry.
Dice the chicken breast fillets into 2.5 cm pieces.
Season the cubes of chicken all over with 2 pinches of pepper and 2 big pinches of salt, then arrange them in the deep steamer basket.
Put 1 bay leaf into the blender jug.
Insert the cooking pot into the blender jug.
Put 125 g long-grain rice into the cooking pot.
Pour 1000 g hot chicken or vegetable stock over the rice in the blender jug.
Attach the deep steamer basket to the blender jug and close the lid.
Remove the deep steamer basket and put it to one side, with the lid still in place.
Remove the cooking pot containing the rice from the blender jug, pour out the stock and reserve. Remove the bay leaf.
Place a container on the blender jug and weigh 100 g of the reserved stock into it, then set aside.
Peel and halve 1 small onion (50 g) and put it into the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Put 20 g cubed cold butter into the blender jug.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Add 20 g flour to the blender jug.
Pour in the reserved stock (100 g).
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Add 1 tsp drained capers and 1 tsp lemon juice to the blender jug.
Add 115 g cream.
Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Put the meat in a serving dish and pour over the sauce. Serve with the rice.

recipe.name: Brioche rolls (makes 8)
instructions: Put 60 ml milk at room temperature and the sugar into the blender jug. Crumble the yeast into it and, with the measuring beaker in place, heat for 3 minutes/speed setting 1/37 °C. Add the butter in chunks, the eggs, flour and 1 pinch of salt and, with the measuring beaker in place, knead with the knead button/1 minute to make a smooth dough.

Put the dough on a floured work surface, dust with flour and knead. Work in as much flour as required to ensure the dough is not sticky. Then put in a bowl, cover with a tea towel and allow to rise for 1 hour.

Line a 8-cup muffin tin and pre-heat the oven to 180 °C. Take the dough out of the bowl, knead through again and divide into 8 portions making 1 large and 1 small ball from each portion. Place the large balls of dough in the muffin wells. Then, using your fingers, press a hollow into every ball and place the small ball into each hollow.
Beat the egg yolk and the remaining milk and brush it over the brioches. Bake in the oven for 25 minutes. If the brioche rolls look a little pale, extend the baking time if necessary.

ingredients.name: 65 ml milk at room temperature (fresh whole milk, 3.5% fat)
plain flour (type 405) for the work surface

steps.text: Take the butter out of the refrigerator.
Pour 60 g milk into the blender jug.
Add 45 g sugar.
Crumble in 15 g fresh yeast.
Add 140 g butter.
Add 3 eggs (medium) and 1 pinch of salt.
Sieve 250 g flour into the blender jug.
Put the dough on a floured work surface, dust with flour and knead. Work in as much flour as required until the dough no longer sticks to the surface.
Then put in a bowl, cover with a tea towel and allow to rise for 1 hour.
Line a 8-cup muffin tin and pre-heat the oven to 180 °C (top and bottom heat).
Take the dough out of the bowl, knead through again and divide into 8 portions making 1 large and 1 small ball from each portion.
Place the large balls of dough in the muffin cases. Then, using your fingers, press a hollow into every ball and place the small ball into each hollow.
Place a container on top of the blender jug and weigh in 5 g lukewarm milk.
Add 1 egg yolk, stir in and brush the brioches with this mixture.
Bake at 180 °C for 25 minutes. If the brioche rolls look a little pale, extend the baking time if necessary.

recipe.name: Spaghetti with creamy salmon (serves 2)
instructions: Wash the salmon fillets under running water, pat dry and cut into 1-cm-wide strips.

Wash and clean the courgette and cut in half length-ways. Then cut the courgette in half lengthways again, cut into 4-cm pieces and put in the blender jug. With the measuring beaker in place, chop for 7 seconds/speed setting 6. Use the spatula to scrape the courgette down the inside the blender jug and repeat this step, if necessary.

Add the cream, hot vegetable stock, flour and dill, and, with the measuring beaker in place, stir with the reverse button/30 seconds/speed setting 3. Then, the measuring beaker not inserted, boil down with the reverse button/8 minutes/speed setting 1/120 °C.
In the meantime, cook the spaghetti according to packet instructions in salted water until al dente. Then drain and keep warm.
Rinse the lime in hot water, zest it until you have ¼ a teaspoon and squeeze out the juice.

Put the salmon, zest and 1 tablespoon of lime juice into the blender jug and season with ¼ teaspoon of salt and 1 big pinch of pepper and, the measuring beaker not inserted, cook with the reverse button/4 minutes/speed setting 1/80 °C. Then switch off the machine and let it steep for 5 minutes, with the measuring beaker in place. Arrange on top of the spaghetti.

TIP
If you would like a creamier sauce, after boiling it down, stir 1-2 teaspoons of cornflour in 30 ml of cold water until smooth and pour into the blender jug. With the measuring beaker in place, bring the sauce to the boil again with the reverse button/2 minutes/speed setting 1/120 °C and then continue to follow the recipe.

ingredients.name: 125 g fresh salmon fillet without skin (alternatively, defrost frozen salmon)
1 tsp finely chopped dill (fresh or frozen)

steps.text: Wash and trim ½ courgette (100 g) and cut it in half lengthways.
Then cut the courgette in half lengthways again, cut into 4-cm pieces and put in the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape the courgette down the inside of the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Put 100 g cream at room temperature into the blender jug.
Pour in 125 g hot vegetable stock.
Add 1 tbsp flour and 1 tsp finely chopped dill.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Cook 200 g spaghetti according to packet instructions in salted water until al dente. Drain and keep warm.
Place a plate on top of the blender jug and weigh out 125 g fresh skinless salmon fillet.
Wash the salmon fillets under running water, pat dry and cut into 1-cm-wide strips. Put the salmon into the blender jug.

Rinse ½ unwaxed lime in hot water, grate 
¼ tsp zest, squeeze out the juice, and add 
1 tbsp juice and the zest to the blender jug.
Add ¼ tsp salt and 1 big pinch of pepper.
Switch off the machine and let it steep for 5 minutes, with the measuring beaker in place. Arrange on top of the spaghetti.

recipe.name: Spaghetti with creamy salmon (serves 6)
instructions: Wash the salmon fillets under running water, pat dry and cut into 1-cm-wide strips.

Wash and clean the courgette and cut in half length-ways. Then cut the courgette in half lengthways again, cut into 4-cm pieces and put in the blender jug. With the measuring beaker in place, chop for 7 seconds/speed setting 6. Use the spatula to scrape the courgette down the inside the blender jug and repeat this step, if necessary.

Add the cream, hot vegetable stock, flour and dill, and, with the measuring beaker in place, stir with the reverse button/30 seconds/speed setting 3. Then, the measuring beaker not inserted, boil down with the reverse button/15 minutes/speed setting 1/120 °C.

If the sauce is not yet creamy enough, mix 1 tablespoon cornflour with 30 ml cold water until smooth, pour the mixture into the blender jug, and, with the measuring beaker in place, bring the sauce back to a boil with the reverse button/2 minutes/setting 1/120 °C.
In the meantime, cook the spaghetti according to packet instructions in salted water until al dente. Then drain and keep warm.
Rinse the lime in hot water, zest it until you have 1 teaspoon and squeeze out the juice.

Put the salmon, zest and 3 tablespoons of lime juice into the blender jug and season with ½ teaspoon of salt and ¼ teaspoon of pepper and, the measuring beaker not inserted, cook with the reverse button/4 minutes/speed setting 1/80 °C. Then switch off the machine and let it steep for 5 minutes, with the measuring beaker in place. Arrange on top of the spaghetti.

ingredients.name: 375 g fresh salmon fillet without skin (alternatively, defrost frozen salmon)
3 tsp finely chopped dill (fresh or frozen)

steps.text: Wash and trim 1 large courgette (300 g) and cut it in half lengthways.
Then cut the courgette in half lengthways again, cut into 4-cm pieces and put in the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape the courgette down the inside of the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Put 270 g cream at room temperature into the blender jug.
Pour in 350 g hot vegetable stock.
Add 3 tbsp flour and 3 tsp finely chopped dill.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
If the sauce isn't thick enough, mix 1 tbsp cornflour with 30 g cold water until smooth and pour into the blender jug.
Insert the measuring beaker.
Cook 600 g spaghetti according to packet instructions in salted water until al dente. Drain and keep warm.
Place a plate on top of the blender jug and weigh out 375 g fresh skinless salmon fillet.
Wash the salmon fillets under cold running water, pat dry and cut into 1-cm-wide strips. Put the salmon into the blender jug.
Rinse 1½ unwaxed limes in hot water, grate 1 tsp zest, squeeze out the juice, and add 3 tbsp juice and the zest to the blender jug.
Add ½ tsp salt and ¼ tsp pepper.
Switch off the machine and let it steep for 5 minutes, with the measuring beaker in place. Arrange on top of the spaghetti.

recipe.name: Baguette (makes 2)
instructions: Brush a large bowl with oil.
Put 165 ml lukewarm water in the blender jug. Crumble the yeast into it and, with the measuring beaker in place, heat up for 2 minutes/speed setting 2/37 °C.
Add the flour and salt and, with the measuring beaker in place, knead with the knead button/2 minutes.
Decant the dough into the prepared bowl, cover with a clean cloth and allow to rest in a warm, evenly heated place, until it has doubled in volume. (This takes approximately 1 hour 30 minutes.)

Dust the work surface with flour. Divide the dough into 2 equally sized pieces and shape each into a flat square. Fold all the corners in towards the centre, do not knead, but just press, so that the air bubbles in the dough remain in the dough. Cover the pieces of dough with a damp cloth or foil and allow to prove for another 20 minutes. Repeat this step.

Shape the pieces of dough into baguettes and place on a sheet of greaseproof paper, pulling the paper up a little between the rolls so that they do not stick together when proving. Cover again and allow to prove for another 45 minutes.
In the meantime, put a dripping pan on the lowest shelf in the oven, place a second baking sheet on top and pre-heat the oven to 250 °C.
With a sharp knife, dampened with hot water, cut 3 diagonal slits in the upper surface of each baguette.

Pour 100 ml hot water into the dripping pan and place the loaves on their greaseproof paper on top of the baking sheet. Close the oven door immediately and bake the baguettes for 20 minutes until golden.
If the loaves are already a good colour before the prescribed baking time has elapsed, reduce the temperature to 230 °C.

Remove the baguettes and cool for 20 minutes before cutting.

TIP Slices of baguette freeze very well in freezer bags. Simply defrost at room temperature and toast in a toaster.

ingredients.name: plain flour (type 405) for the work surface

steps.text: Brush a large bowl with oil and set aside.
Put 165 g lukewarm water into the blender jug.
Crumble 5 g fresh yeast or ½ sachet dried yeast into the blender jug.
Put 250 g flour into the blender jug.
Add ¼ tsp salt.
Put the dough into the prepared bowl, cover with a clean cloth and rest in a warm, evenly heated place, until doubled in volume (90 minutes).
Dust a work surface with flour. Divide the dough into 2 equal-sized pieces and shape each into a flat square.
Fold each corner towards the centre. Do not knead, but just press the dough, so that the air bubbles in the dough remain.
Cover the pieces of dough with a damp cloth or foil and allow to prove for another 20 minutes. Repeat this step.
Shape the pieces of dough into baguettes, placing each on a sheet of greaseproof paper, pulling the paper up between them so that they do not stick together when proving.
Cover again and allow to prove for another 45 minutes. Use this time to follow the next steps.
Place a dripping pan on the lowest shelf in the oven, place a second baking sheet on top and pre-heat the oven to 250 °C (top and bottom heat).
With a sharp knife, dampened with hot water, cut three diagonal slits in the upper surface of each baguette.
Pour 100 ml hot water into the dripping pan and place the loaves on their greaseproof paper on the baking sheet above. Close the oven door immediately.
Bake the baguettes for 20 minutes until golden.
If the loaves are already a good colour before the prescribed baking time has elapsed, reduce the temperature to 230 °C.
Remove the baguettes and cool for 20 minutes before cutting.

recipe.name: Ratatouille (serves 2)
instructions: Clean and wash the courgette and aubergine and dice into 1.5 cm cubes.
Halve and trim the pepper, wash inside and out, remove the stalk and dice into 1.5 cm cubes.
Wash the tomato, remove the stalk and cut the flesh into quarters.
Peel the onion and garlic clove.

Wash the herbs and shake them dry. Remove the leaves from the stalks and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop them in the blender jug with the turbo button/3 seconds. Decant the herbs into another container and rinse out the blender jug.

Put the onion and garlic clove in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop with the turbo button/3 seconds. Use the spatula to scrape the pieces down the inside of the blender jug.
Add ½ tablespoon of olive oil and, the measuring beaker not inserted, sauté using the roast button/2 minutes. Decant the onion and garlic.
Put the courgette, pepper and ½ tablespoon of olive oil in the blender jug and, the measuring beaker not inserted, sauté with the roast button. Then decant and reserve.
Put another ½ tablespoon of olive oil, the aubergine and tomatoes in the blender jug and, the measuring beaker not inserted, cook with the roast button.
