Then add the courgette, pepper, onion, garlic, herbs, the remaining olive oil, ½ teaspoon of salt and 3 big pinches of pepper to the aubergine and tomatoes in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, cook everything with the reverse button/12 minutes/speed setting 1/100 °C. Once more, season to taste with salt and pepper and, with the measuring beaker in place, stir in with the reverse button/20 seconds/speed setting 1.

TIP This dish goes well with fried fish or rice.

steps.text: Wash 1 sprig of parsley, 2 sprigs of basil and 1 sprig of thyme, shake dry, tear off the leaves and put them into the blender jug.
Hold down the turbo button for 3 seconds.
Transfer the herbs to a bowl and rinse out the blender jug.
Peel ½ small onion (20 g) and 1 garlic clove and put both into the blender jug.
Hold down the turbo button for 3 seconds.
Use the spatula to scrape the pieces down the inside of the blender jug.
Put ½ tbsp olive oil into the blender jug.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Decant the onion and garlic into a bowl.
Clean and trim 1 courgette (125 g), dice into cubes of 1.5 cm and put into the blender jug.
Place a plate on top of the blender jug and weigh out ½ red pepper (100 g).
Halve, deseed and wash the pepper inside and out and remove the stalk. Dice into 1.5-cm pieces and add.
Add ½ tbsp olive oil.
Decant into a bowl.
Put ½ tbsp olive oil into the blender jug.
Clean and wash ½ small aubergine (125 g), cut into 1.5-cm dice and add it to the blender jug.
Wash 1 tomato (100 g), remove the stem ends, cut into quarters and add to the blender jug.
Put the courgette, pepper, onions, garlic, herbs, 1 tbsp oil, 1 tsp salt and 3 big pinches of pepper into the blender jug.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Season once more with salt and pepper to taste.

recipe.name: Ratatouille (serves 6)
instructions: Clean and wash the courgettes and aubergine and dice into 1.5 cm cubes.
Quarter and trim the peppers, wash inside and out, remove the stalk and dice into 1.5 cm cubes.
Wash the tomatoes, remove their stalks and cut the flesh into quarters.
Peel the onion and garlic cloves.

Wash the herbs and shake them dry. Remove the leaves from the stalks and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop them in the blender jug with the turbo button/5 seconds. Decant the herbs into another container and rinse out the blender jug.

Put the onion and garlic cloves in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop with the turbo button/5 seconds. Use the spatula to scrape the pieces down the inside of the blender jug.
Add 1 tablespoon of olive oil and, the measuring beaker not inserted, sauté using the roast button/2 minutes. Decant the onion and garlic.
Put the courgettes, peppers and 1½ tablespoons of olive oil in the blender jug and, the measuring beaker not inserted, sauté with the roast button. Then decant and reserve.
Put another 1½ tablespoons of olive oil, the aubergine and tomatoes in the blender jug and, the measuring beaker not inserted, cook with the roast button.

Then add the courgette, pepper, onion, garlic, herbs, the remaining olive oil, 1½ teaspoons of salt and ½ teaspoon of pepper to the aubergine and tomatoes in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, cook everything with the reverse button/15 minutes/speed setting 1/100 °C. Once more, season to taste with salt and pepper and, with the measuring beaker in place, stir in with the reverse button/20 seconds/speed setting 1.

TIP This dish goes well with fried fish or rice.

steps.text: Wash ½ bunch of parsley, ½ bunch of basil and 3 sprigs of thyme, shake dry, tear off the leaves and put them into the blender jug.
Hold down the turbo button for 5 seconds.
Transfer the herbs to a bowl and rinse out the blender jug.
Peel 1 onion (60 g) and 2 garlic cloves and put both into the blender jug.
Hold down the turbo button for 5 seconds.
Use the spatula to scrape the pieces down the inside of the blender jug.
Put 1 tbsp olive oil into the blender jug.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Decant the onion and garlic into a bowl.
Clean and trim 2 courgettes (375 g), dice into cubes of 1.5 cm and put into the blender jug.
Place a plate on top of the blender jug and weigh out 2 red peppers (300 g).
Quarter, deseed and wash the peppers inside and out and remove the stalk. Dice into 1.5-cm pieces and add.
Add 1½ tbsp olive oil.
Decant into a bowl.
Put 1½ tbsp olive oil into the blender jug.
Clean and wash 1 aubergine (375 g), cut into 1.5-cm dice and add it to the blender jug.
Wash 3 tomatoes (300 g), remove the stem ends, cut into quarters and add to the blender jug.
Put the courgette, pepper, onions, garlic cloves, herbs, 2½ tbsp oil, 1½ tsp salt and ½ tsp pepper into the blender jug.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Season once more with salt and pepper to taste.

recipe.name: Guacamole (serves 6)
instructions: Wash, quarter and deseed the tomatoes. Remove the stalks, put in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop roughly for 8 seconds/speed setting 5. Decant the chopped tomato into a bowl.

Peel the onion and the garlic cloves, halve the onion and chop both in the blender jug, with the measuring beaker in place, using the turbo button/7 seconds. Use the spatula to scrape everything down the inside of the blender jug.
Halve the avocado, remove the stone and scrape out the flesh. Juice the lime.
Add the avocado flesh, lime juice, harissa and 2 pinches each of salt and pepper and mix everything together, with the measuring beaker in place, for 8 seconds/speed setting 6.
Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug. Add the chopped tomato and mix using the reverse button/10 seconds/speed setting 2.
Season again with salt and pepper and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix in with the reverse button/10 seconds/speed setting 1.

TIP
If desired, add 1½ tablespoon of freshly chopped coriander and 1-2 teaspoons of crème fraîche (30% fat) to the guacamole.

steps.text: Wash, quarter and deseed 2 small tomatoes (150 g), remove the stem ends, and put them in the blender jug.
Transfer the chopped tomato to a bowl.
Peel and halve 1 onion (75 g) and put it into the blender jug.
Peel 1½ garlic cloves and add them to the blender jug.
Hold the turbo button down for 7 seconds.
Use the spatula to scrape everything down the inside of the blender jug.
Halve 2 avocados (450 g), remove the stone and spoon the flesh into the blender jug.
Add the juice of ½ lime (60 g), 1½ tsp harissa, 2 pinches of salt and 2 pinches of pepper.
Use the spatula to scrape everything down the inside of the blender jug.
Add the chopped tomato.
Decant the guacamole into a dish, season again with salt and pepper and serve.

recipe.name: Baked cauliflower cheese (serves 2)
instructions: Remove the rind from the Gruyère, cut into chunks of 2 cm length and put them in the blender jug. With the measuring beaker in place, chop for 15 seconds/speed setting 8. Decant and rinse out the blender jug.
Clean and wash the cauliflower and divide into florets.

Pour 1 litre of hot water into the blender jug, arrange the cauliflower florets in the shallow steamer basket, place it in the deep steamer basket, close and cook the cauliflower with the steamer button/8 minutes. Then remove the deep steamer basket and empty the blender jug.
Pre-heat the grill to 200 °C.
Put the butter in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, melt for 2 minutes/speed setting 2/100 °C.
Add the flour and, with the measuring beaker in place, cook for 2 minutes/speed setting 1/100 °C.

Stir the cornflour into the cream and pour into the blender jug adding the milk at room temperature, nutmeg, ¼ teaspoon of salt and 1 pinch of white pepper. Then, with the measuring beaker in place, cook for 5 minutes/speed setting 2/110 °C.
If the sauce is not sufficiently thick, with the measuring beaker in place, continue to cook the sauce for another 1 minute/speed setting 2/110 °C.

Add 35 g Gruyère and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix in for 10 seconds/speed setting 5. Finally, season the sauce again to taste with salt, pepper and nutmeg, and stir in the spices with the measuring beaker in place for 10 seconds/speed setting 2.
Arrange the cooked cauliflower florets in a baking dish, cover with the sauce and sprinkle the remaining Gruyère on top.

Bake in the hot oven for 10 minutes until golden brown.

TIPS To make the cauliflower cheese more savoury, add 200 g boiled ham, chicken breast or left-over roast meat to it. The cauliflower cheese goes well with Kassler cured pork and boiled potatoes.

ingredients.name: 50 ml cream at room temperature (30% fat)
200 ml milk at room temperature (fresh whole milk, 3.5% fat)

steps.text: Remove the rind from 100 g Gruyère, cut into chunks and put them in the blender jug.
Decant the cheese and rinse out the blender jug.
Trim and wash 1 cauliflower (500 g) and divide it into florets.
Pour 1000 g hot water into the blender jug.
Place the deep steamer basket and shallow steamer basket on the blender jug.
Arrange the cauliflower florets in the shallow steamer basket and close it.
Remove the deep steamer basket and empty the blender jug.
Pre-heat the grill to 200 °C.
Put 20 g cubed butter into the blender jug.
Add 25 g flour.
Put a cup on top of the blender jug and weigh 50 g cream at room temperature into it.
Add 5 g cornflour to the cream and stir it in until the mixture is smooth.
Add the mixture to the blender jug along with 1 pinch of nutmeg, ¼ tsp salt and 1 pinch of white pepper.
Add 200 g milk at room temperature.
If the sauce is not sufficiently thick, continue to cook the sauce for another 1 minute. Otherwise you can skip the next step.
Add 35 g Gruyère.
Season the sauce to taste once more.
Arrange the cooked cauliflower florets in a baking dish, cover with the sauce and sprinkle the remaining Gruyère on top.
Bake the gratin in the hot oven for 10 minutes until golden brown.

recipe.name: Baked cauliflower cheese (serves 6)
instructions: Remove the rind from the Gruyère, cut into chunks of 2 cm length and put them in the blender jug. With the measuring beaker in place, chop for 15 seconds/speed setting 8. Decant and rinse out the blender jug.
Clean and wash the cauliflower and divide into florets.

Pour 1 litre of hot water into the blender jug, arrange the cauliflower florets in the deep and shallow steamer baskets, close the steamer attachment and cook the cauliflower with the steamer button/8 minutes. Then remove the deep steamer basket and empty the blender jug.
Pre-heat the grill to 200 °C.
Put the butter in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, melt for 2 minutes/speed setting 2/100 °C.
Add the flour and, with the measuring beaker in place, cook for 2 minutes/speed setting 1/100 °C.

Stir the cornflour into the cream and pour into the blender jug adding the milk at room temperature, nutmeg, 1 teaspoon of salt and ½ teaspoon of white pepper. Then, with the measuring beaker in place, cook for 5 minutes/speed setting 2/110 °C.
If the sauce is not sufficiently thick, with the measuring beaker in place, continue to cook the sauce for another 1 minute/speed setting 2/110 °C.

Add 105 g Gruyère and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix in for 10 seconds/speed setting 5. Finally, season the sauce again to taste with salt, pepper and nutmeg, and stir in the spices with the measuring beaker in place for 10 seconds/speed setting 2.
Arrange the cooked cauliflower florets in a baking dish, cover with the sauce and sprinkle the remaining Gruyère on top.

Bake in the hot oven for 10 minutes until golden brown.

TIPS To make the cauliflower cheese more savoury, add 200 g boiled ham, chicken breast or left-over roast meat to it. The cauliflower cheese goes well with Kassler cured pork and boiled potatoes

ingredients.name: 150 ml cream at room temperature (30% fat)
600 ml milk at room temperature (fresh whole milk, 3.5% fat)

steps.text: Remove the rind from 300 g Gruyère, cut into chunks and put them in the blender jug.
Decant the cheese and rinse out the blender jug.
Trim and wash 2 cauliflowers (1500 g) and divide them into florets.
Pour 1000 g hot water into the blender jug.
Place the deep steamer basket on the blender jug.
Arrange the cauliflower florets in the deep steamer basket and close it.
Remove the deep steamer basket and empty the blender jug.
Pre-heat the grill to 200 °C.
Put 60 g cubed butter into the blender jug.
Add 75 g flour.
Put a cup on top of the blender jug and weigh 150 g cream into it.
Add 15 g cornflour to the cream and stir it in until the mixture is smooth.
Add the mixture to the blender jug along with 3 pinches of nutmeg, 1 tsp salt and ½ tsp white pepper.
Add 600 g milk at room temperature.
If the sauce is not sufficiently thick, continue to cook the sauce for another 2 minutes. Otherwise you can skip the next step.
Add 105 g Gruyère.
Season the sauce to taste once more.
Arrange the cooked cauliflower florets in a baking dish, cover with the sauce and sprinkle the remaining Gruyère on top.
Bake the gratin in the hot oven for 10 minutes until golden brown.

recipe.name: Tomato sauce (serves 2)
instructions: Peel the onion and garlic clove. Quarter the onion and put them with the garlic clove into the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 10 seconds/speed setting 6. Use the
spatula to scrape the pieces down the inside of the blender jug.
Add the olive oil and, the measuring beaker not inserted, sweat with the roast button/2 minutes/110 °C.
Wash the basil, shake dry, remove the leaves from the stalks and chop finely.

Put the basil, sieved tomatoes, sugar, dried herbs, ½ teaspoon of salt and ¼ teaspoon of pepper into the blender jug. The measuring beaker not inserted, cook with the reverse button/17 minutes/speed setting 3/100 °C. Put the cooking pot on the lid as a splash guard.
Season again to taste with salt and pepper and, with the measuring beaker in place, stir in with the reverse button/10 seconds/speed setting 3.

ingredients.name: 25 ml olive oil at room temperature

steps.text: Peel 1 onion (70 g) and 1 garlic clove.
Cut the onion into quarters and place in the blender jug with the garlic.
Use the spatula to scrape down the sides of the blender jug.
Add 25 g olive oil at room temperature.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Wash 3 sprigs of basil and shake dry. Pluck the leaves from the stems, chop finely and add to the blender jug.
Add ½ tsp sugar, ½ tsp oregano, ½ tsp marjoram, ½ tsp salt and ¼ tsp pepper.
Add 600 g sieved tomatoes (passata).
During the next step, put the cooking pot on the lid as a splash guard.
Season to taste with salt and pepper.

recipe.name: Tomato sauce (serves 4)
instructions: Peel the onions and garlic cloves. Quarter the onions and put them with the garlic cloves into the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 10 seconds/speed setting 6. Use the spatula to scrape the pieces down the inside of the blender jug.
Add the olive oil and, the measuring beaker not inserted, sweat with the roast button/2 minutes.
Wash the basil, shake dry, remove the leaves from the stalks and chop finely.

Put the basil, sieved tomatoes, sugar, dried herbs, 1 teaspoon of salt and ½ teaspoon of pepper into the blender jug. The measuring beaker not inserted, cook with the reverse button/17 minutes/speed setting 3/100 °C. Put the cooking pot on the lid as a splash guard.
Season again to taste with salt and pepper and, with the measuring beaker in place, stir in with the reverse button/10 seconds/speed setting 3.

TIPS
This sauce is useful to have in store when making pizza and pasta dishes. In this case, pour while still hot into suitable, sterile containers. 
Once the sauce is cold, it freezes well.

ingredients.name: 50 ml olive oil at room temperature

steps.text: Peel 2 onions (150 g) and 2 garlic cloves.
Cut the onions into quarters and place in the blender jug with the garlic.
Use the spatula to scrape down the sides of the blender jug.
Add 50 g olive oil at room temperature.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Wash ¼ bunch of basil and shake dry. Pluck the leaves from the stems, chop finely and add to the blender jug.
Add 1 tsp sugar, 1 tsp oregano, 1 tsp marjoram, 1 tsp salt and ½ tsp pepper.
Add 1200 g sieved tomatoes (passata).
During the next step, put the cooking pot on the lid as a splash guard.
Season to taste with salt and pepper.

recipe.name: Gyro soup (serves 2)
instructions: Peel the onion and garlic clove. Halve the onion, and put the onion halves and the garlic and place in the blender jug. With the measuring beaker in place, chop for 8 seconds/speed setting 6.

Trim the pepper and mushrooms, wash the pepper inside and out, cut into quarters. Add pepper and mushrooms to the blender jug. With the measuring beaker in place, chop for 6 seconds/speed setting 5.  Decant the vegetable mixture.
Pour the oil into the blender jug and, the measuring beaker not inserted, sauté the meat with the roast button.

Add the vegetables, sieved tomatoes, warm vegetable stock, feta in rough-size pieces, ¼ teaspoon of salt and 1 pinch of pepper, and, the measuring beaker not inserted, simmer using the reverse button/25 minutes/speed setting 1/95 °C. Put the cooking pot on the lid as a splash guard.
Add the cream to the blender jug and, the measuring beaker not inserted, cook with the reverse button/1 minute/speed setting 1/95 °C. Season to taste with salt and pepper, and serve.

TIP
Cut up long gyro strips before sautéing to prevent them from wrapping round the blades.

steps.text: Peel 1 onion (70 g) and 1 garlic clove, halve the onion and put both in the blender jug.
Place a plate on top of the blender jug and weigh out ½ green pepper (75 g).
Clean the pepper, wash it inside and out, cut into quarters, deseed and put into the blender jug without the stalk.
Place a plate on top of the blender jug and weigh out 100 g button mushrooms.
Trim the mushrooms and put them into the blender jug.
Decant the vegetable mixture.
Put 1 tbsp olive oil into the blender jug.
Add 250 g gyro-style strips of meat.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Put the chopped vegetables into the blender jug.
Add 200 g sieved tomatoes.
Add 100 g warm vegetable stock.
Add 100 g feta in rough chunks.
Add ¼ tsp salt and 1 pinch of pepper.
During the next step, put the cooking pot on the lid as a splash guard.
Pour 50 g cream into the blender jug.
Season to taste with salt and pepper, and insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Serve the gyro soup.

recipe.name: Gyro soup (serves 4)
instructions: Peel the onions and garlic cloves. Halve the onions, and put the onion halves and the garlic and place in the blender jug. With the measuring beaker in place, chop for 8 seconds/speed setting 6.

Trim the pepper and mushrooms, wash the pepper inside and out, cut into quarters. Add pepper and mushrooms to the blender jug. With the measuring beaker in place, chop for 6 seconds/speed setting 5.  Decant the vegetable mixture.
Pour the oil into the blender jug and, the measuring beaker not inserted, sauté the meat with the roast button/12 minutes.

Add the vegetables, sieved tomatoes, warm vegetable stock, feta in rough-size pieces, ½ teaspoon of salt and 1 big pinch of pepper, and, the measuring beaker not inserted, simmer using the reverse button/25 minutes/speed setting 1/95 °C. Put the cooking pot on the lid as a splash guard.
Add the cream to the blender jug and, the measuring beaker not inserted, cook with the reverse button/1 minute/speed setting 1/95 °C. Season to taste with salt and pepper, and serve.

TIP
Cut up long gyro strips before sautéing to prevent them from wrapping round the blades.

steps.text: Peel 2 onions (140 g) and 2 garlic cloves, halve the onions and put both in the blender jug.
Place a plate on top of the blender jug and weigh out 1 green pepper (150 g).
Clean the pepper, wash it inside and out, cut into quarters, deseed and put into the blender jug without the stalk.
Place a plate on top of the blender jug and weigh out 200 g button mushrooms.
Trim the mushrooms and put them into the blender jug.
Decant the vegetable mixture.
Put 2 tbsp olive oil into the blender jug.
Add 500 g gyro-style strips of meat.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Put the chopped vegetables into the blender jug.
Add 400 g sieved tomatoes.
Add 200 g warm vegetable stock.
Add 200 g feta in rough chunks.
Add ½ tsp salt and 1 big pinch of pepper.
During the next step, put the cooking pot on the lid as a splash guard.
Put 100 g cream into the blender jug.
Season to taste with salt and pepper, and insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Serve the gyro soup.

recipe.name: Batter (18 cm Ø)
instructions: Add the butter in chunks, sugar, 1 pinch of salt and vanilla sugar to the blender jug and mix, with the measuring beaker in place, for 40 seconds/speed setting 5.

Continue stirring for 1 minute/speed setting 5 and, the measuring beaker not inserted, adding the eggs one at a time through the filling opening. Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug.

Mix the baking powder into the flour, sieve into the blender jug and stir all the ingredients in the blender jug, with the measuring beaker in place, for 20 seconds/speed setting 6 to make a smooth batter.

QUICK CHOCOLATE MUFFINS
You can make quick chocolate muffins from this basic batter: add 30 ml cream to the eggs and 1–2 tablespoons of baking cocoa to the flour and baking powder. Pre-heat the oven to 180 °C, grease the muffin tin and dust with flour. Divide the mixture between the 6 holes in the tin and bake for 20 minutes. Using a wooden skewer, test to see if the muffins are baked and extend the baking time if necessary. Let the muffins cool down and coat with chocolate if desired.

ingredientsBases.name: FOR 1 LOAF CAKE, GUGLHUPF OR A SPRINGFORM TIN 18 CM Ø

steps.text: Put 130 g soft butter in chunks into the blender jug.
Add 120 g sugar.
Add 1 pinch of salt and 1 sachet of vanilla sugar.
During the next step, add 3 eggs (medium) one at a time through the filling opening in the lid. Do not put the measuring beaker back in place.
Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug.
Sieve 180 g flour and 2 tsp baking powder into the blender jug.
Continue to follow the instructions for the cake mix as specified in your recipe.

recipe.name: Banana and vanilla milkshake (4 glasses)
instructions: Peel the bananas, slice into 4-cm pieces and put into the blender jug with a dash of cold milk. With the measuring beaker in place, blend for 20 seconds/speed setting 8.
Add the remaining cold milk and the vanilla ice cream and, with the measuring beaker in place, blend for 30 seconds/speed setting 8 until creamy.
Pour into four highball glasses and serve with chocolate sprinkles on top.

VARIATION
You can use strawberries, mango or honeydew melon flesh or bilberries instead of bananas.

ingredients.name: 500 ml cold milk (fresh whole milk, 3.5% fat)

steps.text: Chop 4 very ripe bananas (440 g) in large 4-cm chunks and put in the blender jug.
Add 100 g cold milk.
Add 400 g cold milk and 8 tbsp vanilla ice cream to the blender jug.
Pour into four highball glasses and serve with 4 tsp of chocolate sprinkles on top.

recipe.name: Meat and potato pie (serves 2)
instructions: To make the meat filling, cut the leftover meat into pieces. Wash the parsley, shake it dry and remove the leaves from the stalks. Peel and halve the onion, put it in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 3 seconds/speed setting 6. Use the spatula to scrape the pieces down the inside of the blender jug.

Add the butter and, the measuring beaker not inserted, melt for 30 seconds/speed setting 2/60 °C. Then, the measuring beaker not inserted, sauté the onion with the roast button/1 minute/100 °C. Add the pieces of meat, parsley, ¼ teaspoon of salt and 3 big pinches of pepper. With the measuring beaker in place, chop everything finely for 10 seconds/speed setting 8. Transfer the mixture to another container. Clean out the blender jug thoroughly.

Insert the mixer attachment for the mash. Peel and wash the potatoes, cut them into 3-cm pieces and put them in the blender jug with the room-temperature milk, ¼ teaspoon of salt and 1 big pinch of pepper. The measuring beaker not inserted, cook for 25 minutes/speed setting 1/100 °C. Put the cooking pot on the lid as a splash guard.
In the meantime, pre-heat the oven to 220 °C. Grease a casserole dish.

Remove the mixer attachment (be careful: it will be hot!), add the cubed butter and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix everything for 30 seconds/speed setting 4. Put half of the potato mash in the casserole dish. Cover it with the meat mixture, then spread the rest of the mash over the top. Sprinkle the casserole with breadcrumbs or grated cheese to taste and then bake in the hot oven for 20 minutes until golden brown.
Serve the pie warm.

TIPS
A green salad makes a good accompaniment.
If no children are eating with you, you can also add 1 tablespoon of Madeira to the pieces of meat before they are chopped.

ingredients.name: 150 g cooked meat (e.g. leftovers from a stew)
200 ml milk at room temperature (fresh whole milk, 3.5%)

steps.text: Grease a casserole dish.
Peel and halve ½ onion (30 g) and put it into the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Put 1 tsp butter into the blender jug.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Place a dish on top of the blender jug and weigh 150 g of the cooked meat leftovers into it.
Cut the cooked meat into pieces and put into the blender jug.
Wash 3 sprigs of flat-leaf parsley, shake dry, remove the leaves and put into the blender jug.
Add ¼ tsp salt and 3 big pinches of pepper.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Decant the mixture into another dish.
Clean the blender jug thoroughly.
Insert the mixer attachment.
Weigh out 500 g floury potatoes.
Peel and wash the potatoes, cut into 3–4 cm pieces and put into the blender jug.
Add 200 g milk.
Add ¼ tsp salt and 1 pinch of pepper.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid and put the cooking pot on the lid as a splash guard.
During the next step, shortly before the end of the cooking time, pre-heat the oven to 220 °C (top and bottom heat).
Remove the mixer attachment. (Be careful: it will be hot!)
Put 25 g cubed butter into the blender jug.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Put half of the potato mash in the casserole dish. Cover it with the meat mixture, then spread the rest of the mash over the top.
Sprinkle the casserole with 1 tbsp breadcrumbs or grated cheese to taste and then bake in the hot oven for 20 minutes until golden brown.
Serve the pie warm.

recipe.name: Meat and potato pie (serves 6)
instructions: To make the meat filling, cut the leftover meat into pieces. Wash the parsley, shake it dry and remove the leaves from the stalks. Peel and halve the onion, put it in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 8 seconds/speed setting 6. Use the spatula to scrape the pieces down the inside of the blender jug.

Add the butter and, the measuring beaker not inserted, melt for 1 minute/speed setting 2/60 °C. Then, the measuring beaker not inserted, sauté the onion with the roast button/2 minutes/100 °C. Add the pieces of meat, parsley, 1 teaspoon of salt and ½ teaspoon of pepper. With the measuring beaker in place, chop everything finely for 20 seconds/speed setting 8. Transfer the mixture to another container. Clean out the blender jug thoroughly.

Insert the mixer attachment for the mash. Peel and wash the potatoes, cut them into 3-cm pieces and put them in the blender jug with the room-temperature milk, 1 teaspoon of salt and 3 big pinches of pepper. The measuring beaker not inserted, cook for 40 minutes/speed setting 1/90 °C. Put the cooking pot on the lid as a splash guard.
In the meantime, pre-heat the oven to 220 °C. Grease a casserole dish.

Remove the mixer attachment (be careful: it will be hot!), add the cubed butter and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix everything for 55 seconds/speed setting 4. Put half of the potato mash in the casserole dish. Cover it with the meat mixture, then spread the rest of the mash over the top. Sprinkle the casserole with breadcrumbs or grated cheese to taste and then bake in the hot oven for 20 minutes until golden brown.
Serve the pie warm.

TIPS
A green salad makes a good accompaniment.
If no children are eating with you, you can also add 1 tablespoon of Madeira to the pieces of meat before they are chopped.

ingredients.name: 450 g cooked meat (e.g. leftovers from a stew)
600 ml milk at room temperature (fresh whole milk, 3.5%)

steps.text: Grease a casserole dish.
Peel and halve 1 medium-sized onion (90 g) and put it into the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Put 1½ tbsp butter into the blender jug.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Place a dish on top of the blender jug and weigh 450 g of cooked meat leftovers into it.
Cut the cooked meat into pieces and put into the blender jug.
Wash 1 bunch of flat-leaf parsley, shake dry, remove the leaves and put into the blender jug.
Add 1 tsp salt and ½ tsp pepper.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Decant the mixture into another dish.
Clean the blender jug thoroughly.
Insert the mixer attachment.
Weigh out 1500 g floury potatoes.
Peel and wash the potatoes, cut into 3 cm pieces and put into the blender jug.
Add 600 g milk at room temperature.
Add 1 tsp salt and 3 big pinches of pepper.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.  Put the cooking pot on the lid as a splash guard.
During the next step, shortly before the end of the cooking time, pre-heat the oven to 220 °C (top and bottom heat).
Remove the mixer attachment. (Be careful: it will be hot!)
Put 75 g cubed butter into the blender jug.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Put half of the potato mash in the casserole dish. Cover it with the meat mixture, then spread the rest of the mash over the top.
Sprinkle the casserole with 3 tbsp breadcrumbs or grated cheese to taste and then bake in the hot oven for 20 minutes until golden brown.
Serve the pie warm.

recipe.name: Lentil soup with sausage (serves 2)
instructions: Wash and trim the carrot and celeriac and cut into 2-cm pieces. Peel the onion.

Wash and trim the leek, cut into rough pieces and put everything into the blender jug. With the measuring beaker in place, chop for 6 seconds/speed setting 8. Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Pour the sunflower oil into the blender jug and, the measuring beaker not inserted, sauté the vegetables with the roast button/3 minutes/100 °C until transparent.

Put the lentils into the blender jug and pour in 500 ml hot water. Stir well with the spatula. With the measuring beaker in place, cook everything with the reverse button/20 minutes/speed setting 1/90 °C. Then add the stock powder and use the spatula to stir well.

Add the sausages to the blender jug (cut in half if necessary) and, with the measuring beaker in place, cook with the reverse button/15 minutes/speed setting 1/90 °C. If the lentils are not soft enough, remove the sausages, put them in a warm place and, with the measuring beaker in place, cook the soup again with the reverse button/15 minutes/speed setting 1/90 °C. Season the soup with lovage, marjoram, 1 teaspoon of salt, ¼ teaspoon of pepper and apple cider vinegar and, with the measuring beaker in place, stir in with the reverse button/20 seconds/speed setting 1. Serve the soup with the sausages.

TIP
If you prefer a heartier soup, put 25 g diced bacon into the blender jug with the sunflower oil.

steps.text: Peel, wash and trim ½ carrot (40 g), dice into 2-cm cubes and put into the blender jug.
Peel, wash and trim a piece of celeriac (70 g), cut into 2-cm cubes and put in the blender jug.
Peel ½ onion (40 g) and add it to the blender jug.
Trim and wash a piece of leek (30 g), cut it into rough pieces and add it to the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Add 1 tbsp sunflower oil.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Put 170 g pardina lentils into the blender jug.
Add 500 g water at room temperature.
Stir thoroughly with the spatula.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Add 2 tsp meat stock granules and stir with the spatula.
Add 2 ground pork sausages (cut in half if necessary).
If the lentils are not soft enough, remove the sausages, put them in a warm place and carry out the next step; otherwise skip it.
Season the soup with ½ tsp lovage, ½ tsp marjoram, ½ tsp salt, 1 big pinch of pepper and 2 tsp apple cider vinegar.
Serve the soup with the sausages.

recipe.name: Lentil soup with sausage (serves 4)
instructions: Wash and trim the carrot and celeriac and cut into 2-cm pieces. Put into the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 6 seconds/speed setting 8. Peel and halve the onion.

Wash and trim the leek, cut into rough pieces and put them into the blender jug with the onion. With the measuring beaker in place, chop for 5 seconds/speed setting 8. Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Pour the sunflower oil into the blender jug and, the measuring beaker not inserted, sauté the vegetables with the roast button/3 minutes/100 °C until transparent.

Put the lentils into the blender jug and pour in 1 litre of hot water. Stir well with the spatula. With the measuring beaker in place, cook everything with the reverse button/20 minutes/speed setting 1/90 °C. Then add the stock powder and use the spatula to stir well.

Add the sausages to the blender jug (cut in half if necessary) and, with the measuring beaker in place, cook with the reverse button/15 minutes/speed setting 1/90 °C. If the lentils are not soft enough, remove the sausages, put them in a warm place and, with the measuring beaker in place, cook the soup again with the reverse button/15 minutes/speed setting 1/90 °C. Season the soup with lovage, marjoram, 1 teaspoon of salt, ¼ teaspoon of pepper and apple cider vinegar and, with the measuring beaker in place, stir in with the reverse button/20 seconds/speed setting 1. Serve the soup with the sausages.

TIP
If you prefer a heartier soup, put 50 g diced bacon into the blender jug with the sunflower oil.

steps.text: Peel, wash and trim 1 carrots (100 g), dice into 2-cm cubes and put into the blender jug.
Peel, wash and trim a piece of celeriac (150 g), cut into 2-cm cubes and put in the blender jug.
Peel and halve 1 onion (80 g) and add them to the blender jug.
Trim and wash ½ leek (70 g), cut it into rough pieces and add it to the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Add 1 tbsp sunflower oil.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Put 300 g pardina lentils into the blender jug.
Add 1000 g lukewarm water.
Stir thoroughly with the spatula.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Add 1 tbsp meat stock powder and stir with the spatula.
Add 4 ground pork sausages (cut in half if necessary).
If the lentils are not soft enough, remove the sausages, put them in a warm place and carry out the next step; otherwise skip it.
Season the soup with 1 tsp lovage, ½ tsp marjoram, 1 tsp salt, ¼ tsp pepper and 1 tbsp apple cider vinegar.
Serve the soup with the sausages.

recipe.name: Carrot medley (serves 2)
instructions: Wash the parsley and shake dry. Remove the leaves from the stalks and put the leaves in the blender jug. With the measuring beaker in place, chop for 8 seconds/speed setting 6. Decant and put to one side.
Peel the carrots and potatoes and cut into dice 2.5 cm long.

Pour 500 ml cold water into the blender jug and hang the cooking pot in the blender jug. Put the carrots and the potatoes in the cooking pot and season the carrots with ¼ teaspoon each of salt and sugar. The measuring beaker not inserted, cook everything with the steamer button. Then remove the cooking pot and empty out the blender jug.
Peel the onion and cut in half and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 10 seconds/speed setting
10. Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Add the butter and, the measuring beaker not inserted, sauté with the roast button/2 minutes.
Add the warm chicken stock and room-temperature cream and, the measuring beaker not inserted, heat up for 1 minute/speed setting 1/95 °C.
Add the potatoes, carrots and parsley and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 20 seconds/speed setting 3. Repeat the process again as you wish and season again with salt and pepper.

TIPS 
This delicious side dish is lovely with meatballs, bratwurst or meatloaf. 
You can also adjust the proportions of potato and carrot to taste.

ingredients.name: 25 ml cream at room temperature (30% fat)

steps.text: Wash ½ bunch flat-leaf parsley and shake dry. Remove the leaves from the stalks and put in the blender jug.
Decant the parsley and set aside.
Peel 500 g carrots, dice into 2.5-cm cubes and place in the cooking pot.

Season the carrots with 
¼ tsp salt and ¼ tsp sugar.
Peel, wash and dice 250 g floury potatoes (2.5-cm cubes) and put them into the cooking pot.
Pour 500 g cold water into the blender jug.
Insert the cooking pot into the blender jug.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Remove the cooking pot and empty the blender jug.
Peel and halve ½ red onion (40 g) and add to the blender jug. Insert the measuring beaker.
Add 15 g butter to the measuring jug.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Add 25 g warm chicken stock to the blender jug.
Add 25 g cream at room temperature.
Put the potatoes, carrots and parsley in the blender jug.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Season again with salt and pepper if necessary.

recipe.name: Carrot medley (serves 6)
instructions: Wash the parsley and shake dry. Remove the leaves from the stalks and put the leaves in the blender jug. With the measuring beaker in place, chop for 8 seconds/speed setting 6. Decant and put to one side.
Peel the carrots and potatoes and cut into dice 2.5 cm long.

Pour 1 litre of cold water into the blender jug, hang the cooking pot in the blender jug, put the potatoes in the cooking pot and the carrots in the deep and shallow steamer baskets. Season the carrots with ½ teaspoon each of salt and sugar.

Place the steamer attachment on the blender jug, close with its lid and cook everything with the steamer button/25 minutes. Then set the steamer attachment aside, with the lid on, remove the cooking pot and empty out the blender jug.
Peel the onions and cut in half and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 10 seconds/speed setting
10. Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Add the butter and, the measuring beaker not inserted, sauté with the roast button/2 minutes.
Add the warm chicken stock and room-temperature cream and, the measuring beaker not inserted, heat up for 1 minute/speed setting 1/95 °C.

Add the potatoes, carrots and parsley and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 20 seconds/speed setting 3. Stir the vegetables with the spatula, then, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 20 seconds/setting 3. Season again with salt and pepper.

TIPS This delicious side dish is lovely with meatballs, bratwurst or meatloaf. You can also adjust the proportions of potato and carrot to taste.

ingredients.name: 75 ml cream at room temperature (30% fat)

steps.text: Wash 1½ bunch flat-leaf parsley and shake dry. Remove the leaves from the stalks and put in the blender jug.
Decant the parsley and set aside.
Peel 1500 g carrots and dice into 2.5-cm cubes.
Spread the diced carrot out in the deep steamer basket and the shallow steamer basket.

Season the carrots with 
1 tsp salt and 1 tsp sugar.
Peel, wash and dice 750 g floury potatoes and put them into the cooking pot.
Pour 1000 g cold water into the blender jug.
Insert the cooking pot into the blender jug.
Attach the deep steamer basket, with the shallow steamer basket inserted, to the blender jug and close.
Remove the steamer attachment and set aside while closed. Remove the cooking attachment and empty the blender jug.
Peel and quarter 2 small red onions (120 g) and add to the blender jug.
Add 45 g butter.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Add 75 g warm chicken stock to the blender jug.
Add 75 g cream at room temperature.
Put the potatoes, carrots and parsley in the blender jug.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Use the spatula to stir the vegetables through.
Season again with salt and pepper if necessary.

recipe.name: Potato gratin (serves 2)
instructions: Pre-heat the oven to 180 °C and grease a small oven-proof dish with butter.
Remove the rind from the cheese, cut into 1.5-cm pieces and put them in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop finely for 8 seconds/speed setting 8. Then decant and reserve.
Peel and wash the potatoes, cut into wafer-thin slices, or grate. Arrange in the greased oven-proof dish.

Peel the garlic clove and shallot, and cut the shallot in half. With the measuring beaker in place, chop both in the blender jug with the turbo button/2 seconds. Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.

Add the cream at room temperature, vegetable stock at room temperature, 1 pinch of pepper, ¼ teaspoon of salt, nutmeg and 1 small bay leaf and, with the measuring beaker in place, cook with the reverse button/5 minutes/speed setting 3/100 °C.
Remove the bay leaf from the sauce, and pour the finished sauce over the potatoes.
Sprinkle the chopped cheese evenly over the potatoes.
Bake the potato gratin in the oven for 45 minutes until golden brown. If necessary, extend the baking time if the potatoes are not cooked through.
Once baked, allow to cool for 10 minutes before serving.

TIPS
Serve the gratin as an accompaniment to fish or as the main dish with a fresh salad.
Refine the gratin with diced bacon or strips of boiled ham.

ingredients.name: 100 g mountain cheese or Emmental (45% fat)
175 ml cream at room temperature (30% fat)
50 ml hearty vegetable stock at room temperature

steps.text: Pre-heat the oven to 180 °C (top and bottom heat) and grease an oven-proof dish with butter.
Remove the rind from 100 g mountain cheese or Emmental.
Cut the cheese into 1.5-cm cubes and add it to the cold blender jug.
Transfer the cheese to a small bowl.
Peel and wash 500 g waxy potatoes, and grate or cut them into wafer-thin slices.
Arrange the potato slices in the greased oven-proof dish.
Weigh out 1 shallot (20 g), peel and quarter it, and put it into the blender jug.
Peel 1 small garlic clove and add it to the blender jug.
Hold down the turbo button for 2 seconds.
Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug.
Add 175 g cream at room temperature.
Pour in 50 g vegetable stock at room temperature.
Add a pinch of pepper, ¼ tsp salt, 1 pinch of nutmeg and 1 small bay leaf.
Remove the bay leaf from the sauce, pour the finished sauce over the potatoes and sprinkle the chopped cheese over the top.
Bake in the oven for 45 minutes until golden brown.
Extend the baking time if the potatoes are not yet cooked.
Once baked, allow to cool for 10 minutes.

recipe.name: Potato gratin (serves 6)
instructions: Pre-heat the oven to 180 °C and grease a large oven-proof dish with butter.
Remove the rind from the cheese, cut into 1.5-cm pieces and put them in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop finely for 8 seconds/speed setting 8. Then decant and reserve.
Peel and wash the potatoes, cut into wafer-thin slices, or grate. Arrange in the greased oven-proof dish.

Peel the garlic cloves and shallots, and cut the shallots into quarters. With the measuring beaker in place, chop both in the blender jug with the turbo button/2 seconds. Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.

Add the cream at room temperature, vegetable stock at room temperature, pepper, salt, nutmeg and bay leaves and, with the measuring beaker in place, cook with the reverse button/5 minutes/speed setting 3/100 °C.
Remove the bay leaves from the sauce, and pour the finished sauce over the potatoes.
Sprinkle the chopped cheese evenly over the potatoes.
Bake the potato gratin in the oven for 45 minutes until golden brown. If necessary, extend the baking time if the potatoes are not cooked through.
Once baked, allow to cool for 10 minutes before serving.

TIPS
Serve the gratin as an accompaniment to fish or as the main dish with a fresh salad.
Refine the gratin with diced bacon or strips of boiled ham.

ingredients.name: 300 g mountain cheese or Emmental (45% fat)
525 ml cream at room temperature (30% fat)
150 ml hearty vegetable stock at room temperature

steps.text: Pre-heat the oven to 180 °C (top and bottom heat) and grease a large oven-proof dish with butter.
Remove the rind from 300 g mountain cheese or Emmental.
Cut the cheese into 1.5-cm cubes and put into the cold blender jug.
Transfer the cheese to a small bowl.
Peel and wash 1500 g waxy potatoes, and grate or cut them into wafer-thin slices.
Arrange the potato slices in the greased oven-proof dish.
Weigh out 3 shallots (60 g), peel and quarter them, and put them into the blender jug.
Peel 2 garlic cloves and add it to the blender jug.
Hold down the turbo button for 2 seconds.
Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug.
Add 525 g cream at room temperature.
Pour in 150 g vegetable stock at room temperature.
Add 2 pinches of pepper, ½ tsp salt, 3 pinches of nutmeg and 2 bay leaves.
Remove the bay leaves from the sauce, pour the finished sauce over the potatoes and sprinkle the chopped cheese over the top.
Bake in the oven for 45 minutes until golden brown.
Extend the baking time if the potatoes are not yet cooked.
Once baked, allow to cool for 10 minutes.

recipe.name: Pasta with broccoli and mushrooms (serves 2)
instructions: Peel the shallot and cut in half, peel the garlic clove, and put them all in the blender jug. With the measuring beaker in place, chop with the turbo button/2 seconds. Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug. Add the butter in cubes and, the measuring beaker not inserted, sauté with the roast button/2 minutes. In the meantime, clean the mushrooms, and, depending on their size, cut them into quarters or eighths.

Pour the hot vegetable stock into the blender jug to the shallot-and-garlic mixture and, with the measuring beaker in place, heat for 3 minutes/speed setting 1/100 °C. Add the cream at room temperature, processed cheese, nutmeg, ½ teaspoon of salt and 3 pinches of pepper and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 10 seconds/speed setting 7. Then add the pasta and mushrooms, stir with the spatula and, with the measuring beaker in place, cook everything with the reverse button/8 minutes/speed setting 1/100 °C. Wash the broccoli and remove small florets from the stalk.

Put the small broccoli florets in the blender jug, stir with the spatula and, with the measuring beaker in place, cook with the reverse button/6 minutes/speed setting 1/100 °C. Check if the broccoli and pasta are cooked, and, if necessary, extend the cooking time by a few minutes.
Season to taste with salt and pepper, stir in with the spatula and allow to rest for 2 minutes in the blender jug. Serve the pasta with grated Parmesan if liked.

TIP
After the pasta, broccoli and mushrooms have rested, decant from the blender jug otherwise everything will continue to cook.

ingredients.name: 100 ml cream at room temperature (30% fat)

steps.text: Wash ½ head of broccoli (200 g), separate the florets from the stalk and set them to one side.
Clean 100 g button mushrooms and cut into quarters or eighths. Set to one side.
Peel and quarter 1 shallot (30 g), peel 1 garlic clove, and put both into the blender jug.
Hold the turbo button down for 2 seconds.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Put 20 g cubed butter into the blender jug.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Pour 335 g hot vegetable stock into the blender jug.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Put 100 g cream at room temperature into the blender jug.
Add 50 g processed cheese.
Add 1 pinch of nutmeg, ¼ tsp salt and 1 pinch of pepper.
Put 165 g penne (cooking time: 12 minutes) into the blender jug.
Add the mushrooms and stir in with the spatula.
Add 115 g small broccoli florets and stir them in using the spatula.
Check if the broccoli and pasta are cooked, and, if necessary, extend the cooking time by a few minutes with the next step; otherwise, skip it.
Season to taste with salt and pepper, scrape down with the spatula and allow to rest for 2 minutes in the blender jug.
Serve the pasta with grated Parmesan as desired.

recipe.name: Pasta with broccoli and mushrooms (serves 4)
instructions: Peel the shallot and cut in half, peel the garlic clove, and put them all in the blender jug. With the measuring beaker in place, chop with the turbo button/2 seconds. Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug. Add the butter in cubes and, the measuring beaker not inserted, sauté with the roast button/4 minutes. In the meantime, clean the mushrooms, and, depending on their size, cut them into quarters or eighths.

Pour 500 ml hot vegetable stock into the blender jug to the shallot-and-garlic mixture and, with the measuring beaker in place, heat for 5 minutes/speed setting 1/100 °C. Add the cream at room temperature, processed cheese, nutmeg, ¼ teaspoon of salt and 2 pinches of pepper and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 10 seconds/speed setting 7. Then add the pasta and mushrooms, stir with the spatula and, with the measuring beaker in place, cook everything with the reverse button/8 minutes/speed setting 1/100 °C. Wash the broccoli and remove 300 g of small florets from the stalk.

Put the remaining stock and the small broccoli florets in the blender jug, stir with the spatula and, with the measuring beaker in place, cook with the reverse button/6 minutes/speed setting 1/100 °C. Check if the broccoli and pasta are cooked, and, if necessary, extend the cooking time by a few minutes.
Season to taste with salt and pepper, stir in with the spatula and allow to rest for 2 minutes in the blender jug. Serve the pasta with grated Parmesan if liked.

TIP
After the pasta, broccoli and mushrooms have rested, decant from the blender jug otherwise everything will continue to cook.

ingredients.name: 200 ml cream at room temperature (30% fat)

steps.text: Wash 1 head of broccoli (500 g), separate the florets from the stalk and set them to one side.
Clean 200 g button mushrooms and cut into quarters or eighths. Set to one side.
Peel and quarter 1 shallot (30 g), peel 1 garlic clove, and put both into the blender jug.
Hold the turbo button down for 2 seconds.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Put 30 g cubed butter into the blender jug.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Pour 500 g hot vegetable stock into the blender jug.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Put 200 g cream at room temperature into the blender jug.
Add 100 g processed cheese.
Add 1 pinch of nutmeg, ¼ tsp salt and 2 pinches of pepper.
Put 350 g penne (cooking time: 12 minutes) into the blender jug.
Add the mushrooms and stir in with the spatula.
Pour 250 g hot vegetable stock into the blender jug.
Add 300 g small broccoli florets and stir them in using the spatula.
Check if the broccoli and pasta are cooked, and, if necessary, extend the cooking time by a few minutes with the next step; otherwise, skip it.
Season to taste with salt and pepper, scrape down with the spatula and allow to rest for 2 minutes in the blender jug.
Serve the pasta with grated Parmesan as desired.

recipe.name: Tuscan chicken with rice (serves 2)
instructions: Grease the deep steamer basket well with ½ teaspoon of olive oil. Rinse the chicken breast under cold running water, pat dry and cut into slices.
Arrange the strips of chicken in the deep steamer basket and season well with the Italian herbs, ½ teaspoon of salt and 1 pinch of pepper.
Wash the tomatoes and pat dry. Remove the stalks and slice.
Cut the mozzarella into slices.
Arrange the tomatoes on top of the chicken, and put the mozzarella to one side.
Peel and quarter the shallot, put into the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 5 seconds/speed setting 6. Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Add the remaining olive oil and, the measuring beaker not inserted, brown with the roast button/2 minutes.
Add the tomato purée and, the measuring beaker not inserted, cook with the roast button/2 minutes.

Put the rice in the cooking pot, place in the blender jug and pour the hot vegetable stock over it. Attach the deep steamer basket to the blender jug, close and steam everything with the steamer button.
Five minutes before the cooking time is up, carefully arrange the mozzarella on top of the tomatoes and continue to steam. Remove the deep steamer basket, remove the rice and keep it warm.

Add the chopped tomatoes and room-temperature cream to the liquid in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 4 seconds/speed setting 5, then, the measuring beaker not inserted, reduce for 7 minutes/speed setting1/100 °C.
Dissolve the cornflour in 2 tablespoons of cold water, add to the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, heat for 1 minute/speed setting 1/100 °C.

Season the sauce to taste with salt and pepper and, with the measuring beaker in place, stir in for 10 seconds/speed setting 2.
Wash and shake the basil dry. Remove the leaves and shred into fine strips.
Arrange the chicken with the rice and sauce and serve sprinkled with basil.

steps.text: Grease the deep steamer basket with ½ tsp olive oil.
Wash 350 g chicken breast under cold running water and pat dry.
Slice the chicken breast fillets and arrange them in the deep steamer basket.
Season with 1 tsp Italian herbs, ½ tsp salt and 1 pinch of pepper.
Wash 2 medium-sized tomatoes (150 g), pat them dry, remove the stem ends and cut into slices.
Arrange the prepared tomatoes over the meat.
Peel 1 shallot (30 g), cut into quarters and add to the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Put ½ tsp olive oil into the blender jug.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Put 20 g tomato purée into the blender jug.
Insert the cooking pot into the blender jug.
Put 150 g rice into the cooking pot.
Pour over 1000 g hot vegetable stock.
Attach the deep steamer basket to the blender jug and close the lid.
Slice 1 ball of mozzarella (125 g) and set it to one side.
During the next step, 5 minutes before the cooking time is up, carefully arrange the mozzarella on top of the tomatoes and continue to steam.
Take out the deep steamer basket, remove the cooking pot with the rice and keep it warm.
Add 200 g tinned chopped tomatoes to the liquid in the blender jug.
Add 50 g cream at room temperature.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Place a bowl on top of the blender jug and weigh in 5 g cornflour. Dissolve the cornflour in 2 tbsp cold water and add to the blender jug.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Season the sauce to taste with salt and pepper.
Wash ¼ bunch of basil, shake it dry, tear off the leaves and shred into fine strips.
Arrange the chicken breasts, rice and sauce and serve sprinkled with the basil.

recipe.name: Tuscan chicken with rice (serves 6)
instructions: Grease both the deep and shallow steamer baskets well with 1½ teaspoon of olive oil. Rinse the chicken breast under cold running water, pat dry and cut into slices.
Divide the strips of chicken between the deep and shallow steamer baskets and season well with the Italian herbs, 1½ teaspoon of salt and ¼ teaspoon of pepper.
Wash the tomatoes and pat dry. Remove the stalks and slice. Cut the mozzarella into slices. Arrange the tomatoes on top of the chicken, and put the mozzarella to one side.

Peel and quarter the shallots, put them into the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 7 seconds/speed setting 6.
Add the remaining olive oil and, the measuring beaker not inserted, brown with the roast button/2 minutes. Add the tomato purée and, the measuring beaker not inserted, cook with the roast button/2 minutes.

Put the rice in the cooking pot, place in the blender jug and pour the hot vegetable stock over it. Attach the deep steamer basket with the shallow steamer basket and the lid on top, close and steam everything with the steamer button/25 minutes. Five minutes before the cooking time is up, carefully arrange the mozzarella on top of the tomatoes and continue to steam. Remove the steamer attachment. If necessary, use the spatula to loosen the rice from the edge of the cooking pot and blender jug. Lift out the cooking pot. Remove the rice and keep it warm.

Add the chopped tomatoes and room-temperature cream to the liquid in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 7 seconds/speed setting 5, then, the measuring beaker not inserted, reduce for 7 minutes/speed setting1/100 °C.
Dissolve the cornflour in 3 tablespoons of cold water, add to the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, heat for 1 minute/speed setting 1/100 °C.
Season the sauce to taste with salt and pepper and, with the measuring beaker in place, stir in for 10 seconds/speed setting 2.
Wash and shake the basil dry. Remove the leaves and shred into fine strips.
Arrange the chicken with the rice and sauce and serve sprinkled with basil.

ingredients.name: 3 balls of mozzarella (125 g each, 45% fat)

steps.text: Grease both the deep and shallow steamer baskets with 1½ tsp olive oil.
Wash 1050 g chicken breast under cold running water and pat dry.
Slice the chicken breast fillets and divide between the two steamer baskets.
Season with 3 tsp Italian herbs, 1½ tsp salt and ¼ tsp pepper.
Wash 4 tomatoes (450 g), pat them dry, remove the stem ends and cut into slices.
Arrange the prepared tomatoes over the meat.
Peel 3 shallots (90 g), cut into quarters and add to the blender jug.
Put 25 g olive oil into the blender jug.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Put 60 g tomato purée into the blender jug.
Insert the cooking pot into the blender jug.
Put 450 g rice into the cooking pot.
Pour over 1500 g hot vegetable stock.
Attach the deep steamer basket with the shallow steamer basket to the blender jug and close the lid.
Slice 3 balls of mozzarella (each 125 g) and set them to one side.
During the next step, 5 minutes before the cooking time is up, carefully arrange the mozzarella on top of the tomatoes and continue to steam.
Take out the deep steamer basket, use the spatula to push the rice away from the sides of the pot and the blender jug, remove the pot and keep warm.
Add 600 g tinned chopped tomatoes to the liquid in the blender jug.
Add 150 g cream at room temperature.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Place a bowl on top of the blender jug and weigh in 10 g cornflour. Dissolve the cornflour in 2 tbsp cold water and add to the blender jug.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Season the sauce to taste with salt and pepper.
Wash ½ bunch of basil, shake it dry, tear off the leaves and shred into fine strips.
Arrange the chicken breasts, rice and sauce on plates and serve sprinkled with the basil.

recipe.name: Chicken and vegetables in cream sauce (serves 6)
instructions: Wash the parsley, shake it dry and tear off the leaves. Place in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, process for 8 seconds/speed setting 6. Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug. Peel the carrots and celeriac and slice them into 1.5-cm dice. Put the vegetables and chicken stock at room temperature in the blender jug.
Wash the chicken breasts under running water and pat dry. Cut the chicken into strips of about 5 x 2 cm.

Lay the chicken strips evenly spaced in the deep steamer basket, season with 1 teaspoon of salt and ½ teaspoon of pepper, place the deep steamer basket on the blender jug, close the lid and cook the chicken strips with the steamer button/10 minutes.
While it is cooking, clean the mushrooms, wipe with a damp cloth and cut into 0.5 cm slices. Lay them in the shallow steamer basket.
When the cooking time is up, carefully open the lid and use the spatula to turn the chicken strips.

Insert the shallow steamer basket with the button mushrooms, put the lid on once again and finish cooking with the reverse button/6 minutes/speed setting 1/120 °C. Take out the steamer basket and set it to one side.
Strain the contents of the blender jug through a sieve, retaining the cooking liquid.

Put 450 ml of the cooking liquid, the strained vegetables and the flour, crème fraîche, Worcestershire sauce and lemon juice into the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, cook with the reverse button/2 minutes/speed setting 3/100 °C.

Add the mushrooms and cold cubed butter and, with the measuring beaker in place, process everything with the reverse button/2 minutes/speed setting 1/80 °C. Season the sauce to taste and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix with the reverse button/20 seconds/speed setting 1.
Arrange the chicken strips on plates and serve with the sauce.
TIP Serve with Spätzle or rice.

ingredients.name: 1 l chicken stock at room temperature

steps.text: Clean 225 g button mushrooms, cut into 0.5 cm slices and place in the shallow steamer basket.
Wash 1½ bunches of flat-leaf parsley, shake dry, tear off the leaves and put in the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Place a plate on top of the blender jug and weigh out 3 carrots (225 g).
Peel the carrots, cut into 1.5-cm dice and put into the blender jug.
Place a plate on top of the blender jug and weigh out 1 piece of celeriac (75 g).
Peel the celeriac, cut into 1.5-cm dice and put into the blender jug.
Add 1000 g chicken stock at room temperature.
Place a plate on top of the blender jug and weigh 900 g chicken breasts into it.
Wash the chicken breasts under cold running water, pat dry and cut into 5 x 2 cm strips.
Arrange the chicken evenly in the deep steamer basket and season with 1 tsp salt and ½ tsp pepper.
Attach the deep steamer basket to the blender jug and close.
Carefully open the lid and use the spatula to turn the chicken strips. Insert the shallow steamer basket and close the lid again.
Remove the steamer attachment and put aside.
Strain the contents of the blender jug through a sieve, reserving the liquid.
Put 450 g of the reserved stock into the blender jug, together with the vegetables.
Put 60 g flour into the blender jug.
Add 150 g crème fraîche, 2 tsp Worcestershire sauce and 1½ tbsp lemon juice.
Transfer the mushrooms from the shallow steamer basket to the blender jug.
Add 90 g cold cubed butter.
Season the sauce to taste.
Arrange the chicken strips on plates and serve with the sauce poured over the top.

recipe.name: Chicken and vegetables in cream sauce (serves 2)
instructions: Wash the parsley, shake it dry and tear off the leaves. Place in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, process for 8 seconds/speed setting 6. Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug. Peel the carrot and celeriac and slice them into 1.5-cm dice. Put the vegetables and chicken stock at room temperature in the blender jug.
Wash the chicken breasts under running water and pat dry. Cut the chicken into strips of about 5 x 2 cm.

Lay the chicken strips evenly spaced in the deep steamer basket, season with ¼ teaspoon of salt and 2 big pinches of pepper, place the deep steamer basket on the blender jug, close the lid and cook the chicken strips with the steamer button/10 minutes.
While it is cooking, clean the mushrooms, wipe with a damp cloth and cut into 0.5 cm slices. Lay them in the shallow steamer basket.
When the cooking time is up, carefully open the lid and use the spatula to turn the chicken strips.

Insert the shallow steamer basket with the button mushrooms, put the lid on once again and finish cooking with the reverse button/6 minutes/speed setting 1/120 °C. Take out the steamer basket and set it to one side.
Strain the contents of the blender jug through a sieve, retaining the cooking liquid.

Put 150 ml of the cooking liquid, the strained vegetables and the flour, crème fraîche, Worcestershire sauce and lemon juice into the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, cook with the reverse button/2 minutes/speed setting 3/100 °C.

Add the mushrooms and cold cubed butter and, with the measuring beaker in place, process everything with the reverse button/2 minutes/speed setting 1/80 °C. Season the sauce to taste and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix with the reverse button/20 seconds/speed setting 1.
Arrange the chicken strips on plates and serve with the sauce.
TIP Serve with Spätzle or rice.

ingredients.name: 1 l chicken stock at room temperature

steps.text: Clean 75 g button mushrooms, cut into 0.5 cm slices and place in the shallow steamer basket.
Wash ½ bunch of flat-leaf parsley, shake dry, tear off the leaves and put in the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.

Place a plate on top of the blender jug and weigh out 1 carrot 
(75 g).
Peel the carrot, cut into 1.5-cm dice and put into the blender jug.
Place a plate on top of the blender jug and weigh out 1 piece of celeriac (25 g).
Peel the celeriac, cut into 1.5-cm dice and put into the blender jug.
Add 1000 g chicken stock at room temperature.
Place a plate on top of the blender jug and weigh 300 g chicken breasts into it.
Wash the chicken breasts under cold running water, pat dry and cut into 5 x 2 cm strips.
Arrange the chicken evenly in the deep steamer basket and season with ¼ tsp salt and 2 big pinches of pepper.
Attach the deep steamer basket to the blender jug and close.
Carefully open the lid and use the spatula to turn the chicken strips. Insert the shallow steamer basket and close the lid again.
Remove the steamer attachment and put aside.
Strain the contents of the blender jug through a sieve, reserving the liquid.
Put 150 g of the reserved stock into the blender jug, together with the vegetables.
Put 20 g flour into the blender jug.
Add 50 g crème fraîche, ½ tsp Worcestershire sauce and 1 tsp lemon juice.
Transfer the mushrooms from the shallow steamer basket to the blender jug.
Add 30 g cold cubed butter.
Season the sauce to taste.
Arrange the chicken strips on plates and serve with the sauce poured over the top.

recipe.name: Bifteki with tomato pasta (serves 2)
instructions: Peel and halve the shallots, wash the parsley, shake dry and remove the leaves from the stalks. Put in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 8 seconds/speed setting 7.

Add the minced meat, egg, breadcrumbs, ¼ teaspoon of salt, 1 pinch of pepper and Italian herbs and, the measuring beaker not inserted, mix with the reverse button/2 minutes/speed setting 1, using the spatula to help.
Put the bifteki mixture in a bowl and clean the blender jug.
Cut the feta into 8 cubes.
Form 8 balls from the meat mixture and put a cube of feta into the middle of each one. Roll up so that the cheese is completely covered by the meat mixture.

Put the kritharaki pasta in the blender jug, together with the chopped tomatoes, paprika powder, ½ teaspoon salt, 1 big pinch of pepper and 300 ml water, and, with the measuring beaker in place, cook with the reverse button/time according to the packet instructions/speed setting 1/100 °C.
While it is cooking, heat the oil in a frying pan, sear the bifteki on all sides and continue to fry on a medium heat for 9 minutes.
Once the cooking time is up, check whether the pasta is cooked, extending the cooking time by a few minutes if necessary. Remove the pasta from the blender jug and serve with the bifteki.
Wash the basil and shake it dry. Remove the leaves from the stalks, chop them finely and sprinkle on top.

TIP
If no children are eating with you, add ½ teaspoon of sambal oelek to the pasta for extra piquancy.

ingredients.name: 250 g mixed beef and pork mince
½ tsp dried Italian herbs or oregano

steps.text: Peel and halve 1 shallot (40 g) and put it into the blender jug.
Wash 3 sprigs of flat-leaf parsley, shake dry, tear off the leaves and add to the blender jug.
Put 250 g mixed minced meat into the blender jug.
Add 30 g breadcrumbs.
Add 1 egg (medium), ¼ tsp salt, 1 pinch of pepper and ½ tsp dried Italian herbs or oregano.
During the next step, stir the mixture occasionally through the lid opening with the spatula.
Decant into a bowl and clean the blender jug.
Cut 50 g feta into 8 cubes and set them to one side.
Form 8 balls from the meat mixture.
Put a cube of feta into the middle of each one and roll up so that the cheese is completely covered by the meat mixture.
Put 125 g Greek kritharaki pasta (orzo) into the blender jug.
Add 300 g water at room temperature.
Add 200 g chopped tinned tomatoes, ½ tsp mild paprika, ½ tsp salt and 1 big pinch of pepper.
During the next step but one, heat 1 tbsp oil in a frying pan, sear the bifteki on all sides and continue to fry on a medium heat for 9 minutes.
In the next step, adjust the time setting according to the orzo packet instructions.
Once the cooking time is up, check whether the orzo is cooked. Carry out the next step if necessary; otherwise, skip it.
Remove the orzo from the blender jug and serve with the bifteki.
Wash 1 sprig of fresh basil, shake it dry, remove the leaves, chop finely and sprinkle on top.

recipe.name: Chicken escalope with Swabian Spätzle noodles and vegetables (serves 2)
instructions: Peel and halve the onion and put it in the blender jug. With the measuring beaker in place, chop for 6 seconds/speed setting 8. Use the spatula to scrape everything down the inside of the blender jug.
Pour the olive oil into the blender jug.
Wash the courgette and cut off the ends, clean and wash the celery. Wash, clean and peel the carrot and the kohlrabi.
Dice all the vegetables into cubes of approximately 1.5 cm, put in the blender jug and, the measuring beaker not inserted, sauté with the roast button/5 minutes.
Pour on the vegetable stock and 800 ml warm water.
Rinse the chicken escalopes under cold running water, pat dry and cut into 1-cm-wide strips. Season with ¼ teaspoon of salt, 2 pinches of pepper, paprika powder and the herbes de Provence.

Arrange the chicken evenly in the deep steamer basket. Pull apart the fresh Spätzle and spread evenly across the shallow steamer basket. Insert the shallow steamer basket into the deep steamer basket, place it on the blender jug, close, and cook the chicken with the steamer button/17 minutes.
Remove the entire steamer attachment and put to one side.

Pass the contents of the blender jug through a sieve, reserving the liquid. Put 150 ml of the reserved stock, the reserved vegetables and the crème fraîche in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix using the reverse button/1 minute/speed setting 2.
Season to taste with pepper and salt, and with the measuring beaker in place, mix with the reserve button/10 seconds/speed setting 1. Serve the sauce with the chicken escalope and the Spätzle.

ingredients.name: 200 ml vegetable stock at room temperature
½ tbsp dried herbes de Provence
400 g fresh Swabian Spätzle noodles from the chiller cabinet (ready-made)

steps.text: Peel and halve ½ onion (35 g) and put it into the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Put 1 tbsp olive oil into the blender jug.
Place a plate on top of the blender jug and weigh out 1 small courgette (125 g).
Wash the courgette, cut off the ends, cut into 1.5-cm dice and put into the blender jug.
Place a plate on top of the blender jug and weigh out 1 stick of celery (75 g).
Wash and clean the celery, remove any hard strings, cut into 1.5 cm-dice and add to the blender jug.
Place a plate on top of the blender jug and weigh out 1 large carrot (100 g).
Wash, trim and peel the carrot, cut into 1.5 cm cubes and add to the blender jug.
Put a plate on top of the blender jug and weigh out ½ kohlrabi (100 g).
Wash, trim and peel the kohlrabi, cut it into 1.5-cm cubes and add to the blender jug.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Put 200 g vegetable stock at room temperature into the blender jug.
Add 800 g warm water.
Place a plate on top of the blender jug and weigh out 250 g chicken escalopes.
Wash the chicken under cold running water, pat dry and cut into 1-cm-wide strips.
Season the chicken strips with ¼ tsp salt, 2 pinches of pepper, ½ tsp sweet paprika and ½ tbsp dried herbes de Provence.
Place a bowl on top of the blender jug and weigh in 400 g fresh Swabian spätzle noodles.
Pull apart the fresh spätzle and place in the shallow steamer basket.
Arrange the chicken evenly in the deep steamer basket.
Insert the shallow steamer basket, attach to the blender jug and close.
Remove the whole steamer attachment and put it aside.
Strain the contents of the blender jug through a sieve, reserving the liquid.
Pour 150 g of the reserved liquid into the blender jug.
Add the reserved vegetables and 2 tbsp crème fraîche.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Season to taste with pepper and salt.
Serve the sauce with the chicken escalope and the spätzle.

recipe.name: Semolina pudding with apricot and cherry compote (serves 6)
instructions: Wash, dry, halve and stone the apricots and cherries.
Put the apricot halves with the honey and 120 ml warm water in the blender jug, and, with the measuring beaker in place, cook for 10 minutes/speed setting 2/100 °C until the apricots are soft.

With the measuring beaker in place, blend for 20 seconds/speed setting 5. Add the cerries and the lemon juice and, with the measuring beaker in place, stir in with the reverse button/15 seconds/speed setting 1. Decant and clean the blender jug thoroughly.
To make the semolina pudding, dry-fry the pistachios in a frying pan, cool and chop.
Put the milk at room temperature, cream at room temperature, sugar and soft wheat semolina in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, cook for 12 minutes/speed setting 2/80 °C.
Then with the measuring beaker in place, bring to the boil for 2 minutes/speed setting 1/100 °C.
Divide the semolina pudding into small dessert bowls and serve with the compote on top. Sprinkle the pistachio nuts over the dessert.

TIP
You may like to mix a little grated lemon peel into the semolina pudding. Simply add to the blender jug together with the milk, cream, sugar and semolina.

ingredients.name: 750 ml milk at room temperature (fresh whole milk, 3.5% fat)
300 ml cream at room temperature (30% fat)

steps.text: Weigh out 225 g cherries, wash, dry, halve and stone them, then set aside.
Wash, dry, halve and stone 9 apricots (450 g), then put them into the blender jug.
Add 1½ tbsp honey.
Add 120 g warm water.
Put the cherries you prepared and 1½ tsp lemon juice into the blender jug.
Decant and clean the blender jug thoroughly.
Toast 45 g pistachio nuts in a dry pan, leave them to cool and then chop them.
Pour 750 g milk at room temperature into the blender jug.
Add 300 g cream at room temperature.
Add 75 g sugar.
Add 135 g soft wheat semolina.
Divide the semolina pudding between 6 dessert bowls, spoon over the stewed fruit and sprinkle the pistachio nuts over the top.

recipe.name: Cream of vegetable soup (serves 6)
instructions: Wash and trim the vegetables according to type, peel the carrots and celeriac and cut everything into 3-cm pieces. Peel the potatoes and also cut into rough pieces. Wash and quarter the tomatoes and remove the stalks. Peel the onions and garlic cloves. Cut the onion into quarters. Wash the parsley, shake dry and remove the leaves from the stalks.

Add the vegetables, potatoes, tomato, onion, garlic, parsley, 1 teaspoon of salt, ¼ teaspoon of pepper and 1.5 litres of water at room temperature to the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, cook for 35 minutes/100 °C/speed setting 1.

Add the butter and, with the measuring beaker in place, blend for 1 minute 20 seconds/speed settings 5–8, increasing the speed gradually. If necessary, add more water and season the soup again with salt and pepper to taste. With the measuring beaker in place, stir for 20 seconds/speed setting 2.
Pour the soup into bowls and serve.
TIPS To serve, add 1 tablespoon of (full fat) cream cheese or crème fraîche (30 % fat) on top of the soup. Before serving, sprinkle the soup with freshly chopped herbs.

steps.text: Wash 3 sprigs of parsley, shake them dry, tear off the leaves and set them to one side.
Weigh out 975 g vegetables for the soup (carrots, celeriac, leek, cauliflower).
Wash and trim the vegetables according to type, peel the carrots and celeriac, cut everything into 3-cm pieces and put them into the blender jug.
Weigh out, peel and quarter 1 large onion (120 g) and add it to the blender jug.
Peel 2 garlic cloves and add them to the blender jug.
Weigh out 4 floury potatoes (450 g).
Peel the potatoes, wash and cut them into chunks of 3 cm, and add them to the blender jug.
Wash and quarter 1 large tomato (150 g), remove the stem ends and add to the blender jug.
Add the parsley leaves.
Add 1 tsp salt and ¼ tsp pepper.
Add 1500 g water at room temperature.
Add 30 g butter in pieces.
If necessary, add more water and season the soup again with salt and pepper to taste.

recipe.name: Boiling eggs (2 eggs)
instructions: Pour 500 ml cold water into the blender jug.
Place the eggs in to the cooking pot, place this in the blender jug and with the measuring beaker in place, boil the eggs for the length of time according to hardness required/speed setting 1/120 °C.
9 minutes: soft boiled egg
11 minutes: egg yolk buttery
14 minutes: hard boiled

TIP
To make a larger quantity of hard-boiled eggs, for an egg salad, for example, place the eggs in the cooking pot and the shallow steamer basket and cook them with the steamer button/12 minutes.

steps.text:
9 minutes: soft-boiled egg
11 minutes: buttery egg yolk
14 minutes: hard-boiled egg
Pour 500 g water into the blender jug.
Place 2 eggs (medium) into the cooking pot and place it in the blender jug.

In the next step, set the time according to hardness required. 
9 minutes: soft-boiled egg
11 minutes: buttery egg yolk
14 minutes: hard-boiled egg

recipe.name: Boiling eggs (8 eggs)
instructions: Pour 500 ml cold water into the blender jug.
Place the eggs in to the cooking pot, place this in the blender jug and with the measuring beaker in place, boil the eggs for the length of time according to hardness required/speed setting 1/120 °C.
9 minutes: soft boiled egg
11 minutes: egg yolk buttery
14 minutes: hard boiled

TIP
To make a larger quantity of hard-boiled eggs, for an egg salad, for example, place the eggs in the cooking pot and the shallow steamer basket and cook them with the steamer button/12 minutes.

steps.text:
9 minutes: soft-boiled egg
11 minutes: buttery egg yolk
14 minutes: hard-boiled egg
Pour 500 g water into the blender jug.
Place 8 eggs (medium) into the cooking pot and place it in the blender jug.

In the next step, set the time according to hardness required. 
9 minutes: soft-boiled egg
11 minutes: buttery egg yolk
14 minutes: hard-boiled egg

recipe.name: Boiling potatoes (serves 2)
