instructions: Pour 500 ml cold water into the blender jug. For potatoes cooked in their skins, thoroughly wash and scrub the potatoes, place in the cooking pot and place this in the blender jug.
For boiled potatoes, peel and wash the potatoes, cut into quarters or eighths, depending on size and place in the cooking pot.
Sprinkle the salt and caraway (only for potatoes cooked in their skins) and, with the measuring beaker in place, steam with the steamer button/15 minutes.

steps.text: Weigh out 400 g small potatoes.
For skin-on potatoes, wash and scrub them thoroughly, then set them to one side.
For boiled potatoes without their skins, peel and wash the potatoes, then cut them into quarters or eighths, depending on their size.
Pour 500 g water into the blender jug.
Place the cooking pot in the blender jug.
Put the potatoes into the cooking pot.
Sprinkle in ½ tsp caraway (only for potatoes cooked in their skins) and ½ tsp salt.

recipe.name: Boiling potatoes (serves 6)
instructions: Pour 1 litre of cold water into the blender jug. For potatoes cooked in their skins, thoroughly wash and scrub the potatoes, then arrange them in the deep steamer basket and shallow steamer basket.
For boiled potatoes, peel and wash the potatoes, cut into quarters or eighths, depending on size and arrange them in the deep steamer basket and shallow steamer basket.
Sprinkle the salt and caraway (only for potatoes cooked in their skins), insert the steamer attachment with the lid on, and steam with the steamer button/15 minutes.

steps.text: Weigh out 1200 g small potatoes.
For skin-on potatoes, wash and scrub them thoroughly and then set them to one side.
For boiled potatoes without their skins, peel and wash the potatoes, then cut them into quarters or eighths, depending on their size.
Pour 1000 g water into the blender jug.
Arrange the potatoes in the deep steamer basket and the shallow steamer basket and attach to the blender jug, with the lid closed.
Sprinkle in 1½ tsp caraway (only for potatoes cooked in their skins) and 1½ tsp salt.

recipe.name: Creamy leeks (serves 2)
instructions: Peel the onion and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop in the blender jug with the turbo button/2 seconds. Then use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug. Add the butter and, the measuring beaker not inserted, sweat with the roast button/4 minutes/100 °C.

Trim the leeks, cut in half lengthways and wash thoroughly. Cut into rings 1 cm thick. Put the leek and the room-temperature vegetable stock into the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, boil with the reverse button/12 minutes/speed setting 1/100 °C.

Use the spatula to scrape the pieces of leek down the inside of the blender jug. Add the flour and, with the measuring beaker in place, continue to cook with the reverse button/2 minutes/speed setting 1/100 °C.

Add the cream and, with the measuring beaker in place, continue to cook with the reverse button/1 minute/speed setting 1/100 °C. Season the leek with ¼ teaspoon of salt, 2 big pinches of pepper and 1 pinch of nutmeg and mix, with the measuring beaker in place, with the reverse button/20 seconds/speed setting 1.

TIP 
These leeks go well with roasted meat dishes.

ingredients.name: 75 ml vegetable stock at room temperature

steps.text: Peel 1 small onion (20 g) and put it into the blender jug.
Hold the turbo button down for 2 seconds.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Put 1½ tbsp butter into the blender jug.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Place a plate on top of the blender jug and weigh 400 g leek into it.
Trim the leek, cut in half lengthways, wash thoroughly, cut into rings 1 cm thick and put it into the blender jug.
Pour 75 g vegetable stock at room temperature into the blender jug.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Put 1 tbsp flour into the blender jug.
Put 1½ tbsp cream into the blender jug.
Season the creamed leeks with 1 pinch of salt, 1 big pinch of pepper and 1 pinch of nutmeg.

recipe.name: Creamy leeks (serves 6)
instructions: Peel the onion and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop in the blender jug with the turbo button/5 seconds. Then use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug. Add the butter and, the measuring beaker not inserted, sweat with the roast button/4 minutes/100 °C.

Trim the leeks, cut in half lengthways and wash thoroughly. Cut into rings 1 cm thick. Put the leek and the room-temperature vegetable stock into the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, boil with the reverse button/17 minutes/speed setting 1/100 °C.

Use the spatula to scrape the pieces of leek down the inside of the blender jug. Add the flour and, with the measuring beaker in place, continue to cook with the reverse button/2 minutes/speed setting 1/100 °C.

Add the cream and, with the measuring beaker in place, continue to cook with the reverse button/1 minute/speed setting 1/100 °C. Season the leek with ½ teaspoon of salt, ¼ teaspoon of pepper and 1 pinch of nutmeg and mix, with the measuring beaker in place, with the reverse button/20 seconds/speed setting 1.

TIP 
These leeks go well with roasted meat dishes.

ingredients.name: 225 ml vegetable stock at room temperature

steps.text: Peel 1 onion (60 g) and put it into the blender jug.
Hold the turbo button down for 5 seconds.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Put 4 tbsp butter into the blender jug.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Place a plate on top of the blender jug and weigh 1200 g leek into it.
Trim the leek, cut in half lengthways, wash thoroughly, cut into rings 1 cm thick and put it into the blender jug.
Pour 225 g vegetable stock at room temperature into the blender jug.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Put 3 tbsp flour into the blender jug.
Pour 5 tbsp cream into the blender jug.
Season the creamed leeks with ½ tsp salt, ¼ tsp pepper and 2 pinches of nutmeg.

recipe.name: Cooking pasta (serves 4)
instructions: Pour 2 litres of cold water into the blender jug, add the salt and with the measuring beaker in place, bring to the boil for 12 minutes/speed setting 1/100 °C.
Add the pasta via the filler opening and, the measuring beaker not inserted, cook the pasta with the reverse button/time according to the packet instructions/speed setting 1/100 °C.
Drain pasta in a sieve and serve mixed with butter if desired.

TIP
Spaghetti can also be cooked according to this method. Simply add to the boiling water via the lid opening.

steps.text: Weigh out 600 g pasta and set it to one side.
Pour 2000 g cold water into the blender jug.
Add 1 tbsp salt.
Add the pasta via the filler opening.
In the next step, adjust the time setting to cook the pasta according to the packet instructions.
Drain the pasta in a sieve and serve mixed with 2 tsp butter if desired.

recipe.name: Creamy chicken fricassée with rice (serves 6)
instructions: Put the rice in the cooking pot, and the bay leaves in the blender jug. Place the cooking pot in the blender jug and pour the hot stock over it.
Rinse the chicken breast fillets under cold running water, pat dry and dice into cubes of 2.5 cm in length.

Season the meat all over with ¼ teaspoon of pepper and ½ teaspoon of salt, arrange in the deep and shallow steamer baskets, attach the steamer attachment closed with its lid on, and steam with the steamer button/15 minutes. Put to one side closed with the lid still in place.
Remove the cooking pot from the blender jug and put to one side. Pour the stock out of the blender jug and reserve 300 ml. Remove the bay leaves.
Peel and halve the onions, and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop in the blender jug for 10 seconds/speed setting 5. Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Add the cold butter in chunks and, the measuring beaker not inserted, sauté with the roast button/5 minutes.
Add the flour and reserved stock and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 20 seconds/speed setting 6.
Add the drained capers, cream and lemon juice and, with the measuring beaker in place, cook for 5 minutes/speed setting 2/100 °C. Season with pepper and salt to taste.

Put the meat in a serving dish and pour over the sauce. Serve with the rice.

TIP If you like, you can add pre-cooked pieces of asparagus, peas and button mushrooms to the fricassée.

ingredients.name: 1.2 l hot chicken or vegetable stock

steps.text: Drain 3 tsp capers of their brine and set to one side.
Wash 6 chicken breast fillets (each 170 g) under cold running water and pat them dry.
Dice the chicken breast fillets into 2.5 cm pieces.
Season the cubes of chicken all over with ¼ tsp pepper and ½ tsp salt, then arrange them in the deep steamer basket and the shallow steamer basket.
Put 3 bay leaves into the blender jug.
Insert the cooking pot into the blender jug.
Put 375 g long-grain rice into the cooking pot.
Pour 1200 g hot chicken or vegetable stock over the rice in the blender jug.
Attach the steamer attachment to the blender jug and close the lid.
Remove the deep steamer basket and put it to one side, with the lid still in place.
Remove the cooking pot containing the rice from the blender jug, pour out the stock and reserve. Remove the bay leaves.
Place a container on top of the blender jug and weigh 300 g of the reserved stock into it, then set aside.
Peel and halve 2 onions (150 g) and put them into the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Put 60 g cold cubed butter into the blender jug.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Add 60 g flour to the blender jug.
Pour in the reserved stock (300 g).
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Add 3 tsp drained capers and 1 tbsp lemon juice to the blender jug.
Add 345 g cream.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Put the meat in a serving dish and pour over the sauce. Serve with the rice.

recipe.name: Boiling rice (serves 6)
instructions: Put the rice in the blender jug, sprinkle 1 teaspoon of salt on top and pour 2 litres of cold water into the blender jug above the rice.
With the measuring beaker in place, boil for 30 minutes/speed setting 1/100 °C.
Half way through, stir once with the spatula. Season the rice to taste with 1 teaspoon of butter.

TIP
Cooking time can vary depending on the type of rice.

steps.text: Put 600 g parboiled rice (cooking time: 20 minutes) into the blender jug.
Sprinkle 2 tsp salt on top and pour 2000 g cold water over the rice in the blender jug.
Stir the rice through once with the spatula.
Add butter to taste.

recipe.name: Quark puffs
instructions: Mix the flour with the baking powder and sieve it into the blender jug. Add 200 g sugar, the vanilla sugar and a pinch of salt, and, with the measuring beaker in place, process for 10 seconds/speed setting 5. Place the quark and eggs in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 1 minute/speed setting 4.

Put the remaining sugar into a deep-sided dish. Put the oil in a small, high-sided pot and heat it to 170°C. (It has reached the right temperature when bubbles form around the end of a wooden spoon dipped into the oil and rise to the top.) Using 2 teaspoons, take out little portions of the mixture and carefully lower them into the hot oil. Deep-fry the quark puffs until golden all over. Remove them with a slotted spoon and leave to drain on kitchen paper. While the puffs are still warm, roll them in the sugar and serve straight away, or put them on a wire rack to cool down completely.

TIPS
Mix ¼ teaspoon of cinnamon into the sugar in a deep-sided dish and coat the quark puffs in it. 
They taste great warm or cold.

steps.text: Place a dish on top of the blender jug and weigh 250 g plain flour (type 405) into it.
Add 1 sachet of baking powder (16 g) to the flour in the dish, mix and sieve into the blender jug.
Add 200 g sugar.
Add 1 sachet of vanilla sugar (8 g).
Add 1 pinch of salt.
Put 250 g quark (20% fat) in the blender jug.
Add 2 room-temperature eggs (medium).
Put 100 g sugar in a deep-sided dish.
Put 1000 g rapeseeded oil in a small, high-sided pot and heat it to 170°C.
(It has reached the right temperature when bubbles form around the end of a wooden spoon dipped into the oil and rise to the top.)
Using 2 teaspoons, take out little portions of the mixture and carefully lower them into the hot oil. Deep-fry the quark puffs until golden all over.
Remove them with a slotted spoon and leave to drain on kitchen paper.
While the puffs are still warm, roll them in the sugar and serve straight away, or put them on a wire rack to cool down completely.

recipe.name: Frixuelos (Spanish crêpes)
instructions: Put all of the ingredients in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, process for 30 seconds/speed setting 7.

Add a ladleful of the batter to a hot pan with a little olive oil and fry on both sides to make a very thin crêpe. Remove from the frying pan and repeat the process until you have used all the batter.
Dust with icing sugar or caster sugar and serve drizzled with honey.

TIP
If children are going to be eating the crêpes, too, simply leave out the alcohol.

ingredients.name: 500 ml milk at room temperature (fresh whole milk, 3.5% fat)
grated zest of 1 untreated lemon (80 g)
icing sugar or caster sugar for dusting

steps.text: Put 500 g milk at room temperature (fresh whole milk, 3.5% fat) into the blender jug.
Add 200 g plain flour (type 405).
Add 30 g sugar.
Add 4 eggs (medium).
Add 1 pinch of salt.
Add the grated zest of 1 unwaxed lemon (80 g).
Add 1 tbsp Cognac or aniseed liqueur.
Add a ladleful of the batter to a hot pan with a little olive oil and fry on both sides to make a very thin crêpe.
Remove from the frying pan and repeat the process until you have used all the batter.
Dust with icing sugar or caster sugar and serve drizzled with honey.

recipe.name: Sorrel soup
instructions: Put 500 ml cold water into the blender jug. Place the eggs in the cooking pot, attach the cooking pot to the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, cook for 14 minutes/speed setting 1/120°C. Lift off the cooking pot and refresh the eggs in cold water. Empty out the blender jug, rinse it with cold water and dry.

Wash the sorrel, shake it dry, remove any hard stems and chop the leaves roughly. Place in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, process for 8 seconds/speed setting 8. Decant and put aside.

Peel the onions and cut into quarters. Wash and peel the carrot and cut it into 3-cm pieces. Put the onions and carrot in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 5 seconds/speed setting 6. Use the spatula to scrape the pieces down the inside of the blender jug, then add the oil. The measuring beaker not inserted, sauté with the roast button/3 minutes.

Peel and wash the potatoes and cut them into 2-cm chunks. Put the potatoes and the hot vegetable stock in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, boil for 35 minutes/speed setting 1/100°C. Then, with the measuring beaker in place, blend to a purée for 10 seconds/speed setting 8.
Add 1 teaspoon of salt, 2 pinches of pepper, the sorrel and the soured cream, and, with the measuring beaker in place, process for another 10 seconds/speed setting 6.
Peel the eggs and cut into quarters. Arrange the eggs on plates and serve with the hot soup.

steps.text: Put 500 g water into the blender jug.
Place 8 eggs (medium) in the cooking pot and attach the cooking pot to the blender jug.
Lift off the cooking pot and refresh the eggs in cold water.
Empty out the blender jug, rinse it with cold water and dry.
Wash 2 bunches of sorrel (160 g), shake it dry and remove any hard stems.
Chop the leaves roughly and put them in the blender jug.
Decant and set aside.
Peel and quarter 2 small onions (120 g) and put them in the blender jug.
Wash and peel 1 carrot (100 g), cut it into 3-cm pieces and add to the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Put 1 tbsp rapeseed oil in the blender jug.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Peel and wash 800 g floury potatoes.
Cut the potatoes into 2-cm chunks and put them in the blender jug.
Add 2000 g hot vegetable stock.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Put the chopped sorrel in the blender jug.
Add 1 tsp salt and 2 pinches of pepper.
Add 100 g soured cream (24% fat).
Peel the eggs and cut into quarters. Arrange the eggs on plates and serve with the hot soup.

recipe.name: Chickpea and coconut curry
instructions: Wash the coriander, shake it dry and tear off the leaves. Peel the garlic cloves, ginger and onions. Halve the ginger and onions. Put three-quarters of the coriander leaves into the blender jug along with the garlic cloves, ginger and onions, and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop with the turbo button/2 seconds. Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Add the olive oil, 2 teaspoons of salt, 2 pinches of pepper, and the cumin, cardamom and curry powder, and, the measuring beaker not inserted, sauté with the roast button/4 minutes/120°C.
Add the tomato purée and room-temperature coconut milk, and, with the measuring beaker in place, simmer for 20 minutes/speed setting 1/100°C.

Put the chickpeas in a sieve, rinse with cold water and leave to drain. Wash and halve the cherry tomatoes. Put the chickpeas and tomatoes in the blender jug and, the measuring beaker not inserted, cook with the reverse button/10 minutes/speed setting 1/100°C.
Serve the chickpea and coconut curry with the rest of the coriander scattered over.

TIPS
Vegetables such as broccoli, carrots and leek make great additions to this curry. 
Serve it with rice and naan or pita breads for dipping.

ingredients.name: 400 ml coconut milk at room temperature

steps.text: Wash ½ bunch of coriander, shake it dry and tear off the leaves. Put ¾ of them in the blender jug.
Peel 2 garlic cloves and add them to the blender jug.
Peel 1 piece of ginger (2 cm), cut it in half and add it to the blender jug.
Peel and halve 2 onions (140 g) and add them to the blender jug.
Hold down the turbo button for 2 seconds.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Put 2 tbsp olive oil in the blender jug.
Add 2 tsp salt, 2 pinches of pepper, 1 tsp ground cumin, ½ tsp ground cardamom and 2 tsp curry powder.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Put 100 g tomato purée in the blender jug.
Add 400 g coconut milk at room temperature.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Put 2 tins of chickpeas (800 g drained weight) in a sieve, rinse with cold water and leave to drain.
Wash and halve 300 g cherry tomatoes.
Put the chickpeas and tomatoes into the blender jug.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Serve the chickpea and coconut curry with the rest of the coriander scattered over.

recipe.name: Vegetable hotpot with Mettwurst
instructions: Wash the parsley, shake it dry, tear the leaves from the stalks, put them into the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 8 seconds/speed setting 6. Remove the chopped leaves and rinse out the blender jug.
Peel the potatoes, cut them into 2-cm-thick slices and put them in the cooking pot. Trim and wash the broccoli, cut it into florets and place 200 g of the broccoli florets in the deep steamer basket.

Peel and halve the onion and put it into the blender jug. With the measuring beaker in place, chop for 8 seconds/speed setting 6, then use the spatula to push the mixture down the inside of the blender jug. Add the olive oil and, the measuring beaker not inserted, sauté the onions with the roast button/4 minutes/110°C until glassy and translucent.

Trim, peel and wash the carrots and cut them into 3-cm chunks. Deseed the pepper, remove the stem, wash inside and out, cut into quarters and add to the blender jug. With the measuring beaker in place, chop the vegetables for 7 seconds/speed setting 6. Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the sides of the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop again for 4 seconds/speed setting 6 if necessary. Trim and wash the leek and slice the white part into thin, 3-mm rings. Put the leek rings in the blender jug and add the room-temperature vegetable stock and the spices. Put the potatoes into the cooking pot and attach the pot to the blender jug.
Put the Mettwurst in the shallow steamer basket, attach this to the deep steamer basket, close the lid, put the steamer attachment in place and cook everything with the steamer button.

Remove the steamer attachment and set it to one side. Transfer the contents of the blender jug to a large serving bowl and add the potatoes and broccoli. Cut the Mettwurst into 0.5-cm-thick slices and add them to the hotpot. Carefully mix everything together, season to taste with salt and pepper, and serve with the parsley scattered over.

TIPS
You can change up the vegetables depending on the season and your personal preference. 
You could use frankfurters, kabanos, chorizo, polony or gammon instead of the Mettwurst.

ingredients.name: 1 l vegetable stock at room temperature

steps.text: Wash ½ bunch of flat-leaf parsley, shake it dry, tear the leaves from the stalks and put them into the blender jug.
Decant the parsley and rinse out the blender jug.
Peel and wash 4 medium-sized waxy potatoes (300 g).
Cut the potatoes into 2-cm dice and put them in the cooking pot.
Trim and wash 1 small head of broccoli (300 g) and cut it into bite-size florets.
Place 200 g broccoli florets in the deep steamer basket.
Peel and halve 1 onion (80 g) and put it into the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Put 30 g olive oil in the blender jug.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Trim, peel and wash 2 large carrots (200 g).
Cut the carrots into 3-cm-long pieces and put them into the blender jug.
Deseed 1 small red pepper (100 g), remove the stem and wash it inside and out.
Cut the pepper into quarters and add to the blender jug.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Carry out the next step if necessary; otherwise, skip it.
Trim and wash 1 small leek (120 g).
Slice the white and pale green parts into thin, 3-mm rings and put them in the blender jug.
Add 1000 g room-temperature vegetable stock to the blender jug.
Put ¼ tsp salt, 1 big pinch of pepper and 2 pinches of nutmeg into the blender jug.
Put the potatoes into the cooking pot and attach the pot to the blender jug.
Put 2 Mettwurst (200 g) into the shallow steamer basket.
Attach this to the deep steamer basket, close the lid and put the steamer attachment in place.
Remove the steamer attachment and set it to one side.
Transfer the contents of the blender jug to a large serving bowl and add the potatoes and broccoli.
Cut the Mettwurst into 0.5-cm-thick slices and add them to the hotpot.
Carefully mix everything together, season to taste with salt and pepper, and serve with the parsley scattered over.

recipe.name: Classic cheesecake
instructions: Grease the springform tin with butter and dust with breadcrumbs. Pre-heat the oven to 170°C.

To make the base, put the cubed butter, sugar, egg and a pinch of salt into the blender jug. Mix the flour and baking powder together, sieve it over the butter and sugar mixture, and, with the measuring beaker in place, knead with the knead button/2 minutes. If the mixture is too dry, add 1 tbsp cold water and, with the measuring beaker in place, knead it in for 20 seconds/speed setting 4.
Roll the dough out on a floured worktop so that it is the size of the springform tin, plus an extra 5 cm. Line the prepared tin with the dough. Clean out the blender jug.

To make the quark filling, wash the lemon in hot water, dry it and zest half of the peel. You can use the rest of the lemon for something else. Put the lemon zest in the blender jug together with the sugar, vanilla sugar, low-fat quark, eggs, cream at room temperature and soft, cubed butter. With the measuring beaker in place, process for 2 minutes/speed setting 3. Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug, then, with the measuring beaker in place, process for another 20 seconds/speed setting 4.

Pour the mixture onto the base. Bake the cheesecake for 1 hour, then cover with greaseproof paper and bake for another 10 minutes. Leave it to rest in the oven, with the door still closed, for 10 minutes, then take it out and leave to cool for 30 minutes. Chill the cheesecake in the fridge for 5 hours.

TIP
Take the cheesecake out of the fridge at least 30 minutes before serving. 
To make a raspberry version, put half of the quark mixture into the tin first, then add 300 g raspberries on top, before pouring in the rest of the filling. Follow the rest of the recipe as described.

ingredients.name: ½ sachet of baking powder (8 g)
400 ml cream at room temperature (30% fat)
soft butter and breadcrumbs for the tin

steps.text: Grease the springform tin with butter and dust with breadcrumbs.
Pre-heat the oven to 170°C (top and bottom heat).
Put 80 g soft cubed butter into the blender jug.
Add 90 g sugar.
Add 1 cold egg (medium).
Add 1 pinch of salt.
Place a dish on the blender jug and weigh 220 g plain flour (type 405) into it.
Add ½ sachet of baking powder (8 g) and mix.
Sieve the flour and baking powder mixture into the blender jug.
If the mixture is too dry, add 1 tbsp cold water and carry out the next step; otherwise, skip it.
Roll the dough out on a floured worktop so that it is the size of the springform tin, plus an extra 5 cm.
Line the prepared tin with the dough.
Clean out the blender jug.
Wash 1 unwaxed lemon (80 g) in hot water, then dry.
Zest half the lemon and add the zest to the blender jug.
You can use the rest of the lemon for something else.
Put 280 g sugar into the blender jug.
Add 1 sachet (8 g) of vanilla sugar.
Add 2 sachets (74 g) of custard powder.
Add 1250 g low-fat curd cheese (0.2% fat).
Add 4 eggs (medium) at room temperature.
Add 400 g cream (30% fat) at room temperature.
Add 90 g soft cubed butter.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Pour the mixture onto the base.
Bake the cheesecake for 1 hour, then cover with greaseproof paper and bake for another 10 minutes.
Leave it to rest in the oven, with the door still closed, for 10 minutes, then take it out and leave to cool for 30 minutes.
Chill the cheesecake in the fridge for 5 hours.

recipe.name: Veggie doner kebabs
instructions: Wash the mint, shake it dry and tear the leaves from their stems. Peel the garlic cloves and put them into the blender jug along with the mint leaves. With the measuring beaker in place, chop with the turbo button/1 second, then use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.

Add the yoghurt, 1 teaspoon of salt, 1 big pinch of pepper and the cubed feta and, with the measuring beaker in place, blend for 20 seconds/speed setting 3. Transfer the yoghurt and feta sauce to another vessel and clean out the blender jug.

Trim and wash the pepper and courgette (wash the inside of the pepper, too) and cut them into 2-cm-thick pieces. Put the pepper, courgette and olive oil in the blender jug and, the measuring beaker not inserted, stew with the roast button/120°C.

Peel and halve the onion and cut it into 1-cm strips. Trim and peel the carrots and cut them into slices 5 cm long and 0.5 cm thick. Add the onion, carrots, 1 teaspoon of salt, cumin, chilli flakes and paprika to the vegetables in the blender jug and, the measuring beaker not inserted, stew with the roast button/12 minutes/120°C. Warm the pita breads in the oven or a toaster, according to the packet instructions.
Wash and trim the red cabbage, cucumber and tomato. Cut the red cabbage into 1-cm-wide strips. Cut the cucumber and tomato into 2-cm dice.
Spread the inside of the pita breads with the yoghurt and feta sauce. Stuff with the red cabbage, tomato, cucumber, cooked vegetables and 3 tortilla chips each and serve.

ingredientsBases.name: FOR THE YOGHURT AND FETA SAUCE

ingredients.name: 1 piece of red cabbage (100 g, or drained red cabbage from a jar)

steps.text: Wash ½ bunch of mint, shake dry, tear the leaves from their stems and put them in the blender jug.
Peel 2 garlic cloves and add them to the blender jug.
Hold down the turbo button for 1 second.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Put 200 g yoghurt (3.5% fat) in the blender jug.
Add 1 tsp salt and 1 big pinch of pepper.
Add 150 g cubed feta (48% fat).
Decant the yoghurt and feta sauce and clean out the blender jug.
Remove the seeds from 1 yellow pepper (150 g) and wash it inside and out.
Cut the pepper into 2-cm pieces and put them in the blender jug.
Trim and wash 1 small courgette (150 g), cut it into 2-cm dice and add to the blender jug.
Add 1 tbsp olive oil.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Peel and halve 1 red onion (100 g).
Cut the onion into 1-cm strips and put them in the blender jug.
Trim and peel 2 carrots (150 g), cut into slices 5 cm long and 0.5 cm thick, and add.
Add 1 tsp salt, 3 pinches of ground cumin, 3 pinches of chilli flakes and 3 pinches of paprika.
Warm 4 pita breads in the oven or a toaster, according to the packet instructions.
Wash and trim 1 piece of red cabbage (100 g) and cut it into 1-cm-wide strips.
Wash and trim 1 piece of cucumber (100 g) and cut it into 2-cm dice.
Wash and trim 1 tomato (100 g) and cut it into 2-cm dice.
Spread the inside of 4 pita breads with the yoghurt and feta sauce.
Stuff with the red cabbage, tomato, cucumber, cooked vegetables and 3 tortilla chips each and serve.

recipe.name: Breadcrumbs
instructions: Cut the bread into 3-cm cubes, put them into the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 20 seconds/speed setting 8. Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug and repeat the process if required.
Decant the breadcrumbs into a jar and store in a dry place.
If you're not going to be using the breadcrumbs immediately, put them on a baking tray and leave them to dry at room temperature for another 24 hours before putting them into their storage container.

TIPS
You can use the breadcrumbs as a coating for fish, meat or vegetables. To do this, season the fish, meat or veg in the usual way, then coat them first in some beaten egg and then in the breadcrumbs. Press in the breadcrumbs lightly and fry the coated item in hot fat in a pan. 
You can also add your favourite flavours to your breadcrumbs, for instance by putting some cheese or fresh herbs in with the cubed bread. 
The breadcrumbs shouldn’t have a powdery consistency, but should retain some texture.

ingredients.name: 100 g dry bread roll or day-old bread

steps.text: Cut a dry bread roll or 100 g day-old bread into 3-cm cubes and put them into the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug. Carry out the next step if necessary; otherwise, skip it.
If you're not going to be using the breadcrumbs immediately, put them on a baking tray and leave them to dry at room temperature for another 24 hours.
Then decant the breadcrumbs into a jar and store in a dry place.

recipe.name: Green sauce
instructions: Having discarded any wilted herbs, wash and dry the good ones, remove any thick stems and tear the leaves from their stems. Cut the chives into pieces, put the rest of the herbs in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 10 seconds/speed setting 6. Use the spatula to scrape the herbs down the inside of the blender jug and repeat the process if required. Decant the herbs and rinse out the blender jug.

Pour 500 ml lukewarm water into the blender jug, insert the cooking pot, put the eggs in it and, with the measuring beaker in place, cook for 14 minutes/speed setting 1/120°C. Remove the cooking pot, refresh the eggs in cold water, then peel them. Empty out the blender jug and rinse with cold water.

Separate the yolks of the hard-boiled eggs from the whites. Put the egg yolks, mustard and sunflower oil into the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 20 seconds/speed setting 5 until creamy.

Put all of the herbs, natural yoghurt and cooked egg whites into the blender jug, add the lemon juice and, with the measuring beaker in place, process for 30 seconds/speed setting 4. Season with salt and pepper, and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix again for 20 seconds/speed setting 1.

TIP
This green sauce goes especially well with boiled potatoes, poached eggs and asparagus.

ingredients.name: 2 bunches of mixed herbs (e.g. parsley, borage, cress, sorrel, chervil, salad burnet, chives)

steps.text: Take 2 bunches of mixed herbs (e.g. parsley, borage, cress, sorrel, chervil, salad burnet, chives). Discard any wilted leaves, wash and dry.
Remove any thick stems and tear the leaves from their stems.
Cut the chives into fine pieces. Put the other herbs into the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape the herbs down the inside of the blender jug. Carry out the next step if necessary; otherwise, skip it.
Decant the herbs and rinse out the blender jug.
Put 500 g lukewarm water in the blender jug.
Attach the cooking pot to the blender jug.
Put 6 eggs (medium) in the cooking pot.
Remove the cooking pot, refresh the eggs in cold water, then peel them.
Empty out the blender jug and rinse with cold water.
Separate the yolks of the hard-boiled eggs from the whites.
Put the yolks into the blender jug.
Add 1½ tsp mild mustard.
Add 100 g sunflower oil.
Put all of the herbs into the blender jug.
Add 400 g natural yoghurt (3.5% fat).
Add 400 g soured cream (10% fat).
Add 50 g lemon juice.
Season to taste with salt and pepper.

recipe.name: Carbonara sauce
instructions: Cut the pecorino into pieces, put it into the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop finely for 20 seconds/speed setting 10. Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.

Add the egg and the egg yolks to the pecorino in the blender jug, add 2 big pinches of pepper and, with the measuring beaker in place, process everything for 20 seconds/speed setting 5 to form an even-textured mixture. Transfer the mixture to another bowl and clean out the blender jug.

Cut the bacon into 0.5-cm pieces or 0.5-cm-wide strips, put them in the blender jug and, the measuring beaker not inserted, fry with the roast button until slightly crisp. Transfer the bacon to kitchen paper and leave to cool for 10 minutes.
Add the bacon to the bowl with the egg mixture and mix together. Use the carbonara sauce straight away, e.g. by pouring it over hot drained pasta.

INFO
Carbonara sauce is usually added to spaghetti that has been freshly cooked and drained. Mix everything together quickly and serve immediately, with Pecorino and pepper scattered over the top, if you like. 
This carbonara sauce also tastes great with freshly cooked courgetti. 
Made the traditional Italian way, it does not contain any cream whatsoever.

steps.text: Remove the rind from 100 g Pecorino (38% fat), cut it into pieces and put in the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Put 1 very fresh egg (medium) and 4 very fresh egg yolks (medium) into the blender jug.
Add 2 big pinches of pepper.
Decant into a large bowl and clean out the blender jug.
Cut 150 g streaky bacon into 0.5-cm pieces or 0.5-cm-wide strips.
Put the bacon pieces or strips into the blender jug.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Transfer the bacon to kitchen paper and leave to cool for 10 minutes.
Add the bacon to the bowl with the egg mixture and mix together.
Use the carbonara sauce straight away, e.g. by pouring it over hot drained pasta.

recipe.name: Bolognese sauce
instructions: Remove the rind from the Parmesan, cut the cheese into 2-cm chunks, put it into the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop finely with the turbo button/10 seconds. Decant into another container and rinse out the blender jug.

Peel the onions and garlic cloves and cut the onions into half. Wash, peel and halve the carrots. Wash and trim the celery and cut into 4-cm pieces. Put the vegetables into the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 10 seconds/speed setting 5. Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for another 7 seconds/speed setting 5.
Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug again, then add 1 tablespoon of olive oil and, the measuring beaker not inserted, sauté with the roast button/4 minutes.
Add 400 g minced meat and, the measuring beaker not inserted, brown it with the roast button. Decant the contents of the blender jug and put aside. Clean out the blender jug.

Cut the bacon into large chunks, put into the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 8 seconds/speed setting 9. Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug, add 1 tablespoon olive oil, and, the measuring beaker not inserted, sauté with the roast button/5 minutes.

Add the rest of the minced meat and, the measuring beaker not inserted, brown it with the roast button. Pour in 200 ml warm stock and, the measuring beaker not inserted, boil down with the roast button/10 minutes.

Put the sugar, tomato purée, vegetable and minced meat mixture, chopped tomatoes and the rest of the warm stock into the blender jug, season with paprika, cinnamon, ½ teaspoon of the pepper, and the teaspoon of thyme, and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix everything with the reverse button/30 seconds/speed setting 2. The measuring beaker not inserted, simmer with the reverse button/45 minutes/speed setting 1/95°C.
Season with salt and ½ teaspoon of pepper and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix in with the reverse button/20 seconds/speed setting 2.

TIPS
If no children are eating with you, replace 200 ml of the stock with dry white wine. 
Bolognese sauce is typically served with fresh pasta or in a lasagne (search for a lasagne recipe from our database). It also makes a great pizza topping or can be served with roasted Hokkaido pumpkin, as a filling for courgettes or roasted peppers, as an accompaniment to cauliflower and broccoli, or in a potato gratin.

ingredients.name: 800 g mixed beef and pork mince
600 ml warm vegetable or beef stock

steps.text: Remove the rind from 100 g Parmesan (32% fat), cut into 2-cm chunks and put in the blender jug.
Hold the turbo button down for 10 seconds.
Decant into another container and rinse out the blender jug.
Peel and halve 2 onions (100 g), peel 2 garlic cloves, and put both in the blender jug.
Wash, peel and halve 2 carrots (150 g) and add them to the blender jug.
Wash and trim 3 sticks of celery (150 g), cut into 4-cm pieces and add to the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Put 1 tbsp olive oil in the blender jug.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Put 400 g mixed beef and pork mince in the blender jug.
Decant the contents of the blender jug and set aside.
Clean out the blender jug.
Cut 150 g streaky bacon into large pieces and put them in the blender jug.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Put 1 tbsp olive oil into the blender jug.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Put 400 g mixed beef and pork mince into the blender jug.
Put 200 g warm stock in the blender jug.
Add 2 tsp sugar to the blender jug.
Add 6 tbsp tomato purée.
Add the vegetable and minced meat mixture.
Add 800 g tinned chopped tomatoes.
Add 400 g warm vegetable stock.
Add 2 tsp sweet paprika, 1 pinch of cinnamon, ½ tsp pepper and 2 tbsp dried thyme.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Season to taste with salt and ½ tsp pepper.

recipe.name: Quattro formaggi cheese sauce
instructions: Remove the rind from the provolone and Parmesan, cut into 3-cm chunks and put into the blender jug. With the measuring beaker in place, chop for 8 seconds/speed setting 8. Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.

Remove the rind from the Taleggio and Gorgonzola and cut it into 3-cm chunks. Put both in the blender jug, pour in the room-temperature vegetable stock and, with the measuring beaker in place, melt the cheese for 10 minutes/speed setting 2/80°C.

Add 2 pinches of pepper and the room-temperature cream, and, with the measuring beaker in place, process for 10 seconds/speed setting 5. With the measuring beaker in place, warm the cheese sauce through for another 5 minutes/speed setting 3/90°C.

TIPS
If you’d like a creamier, heartier version, replace the Gorgonzola with Mascarpone (80% fat). 
If you’d prefer the sauce to be runnier, simply add a shot of milk (fresh, 3.5% fat) at room temperature during the final step. 
This cheese sauce goes well with freshly cooked pasta, gnocchi and spinach balls (you can find the recipe in our database).

ingredients.name: 100 ml vegetable stock at room temperature
100 ml cream at room temperature (30% fat)

steps.text: Remove the rind from 150 g provolone (44% fat).
Cut the cheese into 3-cm chunks and put them into the blender jug.
Remove the rind from 125 g Parmesan (32% fat).
Cut into 3-cm chunks and put them in the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Remove the rind from 150 g Taleggio (46% fat).
Cut into 3-cm chunks and put them in the blender jug.
Remove the rind from 200 g Gorgonzola dolce (48% fat).
Cut into 3-cm chunks and put them in the blender jug.
Add 100 g vegetable stock at room temperature.
Add 2 pinches of pepper to the blender jug.
Add 100 g cream (30% fat) at room temperature.

recipe.name: Schupfnudeln (potato dumpling fingers)
instructions: Put 500 ml cold water into the blender jug. Peel, wash and halve the potatoes, put them into the cooking pot, attach this to the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, steam with the steamer button/15 minutes.
Take out the cooking pot, tip the water out of the blender jug, put the potatoes into the blender jug and leave to cool a little for 10 minutes.

Add the flour, cornflour, egg yolk, 1 teaspoon of salt and 1 big pinch of nutmeg, and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix with the knead button. Decant the mixture into a bowl and leave to stand for 10 minutes. Clean out the blender jug.

Using a teaspoon, spoon walnut-sized pieces out of the dumpling dough and roll them out on a floured surface. Ensure that the potato dumpling fingers are slightly fatter in the middle and thinner at the ends.

Arrange the dumplings in the deep steamer basket and shallow steamer basket. Put 1 litre of water at room temperature in the blender jug, insert the deep steamer basket with the shallow steamer basket inserted, put the lid on, and cook the finger dumplings with the steamer button.
Heat the butter and vegetable oil in a pan, then fry the dumpling fingers until golden brown.

TIP
These potato dumplings are especially good with mushroom ragout.

steps.text: Put 500 g cold water in the blender ug.
Peel, wash and halve 600 g small floury potatoes and put them in the cooking pot.
Attach the cooking pot to the blender jug.
Take out the cooking pot, tip the water out of the blender jug, put the potatoes into the blender jug and leave to cool a little for 10 minutes.
Put 130 g plain flour (type 405) in the blender jug.
Add 80 g cornflour.
Add 1 egg yolk (medium).
Add 1 tsp salt and 1 big pinch of nutmeg.
Decant the mixture into a bowl and leave to stand for 10 minutes.
Clean out the blender jug.
Using a teaspoon, spoon walnut-sized pieces out of the dumpling dough and roll them out on a floured surface.
Ensure that the potato dumpling fingers are slightly fatter in the middle and thinner at the ends.
Arrange the dumplings in the deep steamer basket and shallow steamer basket.
Put 1000 g water at room temperature in the blender jug.
Insert the deep steamer basket with the shallow steamer basket inserted and put the lid on.
Heat 1 tbsp butter and 2 tbsp vegetable oil in a pan, then fry the dumpling fingers until golden brown.

recipe.name: Polenta
instructions: Put 1.5 litres of lukewarm water, 1 level teaspoon salt of and the olive oil in the blender jug, sprinkle in the polenta and, with the measuring beaker in place, cook for 10 minutes/speed setting 2/90°C. Then, with the measuring beaker in place, cook for another 10 minutes/speed setting 3/90°C.

Leave the polenta to stand in the blender jug for 10 minutes. Meanwhile, pre-heat the oven to 200°C. Spread out the mixture evenly on a baking tray lined with greaseproof paper and bake it in the hot oven for 20 minutes.
Take the polenta out of the oven, leave it to cool down briefly, then cut it into pieces and serve.

TIPS
If you like, with the measuring beaker in place, stir 1 tablespoon of freshly chopped herbs into the polenta after the cooking time is up for 30 seconds/speed setting 3. 
Pan-frying the polenta in butter before serving makes it even more delicious. 
Polenta goes well with Hungarian vegetable stew and lentil casseroles, but also makes a great snack as part of a party buffet. Cut the polenta into bite-size pieces, pan-fry in butter, leave to cool and serve with a dollop of herb-flavoured cream cheese and scattered with some spring onion rings or radish slices.

steps.text: Put 1500 g lukewarm water into the blender jug.
Add 1 level tsp salt.
Add 2 tsp olive oil.
Sprinkle in 375 g instant polenta.
Leave the polenta to stand in the blender jug for 10 minutes.
Pre-heat the oven to 200°C (top and bottom heat).
Spread out the mixture evenly on a baking tray lined with greaseproof paper and bake it in the hot oven for 20 minutes.
Take the polenta out of the oven, leave it to cool down briefly, then cut it into pieces and serve.

recipe.name: Frikadellen (German meat patties)
instructions: Soak the bread roll in lukewarm water in a covered bowl.

Meanwhile, peel and halve the onions and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop them finely in the blender jug with the turbo button/2 seconds. Use the spatula to scrape the pieces down the inside of the blender jug and then repeat the process if necessary. Use the spatula to scrape the pieces down the inside of the blender jug.

Squeeze the bread out thoroughly and add it to the blender jug with the rest of the Frikadellen ingredients. With the measuring beaker in place, process everything for 45 seconds/speed setting 3. Decant the minced meat mixture and, with moist hands, shape it into 10 patties.
Heat a little oil in a frying pan and fry the Frikadellen on both sides until done.

TIPS
Creamed kohlrabi, potato salad and cucumber salad all go with the Frikadellen. 
If you don’t have a day-old bread roll to hand, you can use 3 tablespoons of breadcrumbs instead. Simply put them in the blender jug with the rest of the Frikadellen ingredients, add 1–2 tablespoons of water to the blender jug and continue with the recipe as described.

ingredients.name: 500 g mixed beef and pork mince

steps.text: Soak 1 day-old bread roll (40 g) in lukewarm water in a covered bowl.
Peel and halve 2 small onions (100 g) and put them into the blender jug.
Hold down the turbo button for 2 seconds.
Use the spatula to scrape the pieces down the inside of the blender jug.
Carry out the next step if necessary; otherwise, skip it.
Hold down the turbo button for 2 seconds.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Squeeze the bread out thoroughly and add it to the blender jug.
Add 500 g mixed beef and pork mince.
Add 1 tsp mustard.
Add 1 egg (small).
Add 1 tsp salt, 2 pinches of pepper and 1 pinch of hot paprika.
Decant the minced meat mixture and, with moist hands, shape it into 10 patties.
Heat a little oil in a frying pan and fry the Frikadellen on both sides until done.

recipe.name: Kimchi
instructions: Remove the outer leaves of the Chinese cabbage, cut out the stalk and cu the cabbage lengthways into quarters, then into 5-cm-wide strips.

Put half of the Chinese cabbage in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place chop for 2 seconds/speed setting 5. Transfer to a large bowl. Put the remaining Chinese cabbage in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 2 seconds/speed setting 5. Decant into the bowl.
Add the salt to the cabbage in the bowl, mix thoroughly and cover with cold water. Leave to infuse for 2 hours.
Using the deep steamer basket as a sieve, drain the Chinese cabbage. Rinse with cold water and leave to drain thoroughly,

Peel the garlic cloves and put them into the blender jug. Peel the garlic, cut it into 3-mm slices and add to the blender jug along with the sugar. With the measuring beaker in place, chop with the turbo button/2 seconds. Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug and repeat the process.

Add the gochujang and fish sauce, and, with the measuring beaker in place, process for 5 seconds/speed setting 6. Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug and repeat the process. Decant the spice paste.

Trim, wash and peel the carrots and cut them into 3-cm pieces. Wash and peel the radish and cut into 2 x 3-cm pieces. Put the carrots and radish into the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 5 seconds/speed setting 6. Add the vegetables to the spice paste.
Trim and wash the spring onions and shake them dry, then cut into 5-mm slices.

Squeeze out the Chinese cabbage thoroughly and put it in a large bowl with the spring onions. Add the spice paste and vegetables and mix everything together well. It’s best to wear gloves due to the fieriness of the spices.

Decant the Chinese cabbage into 2 screw-top jars and put on the lids. Leave to ferment for 3 days at room temperature. Open the jars once a day to let the gases escape, then push the cabbage back down.

TIPS
Kimchi will keep in the fridge for up to 3 months. During that time, it will become even hotter. 
In Korea, kimchi is served with almost every meal. It’s particularly good in sandwiches, on Asian-style burgers, in soups or mixed in with stir-fried vegetables. Koreans prefer to eat kimchi on its own with rice. 
For an even more intense flavour, try replacing the fish sauce with shrimp paste.

ingredients.name: 1 glass dish with a sealable lid (holds approx. 1.6 litres)

steps.text: Remove the outer leaves of 1 Chinese cabbage (750 g), quarter lengthways and remove the stalk.
Cut the cabbage into 5-cm-wide strips.
Put half of the cabbage into the blender jug.
Transfer to a large bowl.
Put the rest of the cabbage into the blender jug.
Decant into a bowl.
Add 3 tbsp salt to the cabbage in the bowl, mix thoroughly and cover with cold water. Leave to infuse for 2 hours.
Use the deep steamer basket as a sieve to drain the Chinese cabbage. Rinse with cold water and leave to drain thoroughly,
Peel 6 garlic cloves and put them in the blender jug.
Peel 1 piece of ginger (30 g), cut it into 3-mm slices and add to the blender jug.
Add 25 g sugar.
Hold down the turbo button for 2 seconds.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Hold down the turbo button for 2 seconds.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Put 2 tbsp fish sauce in the blender jug.
Add 3 tbsp gochujang (Korean chilli paste).
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.
Decant the spice paste.
Trim and wash 3 carrots (300 g) and cut them into 3-cm pieces.
Wash and peel 150 g white radish and cut it into 2 x 3 cm pieces.
Put the carrots and radish into the blender jug.
Add the vegetables to the spice paste.
Trim and wash 2 spring onions (50 g) and shake them dry, then cut into 5-mm slices.
Squeeze out the Chinese cabbage thoroughly and put it in a large bowl with the spring onions.
Add the spice paste and vegetables and mix everything together well. It’s best to wear gloves due to the fieriness of the spices.
Decant the Chinese cabbage into 2 screw-top jars and put on the lids. Leave to ferment for 3 days at room temperature.
Open the jars once a day to let the gases escape, then push the cabbage back down.

recipe.name: Spinach and celery smoothie
instructions: Wash and dry the apple and celery. Quarter and core the apple. Trim the celery sticks and cut into 3-cm-long pieces. Wash the spinach and pat dry. Remove any hard leaf veins. Peel and halve the banana.

Put everything into the blender jug and add 300 ml cold water. With the measuring beaker in place, process for 1 minute/speed setting 10. Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug and repeat the process if required.
Decant the smoothie into glasses and serve immediately.

TIP
You could replace the water in this recipe with soy or oat milk. 
You can adjust the temperature and consistency of the smoothie to your taste by adding ice cubes or mineral water.

steps.text: Wash and dry 1 large green apple (220 g).
Quarter and core the apple and put it in the blender jug.
Trim 2 sticks of celery (100 g), cut them into 3-cm-long pieces and add to the blender jug.
Wash 100 g fresh spinach and pat it dry.
Remove any hard leaf veins and add the spinach to the blender jug.
Peel and halve 1 banana (130 g) and add it to the blender jug.
Put 300 g cold water in the blender jug.
If you like, use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug and carry out the next step; otherwise, skip it.
Decant the smoothie into glasses and serve immediately.

recipe.name: Margherita pizza (4 pizzas)
instructions: To make the yeast dough, put 300 ml water at room temperature and the sugar into the blender jug. Crumble the yeast into it and, the measuring beaker not inserted, mix together for 2 minutes/speed setting 1/37 °C. Then add the flour, 2 tablespoons of olive oil and 1 teaspoon of salt and, with the measuring beaker in place, knead with the knead button/2 minutes to make a smooth dough. The dough should fall easily off your hands. If necessary, knead in a little more flour or water until it reaches the right consistency.

Take the dough out of the blender jug, shape into a ball and put in a bowl covered by a tea towel. Put in a warm place and allow to prove for at least 1 hour until it has doubled in volume. Clean the blender jug.

To make the tomato sauce, put the sieved tomatoes, the tomato purée, the oregano, ½ teaspoon of salt, ¼ teaspoon of pepper and 2 pinches of sugar in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix well for 20 seconds/speed setting 4.
Cut the mozzarella into thin slices. Pre-heat the oven to 240 °C. Brush two baking sheets with 1 tablespoon of olive oil each.

Knead the dough through again thoroughly by hand, divide into 4 portions and roll out each one into a circle. Place the dough bases on the baking sheets, spread the tomato sauce on top and arrange the mozzarella on top of the sauce. Finally, drizzle the remaining olive oil on top and put the baking sheets in the oven in turn for 15 minutes each, until the pizzas are golden.

VARIATIONS
Using Pizza Margherita as a base, you can make popular pizza classics by adding extra ingredients. Then put 50 g mozzarella on each pizza.
Pizza salami: Put 7 slices of salami on top of the tomato sauce.
Pizza funghi: Put 100 g sliced button mushrooms on top of the tomato sauce.
Pizza spinaci: Cook 130 g frozen spinach according to packet instructions, season with salt and pepper to taste and arrange on top of the tomato sauce.
Pizza Hawaii: Cut 3 slices of pineapple into pieces and arrange with two slices of cooked ham (cut into pieces) on top of the tomato sauce.
Pizza pepperoni: Put half of each of a red, yellow and green pepper cut into strips on top of the tomato sauce.
Pizza cipolla: Peel one large onion, cut into rings and arrange on top of the tomato sauce.
Pizza prosciutto: Cut 2 slices of cooked ham into pieces and arrange on top of the tomato sauce.
And, of course, you can combine all the specified ingredients according to your taste and mood!

ingredients.name: plain flour (type 405) for the work surface

steps.text: Put 300 g lukewarm water into the blender jug.
Add 1 tsp sugar.
Crumble in 20 g fresh yeast.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Put 500 g flour into the blender jug.
Add 4 tbsp olive oil and 1 tsp salt.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
The dough should fall easily off your hands. If necessary, knead in a little more flour or water and then carry out the next step; otherwise skip it.
Take the dough out of the blender jug, shape into a ball and put in a bowl.
Cover with a tea towel and leave to prove for at least 1 hour in a warm place until it has doubled in volume.
Thoroughly clean the blender jug.
Put 12 tbsp tomato passata, 2 tbsp tomato purée, 2 tsp crushed oregano, ½ tsp salt, ¼ tsp pepper and 2 pinches of sugar into the blender jug.
Slice 200 g mozzarella (45% fat) and set to one side.
Pre-heat the oven to 240 °C (top and bottom heat).
Brush 2 baking sheets with 1 tbsp olive oil each.
Knead the dough through again thoroughly by hand, divide into four and roll out each piece into a circle.
Place the dough bases on the baking sheets, spread over the tomato sauce and arrange the mozzarella on top.
Drizzle over 2 tbsp olive oil and bake the pizzas in 2 batches for 15 minutes each until golden.

recipe.name: Spelt bread (2 loaves)
instructions: Put the flour, 2 teaspoons of salt, the dried yeast, honey, oil and 600 ml lukewarm water in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, knead with the knead button. Add 100 g of the seeds and stir together with the reverse button/10 seconds/speed setting 3. The dough should still be a little sticky but should come away easily from the sides of the jug.

Lightly grease two loaf tins and sprinkle with bran or breadcrumbs. Put equal amounts of dough in each tin and hit the tins on the table several times so that the dough moves into the corners. Cover with clean tea towels and allow the dough to rise in an evenly warm place for 1 hour until it completely fills the tin.

Pre-heat the oven to 200 °C.  Beat the egg yolks and milk and brush the upper surface of the dough with it. Sprinkle with the remaining seeds and bake the loaves in the hot oven for 40 minutes. The loaves should sound hollow when you hit them with a spoon. Then you will know that they are ready.
Remove the loaves from the oven, allow to cool briefly in the tins, then turn them out of the tins and allow to cool completely.
TIPS This loaf can also be baked with rye flour (type 1150) or dark wheat flour (type 1050). Other seeds can be used, as desired.

ingredients.name: 140 g seeds if desired (e.g. linseeds, sesame seeds, sunflower seeds or pumpkin seeds)
fat and bran or breadcrumbs for the tin

steps.text: Put 800 g wholemeal spelt flour into the blender jug.
Add 2 tsp salt, 2 sachets dried yeast, 2 tsp honey and 2 tbsp olive oil.
Add 600 g lukewarm water.
Put 100 g seeds into the blender jug.
Lightly grease two loaf tins and sprinkle with bran or breadcrumbs.
Put the dough into the tins and hit the tins on the table several times so that the dough moves into the corners.
Cover the tins with a clean tea towel each and allow the dough to rise in an evenly warm place for 1 hour until it completely fills the tins.
Pre-heat the oven to 200 °C (top and bottom heat).
Beat 2 egg yolks (medium) with 2 tbsp milk in a small bowl and brush the upper surface of the dough with it.
Sprinkle with 40 g seeds and bake the loaves in the hot oven for 40 minutes.
You will know that the loaves are ready when it sounds hollow when you hit it with a spoon.
Remove the loaves from the oven, allow to cool briefly in their tins, then turn them out of the tins and allow to cool completely.

recipe.name: Sweet yeast dough (490 g)
instructions: Pour the milk at room temperature, yeast and sugar into the blender jug, and with the measuring beaker in place, heat up for 3 minutes/speed setting 1/37 °C. Add the butter in chunks, egg, flour and 2 pinches of salt, and with the measuring beaker in place, knead with the knead button/2 minutes to make a smooth dough.
Put the yeast dough in a bowl, cover and allow to prove in a warm place for 30 minutes, until the volume has doubled.

NOTE
Sweet yeast dough is suitable as a base for fruit cake, brioches, plaited yeast loaves, cinnamon buns, and much more.

TIP
The lower the yeast content and the longer the proving time, the better the taste and consistency of the baked goods will be. If there is enough time, you can use half the quantity of yeast with at least twice the proving time.

ingredients.name: 110 ml milk at room temperature (UHT milk, 3.5% fat)
½ cube of fresh yeast (20 g) or 1 sachet of dried yeast (7 g)

steps.text: Pour 110 g milk into the blender jug.
Add 35 g sugar.
Add ½ cube fresh yeast (20 g) or 1 sachet of dry yeast (7 g).
Cut 40 g butter into pieces and add to the blender jug.
Add 250 g flour.
Add 1 egg (small) and 2 pinches of salt.
Transfer the dough to a bowl, cover and allow to rise in a warm place for at least 30 minutes, or until doubled in volume.

recipe.name: Eggnog (2 bottles)
instructions: First, allow all ingredients to reach room temperature for 30 minutes.
Put the sugar into the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, pulverise for 10 seconds/speed setting 8. Repeat the process if necessary.

ingredients.name: 2 sachets of vanilla sugar (8 g each)
500 ml white rum or Korn (grain spirit)

steps.text: Keep all of the ingredients at room temperature for 30 minutes.
Put 500 g sugar in the blender jug.
Follow the next step if necessary; otherwise, skip this step.
Put 12 egg yolks (medium) and 2 sachets vanilla sugar into the blender jug.
Add 250 g cream.
Add 500 g white rum or Korn.
Use a funnel to pour the still-hot eggnog into the bottles and seal. Store in a cool place.

recipe.name: Spicy yeast dough (455 g)
instructions: Pour the milk at room temperature, yeast and sugar into the blender jug, and with the measuring beaker in place, heat up for 3 minutes/speed setting 1/37 °C. Add the butter in chunks, egg, flour and ½ teaspoon of salt, and with the measuring beaker in place, knead with the knead button/2 minutes to make a smooth dough.
Put the yeast dough in a bowl, cover and allow to prove in a warm place for 30 minutes, until the volume has doubled.

TIPS The lower the yeast content and the longer the proving time, the better the taste and consistency of the baked goods will be. If there is enough time, you can use half the quantity of yeast with at least twice the proving time. Spicy yeast dough is suitable for bread, rolls, stick bread, lye pastry, 1 small pull-apart bread in a loaf tin 12 x 20 cm or 10 yeast buns.

ingredients.name: 110 ml milk at room temperature (UHT milk, 3.5% fat)
½ cube of fresh yeast (20 g) or 1 sachet of dried yeast (7 g)

steps.text: Pour 110 g milk at room temperature into the blender jug.
Add ½ tsp sugar.
Add ½ cube of fresh yeast (20 g) or 1 sachet of dried yeast (7 g).
Put 40 g butter in chunks into the blender jug.
Add 250 g flour.
Add 1 egg (small) and ½ tsp salt.
Put the yeast dough into a bowl, cover and leave to prove in a warm place for at least 30 minutes, until it has doubled in volume.

recipe.name: Vegetable stock concentrate (2 jars)
instructions: Clean the vegetables, peel if necessary, and wash, dry and coarsely chop them. Wash the herbs, dry and remove the leaves from the stalks. Peel the garlic clove.

Put the vegetables, herbs, garlic and dried tomatoes into the blender jug together with the oregano, marjoram and ½ teaspoon of ground pepper in the blender jug, and with the measuring beaker in place, chop finely for 20 seconds/speed setting 6. Use the spatula to scrape everything down the inside of the blender jug. Repeat this process if necessary.
Add the sea salt, 15 ml water at room temperature and olive oil and, the measuring beaker not inserted, boil for 20 minutes/speed setting 2/100 °C.
Then with the measuring beaker in place, mix finely for 1 minute/speed setting 10. Pour hot into sterile screw-top jars. Seal the jars and allow to cool.

TIPS
Add 1 to 2 tablespoons of stock concentrate to 500 ml hot water and dissolve like commercial stock.
If adults are eating without children, the water can be replaced with white wine.
If cooled well, the stock concentrate will keep for several months.

ingredients.name: 2 sprigs of fresh mixed herbs to taste

steps.text: Prepare 2 sterile screw-top jars (100 ml each).
Wash and dry 2 sprigs of fresh mixed herbs of your choice, then tear the leaves from their stems and put them into the blender jug.
Peel and halve 1 small onion (50 g), peel 1 garlic clove, then put both into the blender jug.
Put 50 g sundried tomatoes into the blender jug.
Trim, peel and wash 1 small carrot (50 g), cut into chunks and add to the blender jug.
Trim, peel and wash 1 stick of celery (50 g), cut into chunks and add to the blender jug.
Trim, peel and wash 1 piece of parsley root (50 g), cut into chunks and add to the jug.
Trim, peel and wash 1 piece of leek (50 g), cut it into chunks and add to the blender jug.
Add ½ tsp dried oregano, ½ tsp dried marjoram and ½ tsp ground pepper.
Use the spatula to scrape everything down the inside of the blender jug.
Carry out the next step if necessary; otherwise, skip it.
Add 15 g sea salt.
Add 15 g water at room temperature and 1 tbsp olive oil.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Pour hot into the sterile screw-top jars. Seal the jars and leave them to cool.

recipe.name: Pearl barley soup with mixed vegetables (serves 2)
instructions: Wash the parsley and shake it dry. Remove the leaves from the stalks and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop finely in the blender jug for 8 seconds/speed setting 6. If necessary, use the spatula to scrape the pieces down the inside of the blender jug and repeat the process. Put the parsley in another container.

Peel the carrot, parsley root, celeriac and potato, wash and cut into rough pieces of 3 cm. Thoroughly clean and wash the white part of the leek and also cut into rough pieces. With the measuring beaker in place, chop the vegetables in the blender jug for 9 seconds/speed setting 6. Use the spatula to scrape everything down the inside of the blender jug. Add the room-temperature chicken stock, 350 ml warm water and the pearl barley and, with the measuring beaker in place, cook with the reverse button/50 minutes/speed setting 1/95 °C. Season to taste with salt and pepper and, with the measuring beaker in place, stir in with the reverse button/10 seconds/speed setting 1.
Divide the soup between deep bowls and serve sprinkled with parsley.
TIP Wiener or smoked pork sausages make a good addition to the soup. Cut them into pieces and add through the filler opening in the lid 5 minutes before the cooking time is up.

ingredients.name: 200 ml chicken stock at room temperature

steps.text: Wash 4 sprigs of parsley and shake dry. Pluck the leaves from the stalks and place in the blender jug.
If necessary, use the spatula to scrape down the sides of the blender jug and repeat the process; otherwise, skip the next step.
Transfer the parsley to another container.
Peel 1 carrot (75 g), cut into rough pieces of 3 cm and add to the blender jug.
Peel ½ parsley root (40 g), cut into rough pieces of 3 cm and add to the blender jug.
Peel a piece of celeriac (75 g), cut into rough pieces of 3 cm and add to the blender jug.
Peel 1 small potato (75 g), cut into rough pieces of 3 cm and add to the blender jug.
Thoroughly wash the white part of a piece of leek (40 g), cut into rough pieces and add.
Use the spatula to scrape down the sides of the blender jug.
Add 200 g chicken stock (at room temperature) to the blender jug.
Add 350 g warm water.
Add 30 g pearl barley.
Season with salt and pepper.
Ladle the soup into deep bowls and serve sprinkled with the parsley.

recipe.name: Pearl barley soup with mixed vegetables (serves 6)
instructions: Wash the parsley and shake it dry. Remove the leaves from the stalks and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop finely in the blender jug for 8 seconds/speed setting 6. If necessary, use the spatula to scrape the pieces down the inside of the blender jug and repeat the process. Put the parsley in another container.

Peel the carrots, parsley root, celeriac and potatoes, wash and cut into rough pieces of 3 cm. Thoroughly clean and wash the white part of the leek and also cut into rough pieces. With the measuring beaker in place, chop the vegetables in the blender jug for 12 seconds/speed setting 6. Use the spatula to scrape everything down the inside of the blender jug. Add the room-temperature chicken stock, 1 litre of warm water and the pearl barley and, with the measuring beaker in place, cook with the reverse button/50 minutes/speed setting 1/95 °C. Season to taste with salt and pepper and, with the measuring beaker in place, stir in with the reverse button/10 seconds/speed setting 1.
Divide the soup between deep bowls and serve sprinkled with parsley.
TIP Wiener or smoked pork sausages make a good addition to the soup. Cut them into pieces and add through the filler opening in the lid 5 minutes before the cooking time is up.

ingredients.name: 600 ml chicken stock at room temperature

steps.text: Wash 1 bunch of parsley and shake dry. Pluck the leaves from the stalks and place in the blender jug.
If necessary, use the spatula to scrape down the sides of the blender jug and repeat the process; otherwise, skip the next step.
Transfer the parsley to another container.
Peel 3 carrots (220 g), cut into rough pieces of 3 cm and add to the blender jug.
Peel 1 parsley root (120 g), cut into rough pieces of 3 cm and add to the blender jug.
Peel a piece of celeriac (220 g), cut into rough pieces of 3 cm and add to the blender jug.
Peel 3 potatoes (230 g), cut into rough pieces of 3 cm and add to the blender jug.
Thoroughly wash the white part of 1 leek (120 g), cut into rough pieces and add.
Use the spatula to scrape down the sides of the blender jug.
Add 600 g chicken stock (at room temperature) to the blender jug.
Add 1000 g warm water.
Add 90 g pearl barley.
Season with salt and pepper.
Ladle the soup into deep bowls and serve sprinkled with the parsley.

recipe.name: Beef stock concentrate (2 jars)
instructions: Dice the meat (3 cm squares), put in freezer for 20 minutes and then chop in the blender jug with the measuring beaker in place, for 20 seconds/speed setting 8. Put in another container.

Wash, dry and coarsely chop the vegetables. Remove the leaves of the herbs from the stalks. Peel the garlic cloves. Put the vegetables, herbs, garlic cloves and dried tomatoes with thyme and 1 pinch of ground pepper into the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop finely for 20 seconds/speed setting 6, using the spatula to help. Then, use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug. Repeat this process if necessary.
Add the sea salt, 10 ml water at room temperature and olive oil and, the measuring beaker not inserted, boil everything for 25 minutes/speed setting 2/100 °C.
Then with the measuring beaker in place, mix finely for 1 minute/speed setting 10. Pour hot into sterile screw-top jars. Seal the jars and allow to cool.

TIPS Add 1 to 2 tablespoons of stock concentrate to 500 ml hot water and dissolve like commercial stock. If adults are eating without children, the water can be replaced with dry red wine. If cooled well, the stock concentrate will keep for several months.

ingredients.name: 1 sprig of fresh mixed herbs to taste

steps.text: Sterilise 2 screw-top jars (approx. 100 ml each).
Weigh out 60 g lean beef (no bones or fat).
Dice the meat (3 cm squares) and chill in the freezer for 20 minutes.
Put the beef into the blender jug.
Transfer the chopped meat to a bowl.
Peel 1 shallot (20 g) and 1 garlic clove, halve the shallot and put both into the blender jug.
Add 20 g sundried tomatoes.
Trim, peel and wash 1 carrot (30 g), cut it into chunks and add to the blender jug.
Trim, peel and wash 1 piece of celery (20 g), slice it roughly and add to the blender jug.
Weigh out a 20 g piece of parsley root, trim, peel, wash, roughly chop and add to the jug.
Clean, peel, wash and roughly chop a piece of leek (20 g), then add it to the blender jug.
Wash and dry 1 sprig of mixed fresh herbs of your choice, tear the leaves from the stalks, and add them to the blender jug.
Add ¼ tsp dried thyme and 1 pinch of ground pepper.
Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug.
If necessary, follow the next step; otherwise skip it.
Add 5 g sea salt.
Add 10 g water at room temperature, 1 tsp olive oil and the meat.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Insert the measuring beaker into the lid.
Pour hot into the sterile screw-top jars. Seal the jars and leave them to cool. Store in a cool place.

recipe.name: Chicken stock concentrate (2 jars)
instructions: Dice the meat (3 cm squares), put in the freezer for 20 minutes and then chop in the blender jug with the measuring beaker in place for 25 seconds/speed setting 8. Put in another container.

Clean the vegetables, peel if necessary, and wash, dry and coarsely chop them. Wash the herbs, dry and remove the leaves from the stalks. Put the vegetables and herbs into the blender jug together with the marjoram and the white pepper, and with the measuring beaker in place, chop finely for 10 seconds/speed setting 6. Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug. Repeat this process if necessary.

Add the sea salt, 15 ml water at room temperature, the sunflower oil and the chicken and cook everything, the measuring beaker not inserted, for 25 minutes/speed setting 2/100 °C. Then with the measuring beaker in place, blend for 1 minute/speed setting 10. Pour hot into sterile screw-top jars. Seal the jars and allow to cool. Store in a cool place.
TIPS Add 1 to 2 tablespoons of stock concentrate to 500 ml hot water and dissolve like commercial stock. If cooled well, the chicken stock concentrate will keep for several months.

ingredients.name: 2 sprigs of fresh mixed herbs to taste

steps.text: Sterilise 2 screw-top jars (100 ml each).
Weigh out 135 g skinless chicken.
Cut into cubes (3 cm squares) and chill in the freezer for 20 minutes.
Put the cubed chicken into the blender jug.
Transfer the chopped meat to a bowl.
Peel and halve 1 small onion (35 g) and put it into the blender jug.
Trim, peel and wash 1 small carrot (35 g), cut into chunks and add to the blender jug.
Clean, peel and wash 1 stick of celery (35 g), roughly chop it and add it to the blender jug.
Trim, peel and wash 1 piece of parsley root (35 g), cut into chunks and add to the jug.
Trim, peel and wash 1 piece of leek (35 g), roughly chop it and add it to the blender jug.
Wash and dry 2 sprigs of mixed fresh herbs of your choice, tear the leaves from their stalks and add to the blender jug.
Add ½ tsp dried marjoram and ¼ tsp white pepper.
Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug.
If necessary, follow the next step; otherwise skip it.
Remove the measuring beaker from the lid.
Add 10 g sea salt.
Add 15 g water.
Add 1 tbsp sunflower oil and the chopped meat.
Put the lid on the blender jug.
Pour hot into the sterile screw-top jars. Seal the jars and leave them to cool. Store in a cool place.

recipe.name: Quark puffs
instructions: Mix the flour with the baking powder and sieve it into the blender jug. Add 200 g sugar, the vanilla sugar and a pinch of salt, and, with the measuring beaker in place, process for 10 seconds/speed setting 5. Place the quark and eggs in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix for 1 minute/speed setting 4.

Put the remaining sugar into a deep-sided dish. Put the oil in a small, high-sided pot and heat it to 170°C. (It has reached the right temperature when bubbles form around the end of a wooden spoon dipped into the oil and rise to the top.) Using 2 teaspoons, take out little portions of the mixture and carefully lower them into the hot oil. Deep-fry the quark puffs until golden all over. Remove them with a slotted spoon and leave to drain on kitchen paper. While the puffs are still warm, roll them in the sugar and serve straight away, or put them on a wire rack to cool down completely.

TIPS
Mix ¼ teaspoon of cinnamon into the sugar in a deep-sided dish and coat the quark puffs in it. 
They taste great warm or cold.

recipe.name: Frixuelos (Spanish crêpes)
instructions: Put all of the ingredients in the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, process for 30 seconds/speed setting 7.

Add a ladleful of the batter to a hot pan with a little olive oil and fry on both sides to make a very thin crêpe. Remove from the frying pan and repeat the process until you have used all the batter.
Dust with icing sugar or caster sugar and serve drizzled with honey.

TIP
If children are going to be eating the crêpes, too, simply leave out the alcohol.

ingredients.name: 500 ml milk at room temperature (fresh whole milk, 3.5% fat)
grated zest of 1 untreated lemon (80 g)
icing sugar or caster sugar for dusting

recipe.name: Frikadellen (German meat patties)
instructions: Soak the bread roll in lukewarm water in a covered bowl.

Meanwhile, peel and halve the onions and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop them finely in the blender jug with the turbo button/2 seconds. Use the spatula to scrape the pieces down the inside of the blender jug and then repeat the process if necessary. Use the spatula to scrape the pieces down the inside of the blender jug.

Squeeze the bread out thoroughly and add it to the blender jug with the rest of the Frikadellen ingredients. With the measuring beaker in place, process everything for 45 seconds/speed setting 3. Decant the minced meat mixture and, with moist hands, shape it into 10 patties.
Heat a little oil in a frying pan and fry the Frikadellen on both sides until done.

TIPS
Creamed kohlrabi, potato salad and cucumber salad all go with the Frikadellen. 
If you don’t have a day-old bread roll to hand, you can use 3 tablespoons of breadcrumbs instead. Simply put them in the blender jug with the rest of the Frikadellen ingredients, add 1–2 tablespoons of water to the blender jug and continue with the recipe as described.

ingredients.name: 500 g mixed beef and pork mince

recipe.name: Breadcrumbs
instructions: Cut the bread into 3-cm cubes, put them into the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 20 seconds/speed setting 8. Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug and repeat the process if required.
Decant the breadcrumbs into a jar and store in a dry place.
If you're not going to be using the breadcrumbs immediately, put them on a baking tray and leave them to dry at room temperature for another 24 hours before putting them into their storage container.

TIPS
You can use the breadcrumbs as a coating for fish, meat or vegetables. To do this, season the fish, meat or veg in the usual way, then coat them first in some beaten egg and then in the breadcrumbs. Press in the breadcrumbs lightly and fry the coated item in hot fat in a pan. 
You can also add your favourite flavours to your breadcrumbs, for instance by putting some cheese or fresh herbs in with the cubed bread. 
The breadcrumbs shouldn’t have a powdery consistency, but should retain some texture.

ingredients.name: 100 g dry bread roll or day-old bread

recipe.name: Carbonara sauce
