instructions: Cut the pecorino into pieces, put it into the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop finely for 20 seconds/speed setting 10. Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.

Add the egg and the egg yolks to the pecorino in the blender jug, add 2 big pinches of pepper and, with the measuring beaker in place, process everything for 20 seconds/speed setting 5 to form an even-textured mixture. Transfer the mixture to another bowl and clean out the blender jug.

Cut the bacon into 0.5-cm pieces or 0.5-cm-wide strips, put them in the blender jug and, the measuring beaker not inserted, fry with the roast button until slightly crisp. Transfer the bacon to kitchen paper and leave to cool for 10 minutes.
Add the bacon to the bowl with the egg mixture and mix together. Use the carbonara sauce straight away, e.g. by pouring it over hot drained pasta.

INFO
Carbonara sauce is usually added to spaghetti that has been freshly cooked and drained. Mix everything together quickly and serve immediately, with Pecorino and pepper scattered over the top, if you like. 
This carbonara sauce also tastes great with freshly cooked courgetti. 
Made the traditional Italian way, it does not contain any cream whatsoever.

recipe.name: Bolognese sauce
instructions: Remove the rind from the Parmesan, cut the cheese into 2-cm chunks, put it into the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop finely with the turbo button/10 seconds. Decant into another container and rinse out the blender jug.

Peel the onions and garlic cloves and cut the onions into half. Wash, peel and halve the carrots. Wash and trim the celery and cut into 4-cm pieces. Put the vegetables into the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 10 seconds/speed setting 5. Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for another 7 seconds/speed setting 5.
Use the spatula to scrape the mixture down the inside of the blender jug again, then add 1 tablespoon of olive oil and, the measuring beaker not inserted, sauté with the roast button/4 minutes.
Add 400 g minced meat and, the measuring beaker not inserted, brown it with the roast button. Decant the contents of the blender jug and put aside. Clean out the blender jug.

Cut the bacon into large chunks, put into the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, chop for 8 seconds/speed setting 9. Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug, add 1 tablespoon olive oil, and, the measuring beaker not inserted, sauté with the roast button/5 minutes.

Add the rest of the minced meat and, the measuring beaker not inserted, brown it with the roast button. Pour in 200 ml warm stock and, the measuring beaker not inserted, boil down with the roast button/10 minutes.

Put the sugar, tomato purée, vegetable and minced meat mixture, chopped tomatoes and the rest of the warm stock into the blender jug, season with paprika, cinnamon, ¼ teaspoon of the pepper, and the teaspoon of thyme, and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix everything with the reverse button/30 seconds/speed setting 2. The measuring beaker not inserted, simmer with the reverse button/45 minutes/95°C/speed setting 1.
Season with salt and ½ teaspoon of pepper and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix in with the reverse button/20 seconds/speed setting 2.

TIPS
If no children are eating with you, replace 200 ml of the stock with dry white wine. 
Bolognese sauce is typically served with fresh pasta or in a lasagne (search for a lasagne recipe from our database). It also makes a great pizza topping or can be served with roasted Hokkaido pumpkin, as a filling for courgettes or roasted peppers, as an accompaniment to cauliflower and broccoli, or in a potato gratin.

ingredients.name: 800 g mixed beef and pork mince
600 ml warm vegetable or beef stock

recipe.name: Quattro formaggi cheese sauce
instructions: Remove the rind from the provolone and Parmesan, cut into 3-cm chunks and put into the blender jug. With the measuring beaker in place, chop for 8 seconds/speed setting 8. Use the spatula to scrape down the inside of the blender jug.

Remove the rind from the Taleggio and Gorgonzola and cut it into 3-cm chunks. Put both in the blender jug, pour in the room-temperature vegetable stock and, with the measuring beaker in place, melt the cheese for 10 minutes/80°C/speed setting 2.

Add 2 pinches of pepper and the room-temperature cream, and, with the measuring beaker in place, process for 10 seconds/speed setting 5. With the measuring beaker in place, warm the cheese sauce through for another 5 minutes/90°C/speed setting 3.

TIPS
If you’d like a creamier, heartier version, replace the Gorgonzola with Mascarpone (80% fat). 
If you’d prefer the sauce to be runnier, simply add a shot of milk (fresh, 3.5% fat) at room temperature during the final step. 
This cheese sauce goes well with freshly cooked pasta, gnocchi and spinach balls (you can find the recipe in our database).

ingredients.name: 100 ml vegetable stock at room temperature
100 ml cream at room temperature (30% fat)

recipe.name: Schupfnudeln (potato dumpling fingers)
instructions: Put 500 ml cold water into the blender jug. Peel, wash and halve the potatoes, put them into the cooking pot, attach this to the blender jug and, with the measuring beaker in place, steam with the steamer button/15 minutes.
Take out the cooking pot, tip the water out of the blender jug, put the potatoes into the blender jug and leave to cool a little for 10 minutes.

Add the flour, cornflour, egg yolk, 1 teaspoon of salt and 1 big pinch of nutmeg, and, with the measuring beaker in place, mix with the knead button. Decant the mixture into a bowl and leave to stand for 10 minutes. Clean out the blender jug.

Using a teaspoon, spoon walnut-sized pieces out of the dumpling dough and roll them out on a floured surface. Ensure that the potato dumpling fingers are slightly fatter in the middle and thinner at the ends.

Arrange the dumplings in the deep steamer basket and shallow steamer basket. Put 1 litre of water at room temperature in the blender jug, insert the deep steamer basket with the shallow steamer basket inserted, put the lid on, and cook the finger dumplings with the steamer button.
Heat the butter and vegetable oil in a pan, then fry the dumpling fingers until golden brown.

TIP
These potato dumplings are especially good with mushroom ragout.

recipe.name: Polenta
instructions: Put 1.5 litres of lukewarm water, 1 level teaspoon salt of and the olive oil in the blender jug, sprinkle in the polenta and, with the measuring beaker in place, cook for 10 minutes/90°C/speed setting 2. Then, with the measuring beaker in place, cook for another 10 minutes/90°C/speed setting 3.

Leave the polenta to stand in the blender jug for 10 minutes. Meanwhile, pre-heat the oven to 200°C. Spread out the mixture evenly on a baking tray lined with greaseproof paper and bake it in the hot oven for 20 minutes.
Take the polenta out of the oven, leave it to cool down briefly, then cut it into pieces and serve.

TIPS
If you like, with the measuring beaker in place, stir 1 tablespoon of freshly chopped herbs into the polenta after the cooking time is up for 30 seconds/speed setting 3. 
Pan-frying the polenta in butter before serving makes it even more delicious. 
Polenta goes well with Hungarian vegetable stew and lentil casseroles, but also makes a great snack as part of a party buffet. Cut the polenta into bite-size pieces, pan-fry in butter, leave to cool and serve with a dollop of herb-flavoured cream cheese and scattered with some spring onion rings or radish slices.
